Title: Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Your tasks

InstaFreight is looking for a Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d) to join our Team Data. As such, you will be the senior leadership's main partner to explore our data orbit for strategic insights and develop tool prototypes. As a Data Strategy Analyst (m/f/d) you will be a key agent in analyzing complex business problems and issues using data from internal and external sources to provide data-driven solutions, and ensuring analytics are valid, meaningful, and provide actionable and comprehensive insights. For example, you may be asked to build a more precise model to predict our truck sourcing cost for the months ahead. Or the leadership may be interested in exploring the commercial potential of new Sales channels (e.g. automatically bidding on requests for shipping).

In this role you will:

Conduct project-driven work in close collaboration with your team lead and the senior leadership
Derive key strategic insights from our data (‘one-off analyses’) and summarize them in crisp communication materials to trigger new initiatives
Develop data-driven tool prototypes to further improve the efficiency and quality of our internal processes
Take full ownership of your projects incl. stakeholder management and communication of updates / results (e.g. jour fixes, final presentations)
Champion best practices and data literacy across the organization
Come up with new project opportunities for yourself and pitch them


Your Profile

You have at least three years of working experience in problem solving, strategy development and communication to senior level (e.g. strategy development department, management consulting)
You have strong skills in quantitative exploration and analysis
You have distinct business intuition and ability to understand complex business system
You have a master's degree in a quantitative subject (e.g. engineering, finance) with strong grades
Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments, solving critical-to-operations issues
A passion and curiosity for data, systems and data driven decision making


Good to have:

Python and SQL skills
Industry expertise in road transportation / logistics


What We Offer

__Take the driver seat

Take charge - Be accountable for your own field of responsibility from day one onwards.
Have impact - Drive development projects and steer the course of the company.
Make mistakes - Take risks, learn from failures and grow personally with us.


Hit the gas pedal

Learn as you go - Be supported in a great learning environment with training, mentoring and feedback.
Accelerate - Go out of your comfort zone and climb your personal growth ladder step by step.
Outgrow yourself - Unlock your full potential and accomplish things you hardly dare to dream of.


Enjoy the ride

Be part of the team - Join a great group of individuals standing behind a common goal.
Have fun - Take part in our legendary parties, company events or just the regular office craziness.
Write history - Shape the future of an entire industry together with us.__

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Team

The Data Analytics team brings together the theory and practice to identify and communicate data-driven insights that allow stakeholders and other executives at Raisin to make more informed decisions. Team’s responsibilities include reporting (define and set-up consistent business KPIs), deep-dive analysis and predictive analytics amongst many. In summary, team is responsible for:

Providing and maintaining Looker as a platform
Providing analytics as a service


We are looking for a Data Analyst who is deeply passionate about data driven decisions, transforming raw data into clear actionable business insights and who is constantly driving themselves and the team towards meeting the next challenge.

Your Responsibilities

Following the end-to-end analytical cycle of defining the problem to data preparation to data analysis to quality check measures to results presentation to measuring success/ results.
Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of customers to address strategic and operational business questions.
Provide actionable recommendations and conclusions from data to shape features, economies and possible future product/ CRM/ Marketing, etc. roadmaps. Deriving value by identifying key business findings and insights through analysis or reporting.
Analyzing and assisting senior analysts with value-adding projects where effective data analysis is central. Assisting co-workers in analytical tasks and helping to explain the structure of the data.
Supporting business stakeholders with ad-hoc questions on internal performance, external partner/business development efforts.
Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics customer’s experience - key for teams to make informed quantitative decisions.
Looker specific: Defining new tables in LookML along with measures and dimensions. Maintaining quality of code in LookML by performing regular clean-ups of unused views and explores.


Your Profile

Bachelors or master’s in Economics, Statistics, Finance (mathematics focus), Mathematics, Business - Any other relevant quantitative fields.
Work experience in data analysis (descriptive/ reporting, inquisitive or predictive analytics) and/ or BI.
Strong SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets: Snowflake preferred. Experience in working with version controls like Git
High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details.
Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations.
Basic experience in analytical tools and technologies such as R, Python.
Experience in reporting and data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI.
Experience in solving data science related problems or building and applying machine learning algorithms: advantage.
Good communication and organizational skills.
Eagerness and hunger to learn and grow.


Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us!

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which, connects more than 40 different nationalities.

You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities.

As part of our team, you will benefit from:

Personal training budget of 1,700 € and four full training days per year.

Free choice of hardware.

Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office.

Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days.

Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than €20 per month.

A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%.

Enjoy yearly company retreats to exciting European cities and other team events, such as Lunch & Learn, Tech Lunch, Female Empowerment Forum, CEO Talks as well as our yearly Summer- and Christmas Party.

Do you miss being in the office? The corporate ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with €25 per month (BVG Firmenticket for Berlin and HVV ProfiTicket for HH).

You are moving from another country or city to join us? We will support your relocation.

  • Providing and maintaining Looker as a platform

Title: Data Analyst, Business and Product Analytics
Description:
Smartly.io is looking for a customer success and product analytics focused Data Analyst to join our Analytics and Business Intelligence team! Our centralized analytics team works with different parts of the organization, spanning from Product Management and Design to Customer Success, Marketing and Financial Planning and Analysis.




You will work with different types of data, ranging from sales and revenue data to in-app user interactions. Our goal is to develop a unified view of crucial business and product metrics, such as engagement, revenue development, and key action monitoring. We operate in a rapidly evolving business environment, working with the world's most advanced advertisers. This means that our business is constantly changing and we need reliable ways to estimate where we are and where we are going in terms of our customer metrics.




You will work as a part of a wider analytics and business intelligence team that automates operations by creating internal BI tools, dashboards and internal data warehouses. Your primary stakeholders will be our Customer Success and Product Management organizatios.




As a Data Analyst at Smartly.io, you will:




Work closely with our Customer Success Operations, Product Management and Product Design teams to build and optimize our customer experience with data.
Build, develop and maintain reporting of key product adoption metrics
Develop an understanding of our product data and help develop our tracking of key features.
Have end-to-end ownership of data: define data requirements and dive deep into data sets to provide actionable insights.
Develop an in-depth understanding of what drives our customer and product success
Be an important part of our higher level data driven decision making process as well as day-to-day business operations





What we are looking for:




Skills in writing complex analytical SQL queries (we use Snowflake and PostgreSQL as our warehouses)
Proficiency in one or more BI and visualization tools like Looker, Periscope, Tableau or Power BI (we use Tableau and Redash at Smartly.io)
Strong communication and presentation skills, you can turn data into stories and actionable insights
Experience with business & product analytics or a strong interest in the field
Basic understanding of data warehousing
Basic knowledge of typical key business KPIs for SaaS companies
Basic understanding of financial processes, including forecasting, target setting, and budgeting





Meet Smartly.io




Smartly.io combines the power of media automation, creative agility, and advertising intelligence in a next generation digital advertising platform.




We serve marketers across the largest media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Snap, Pinterest, TikTok, and Google. We manage about $4B in ad spend and help 700+ brands worldwide, including eBay, Uber, and TechStyle. Our technology and outstanding customer service help brands to reach and engage their audiences, and scale their results.




We offer growth-minded people opportunities to make an impact in a fast-paced, collaborative and inclusive environment built on a culture of trust, transparency, and feedback. You’ll work with a team of 650+ Smartlies, representing 60+ nationalities. We operate in 13 countries across 24 locations.




At Smartly.io, you can enjoy the freedom to harmonize work and personal life. On top of flexible hours, we offer a hybrid workplace where Smartlies can choose to work at the office, from home, or a bit of both. As a global, hybrid organization, we are mindful to collaborate in ways that allow everyone, everywhere to be productive and feel included.




Join our global team to reshape the future of digital marketing!




Learn more at smartly.io/careers and smartly.io/careers/life-at-smartly.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing & Communications
Description:
As stewards of the Polkadot and Substrate ecosystem, Parity is laying the foundation for a better web which respects the freedom and data of individuals and empowers developers to create better services through decentralised technology. The internet is too important to billions of people for it to be at the mercy of a few powerful companies.

Like Polkadot, Parity was built on a foundation of being decentralised and open, which trickles down to how we work. We're a distributed organisation and have been from the beginning. Being distributed isn't just a way of doing business—it's a mentality that is at the core of our culture. We have a flat structure that pushes power to the edges and empowers our people to take ownership of their role, authority coupled with responsibilities.

As the Polkadot ecosystem grows, so does the data associated with it. We are looking for a data analytics professional to perform analytics on all our marketing activities, drive the definition of metrics and implement reporting structures within the Marketing & Communications (Marcomms) department at Parity Technologies.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about marketing, Web3 and open source blockchain development to spearhead some cutting edge analytics within the Blockchain industry. Also the ability to play a pivotal role in the formation of the data platform and culture at a rapidly growing open-source technology startup.

Key Responsibilities

Lead metric definition and measurement for the department, including supporting the KPI and OKR framework and processes
Work directly with a variety of stakeholders and multiple data sets to derive sophisticated data solutions and dashboards
Create and maintain dashboards to visualize the performance (ROI, attribution etc) of different marketing activities (social media, paid advertising, website traffic, CRM, organic content etc.)
Support the mapping of existing business processes into reporting structures.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) on marketing data and open-source blockchain development data within and outside the ecosystem.
Coordinate with the data engineering team to turn the results of this EDA into user-friendly, consumable and automated dashboards.
Coordinate with other departments within Parity to help ensure organizational-wide visibility of Ecosystem Development data.


Qualification and Skills

3+ years of work experience in data analytics.
Strong proficiency in Python,SQL and dashboarding tools.
Experience defining metrics, implementing reporting structures, building and automating dashboards.
Professional experience with marketing data (paid ads, website traffic, CRM etc.) workflows and activities
Knowledge and practical application of statistical techniques in a professional setting.
Familiarity with connecting and harnessing data from a number of different sources.
Ability to work autonomously, be proactive, prioritise, communicate, and function in a small team.
Strong program management skills and able to address multiple projects in parallel managing competing interests and aligning various parties on a common goal.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


Nice-to-haves

Understanding of blockchain technologies and ecosystems.
Experience with GCP.
Knowledge of GDPR.


Benefits

Working at Parity means focusing on the stuff that counts: building the most cutting-edge technology for the future web. Our teams enjoy a high degree of trust, freedom and autonomy to achieve that goal.
You will gain a keen understanding of blockchain technology and business development and have a skill set transferable to many jobs.
Because we value initiative and learning, we've defined a generous personal budget to attend conferences or skills courses of your choosing. We think you know what's best for you!
Parity is a diverse company with people from various countries, and we will support you with German or English language courses where needed.
Not all of us who collaborate work in the same place. Bringing the team together is something we value a lot, so we regularly go on team retreats.


To see how we use your data, please see our Applicant Notice: https://www.parity.io/applicant-notice/

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for your next challenge? Do you want a job that’s exciting with a team that loves what they do? Then we may have just the thing...

At Doodle, we’re the kind of people who wake up every morning passionate about what we do. That’s what we’re looking for in our new Doodlers. You’ll be brimming with new ideas, driven by curiosity and don’t flinch at the thought of experimenting - even if the test fails. You’re someone who challenges the status quo and enjoys pushing yourself and others to reimagine, optimize and innovate.




Who Are We?

Doodle is the world’s leading scheduling platform, helping millions of people instantly set meetings with clients, colleagues and teams. Tapping into the unique nature of smart scheduling with AI, Doodle simplifies the planning of 1:1 and group meetings for busy professionals. As the world's most trusted online scheduling platform, Doodle attracts more than 25 million monthly active users.

Now’s your chance to join 100+ ambitious engineers, designers, product managers, marketers and salespeople on a mission to make great meetings happen. Be a part of a global team headquartered in Zurich, with offices in Atlanta, Belgrade and Berlin.




Who we're looking for

Doodle is looking for an experienced (Senior) Data Analyst who can gather data, understand problems, and makes recommendations based on Doodle's data, stakeholder input and company goals.




Ideally, You Have

3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role, ideally in SaaS
Excellent SQL skills and experience in data visualisation and Power BI. Python experience is a plus
Experience working with DBT is a must
Knowledge of database modelling, version control, testing and continuous integration
Experience with Google Analytics or other event tracking platforms. We use Google Analytics and Avo
Incredible communication skills and a customer-centric mentality
Self-starter, high energy, adaptable, inquisitive and excited to work in a startup environment
Ability to work independently, be proactive and think holistically
Fluency in English




What the role involves

Play a leading role in making Doodle data-driven
Collaborate across teams to define key metrics, develop dashboards, track metric progress, investigate changes in metrics, and propose next steps
Exemplify best practices for data management
Use data analysis to proactively address company and product problems and solutions with sometimes broad scopes and minimal specifications - the ability to drill down to the essential analytics insights is important
Fulfil requests for data and analysis coming from other teams while guiding them on which data to use and how to interpret it, automating solutions to be self service were possible.
Provide clear and concise views into company and product data that enable everyone at Doodle to understand the data
Provide data-supported recommendations for company and product strategy
Help define success metrics and oversee product and marketing experiments




What’s Awesome About Working at Doodle?

Top talent deserves a competitive salary.
We’re a team that cares about each other. We think we work best when we work together, so you’ll always feel included.
Diversity is what makes us successful. We all have different strengths and push each other to try new things, innovate and deliver impactful results for the business.
Your personal development matters and we mean it. Every Doodler gets a yearly budget to use for anything that promotes your continuous learning (be it an industry conference, language classes, leadership training, or anything else).
Your well-being matters to us. Access thousands of beneficial meditation tools with your free Headspace account.
Get together with the entire team of Doodlers (from all offices) to connect, bond, play games and unwind at the annual international retreat.
Travel to and spend time with other Doodlers in some of our lovely offices worldwide.
Take advantage of our remote friendly policy.
Enjoy complimentary Doodle Premium memberships for you, your friends and your family.
Free snacks and fruit in all our office locations.







Hiring Journey

Applicant initial validation
BRYQ assessment
Cultural Fit Interview
Coding Challenge
Meet the team
Offer




So, Get in Touch!

At Doodle, we’re committed to providing an environment of mutual trust and respect, where equal employment opportunities (EEO) are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to age, race, color, disability, religion, gender and sexual orientation. Diversity and inclusion are of utmost importance to us. We’re committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work and our products will be. We want to hear from you, so please don’t hesitate to apply!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst




Are you a Data Analyst looking for your next challenge?




We are currently seeking a Senior Data Analyst in Germany to join a Berlin-based insuretech company that provides a diverse platform to insurance brokers, insurers and consumers.




You will be responsible for the development of the cloud infrastructure, data analysis, operating and monitoring existing analyses, and providing new analyses and data sources. In this role, you will coordinate with management and departments to analyze internal/external data and implement solutions with the support of the IT team.




Key requirements:




2-3 years of professional experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Strong analytical skills
Expertise in BI tools such as Power BI.
Proficient in SQL (MySQL or T-SQL) and knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R.
Basic understanding of data modeling techniques and prior experience working with databases.
Relevant experience in the insurance or financial sector is a plus.
Familiarity with agile project management.
Fluent in both German and English.




On offer is an attractive compensation package including benefits, a stimulating work environment with opportunities for creativity and professional growth, flat hierarchies and fast decision-making processes and a friendly and dedicated team.




If this sparks your interest, get in touch with GR4!




We’re a forward-thinking, data-driven hive of experts who utilise analytics, research and innovative sourcing strategies to put Europe's finest tech talent at your fingertips. We handle all your organisation’s recruitment needs, from discovery to onboarding, leaving your team free to do what they do best – drive innovation and push boundaries. We know one size doesn’t fit all.




That’s why we offer a range of bespoke solutions tailored to fit your company’s requirements.

  • Familiarity with agile project management.
  • Fluent in both German and English.


On offer is an attractive compensation package including benefits, a stimulating work environment with opportunities for creativity and professional growth, flat hierarchies and fast decision-making processes and a friendly and dedicated team.


If this sparks your interest, get in touch with GR4!


We’re a forward-thinking, data-driven hive of experts who utilise analytics, research and innovative sourcing strategies to put Europe's finest tech talent at your fingertips. We handle all your organisation’s recruitment needs, from discovery to onboarding, leaving your team free to do what they do best – drive innovation and push boundaries. We know one size doesn’t fit all.


That’s why we offer a range of bespoke solutions tailored to fit your company’s requirements.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
What To Expect

We are looking for a (Senior) Data Analyst (all genders) passionate about improving patient care with data. You will work closely with our stakeholders (sales, product, marketing, operations) within the Data Analytics Department at Caspar Health. Your work will contribute to one of the most transformative shifts emerging in healthcare.

Your Challenges

You will be conceptualizing and evaluating new data architectures, structures, fields and their relationships for (complex) analysis.
You will be building data sources for use in data visualization and business critical processes
You will be communicating with key stakeholders to develop dashboards and analyses that can be used to make business-critical decisions.
You will be providing quality assurance of data, working with various departments to ensure accuracy and consistency.


Your profile

You bring at least 2+ years experience as a Data Analyst / Data Engineer / Analytics Engineer or in a related role
You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, natural science, physics or in a related field
Your are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver
You are self driven and take ownership of your tasks
You can work independently as well as in a team
You are a motivated and fast learner
You have strong communication skills in both English and German


You have profound knowledge of and practical experience in:

Data querying and transformation - SQL
Data visualisation - Tableau


Ideally, you could also already gain experience with:

Python
Git
dbt
Snowflake


Why Caspar Health?

Looking for commitment? Perfect match! We offer a permanent employment contract.
You don't want to just be a number? Understandable. With us, the human-being is the focus. We currently have initiatives on diversity and inclusion as well as a common reflection room on our work culture in which every Casparian* can participate and thus actively contribute to your working environment and Caspar’s development.
You appreciate feedback? We're happy to hear it. We encourage an open feedback culture to learn and grow together.
You value a good work-life balance? So do we, and that's why we offer flexible working hours, mobile working and various models for part-time work.
You want to develop yourself continuously? We support this with an individual annual training budget for all Casparians*.
You value your health? So do we! We offer a generous remote policy to protect you according to your health needs during the pandemic. Plus, as a Casparian*, you can take advantage of our health app with mental health-, exercise -, and nutrition modules for free.
Of course, we also offer fresh fruit and a variety of healthy snacks and drinks in the office.


Diversity and Inclusion:

At Caspar Health, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all Casparians* regardless of ethnic origin, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations of any kind, physical appearance, social background, age or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we purely focus on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (picture, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc). We value and treat all applications equally.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

Title: Data Analyst/Manager - Last Mile Planning (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description




We are Flink - your online supermarket revolutionizing the way you do your grocery shopping. With a wide selection of over 2,400 high-quality products, we aim to deliver to your door in minutes. We put our customers first and ensure all products delivered are fresh and nutritious. Additionally, we can customize our national assortment to be able to offer you unique local products in every city. Our delivery hubs are located in densely populated inner-city locations and we strive to be sustainable by delivering on electric bikes and using packaging that can be recycled.




In your role as Planning Manager, you will be responsible for our fleet shift planning and scheduling optimization initiatives, ensuring rider supply meets demand as efficiently as possible - which will be a key driver for unit economics and sustainable growth.




Job Description




You will oversee our set of workforce management solutions, including our scheduling tool as well as internally developed data products, such as our Forecasting and Scheduling Optimization models. In this effort, you will be the main point of contact between Ops and Data Science teams
You will conceptualize and coordinate the implementation of a variety of workforce management initiatives, whether they are related to Product, reporting or process changes
You will empower local operations teams with reports, dashboards and ad-hoc analysis
You will conduct regular performance reviews with local operations teams, understand issues and concerns regarding suggested/actual scheduling, and align together on action plans




Qualifications




Bachelor or Masters degree in Mathematics, Statistics, IT, Finance or similar area
You have at least 2 years of work experience in a quantitative field - e.g. consulting, operations (capacity planning experience is a plus)
Very good working knowledge of SQL
Previous experience working with R, or Python and common data libraries
Experience with Python, unstructured data, machine learning techniques are advantageous
Good knowledge of MS Office, specially Excel




Additional Information




A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with RYDES, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance




We pride ourselves in being an inclusive and equal opportunities employer with a diverse and multicultural team. It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion

Title: Data Analyst / Data Product Manager
HTML:
Data Analyst / Data Product Manager (m/w/d)

Lot Internet GmbH – 14473 Potsdam

 

Lust „Big Data“ mit Leben zu füllen? Den Umgang mit großen Datenmengen zu revolutionieren? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Gegründet 2011 mit Firmensitz in Potsdam hat sich die Lot Internet GmbH auf das Erfassen und Analysieren strukturierter Daten aus dem Internet spezialisiert.

Als Data Analyst / Data Product Manager liegt Dein Schwerpunkt in der Nutzbarmachung von heterogenen Online-Datenquellen durch die Entwicklung von effizienten Daten-Services. Du berätst und unterstützt unsere Kunden bei der digitalen Transformation und hilfst diesen, durch Daten einen echten Mehrwert zu generieren.

Ziel ist die Erkennung von Zusammenhängen und Mustern in den Datenwelten, sowie die Schaffung von Transparenz im Marktgeschehen. Der Branchenschwerpunkt liegt dabei im Bereich Automotiv, wo große Konzerne unsere Kunden sind.


Deine Aufgaben

●     Erstellung von ganzheitlichen Analysen, basierend auf Datenbankabfragen;

●     Interpretation und Bewertung von Datenanalysen und Kennzahlen;

●     Konzeption von Online-Applikationen zur Datenanalyse;

●     Verantwortlich für die Datenqualitätssicherung, u.a. durch fortlaufende Optimierung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen;

●     Strategische Beratung unserer Kunden bei Big Data-Analysen;

●     Fachlicher Key Account Manager;

●     Produkt- und Projektmanagement bei unseren Daten-Services;

●     Steuerung von Entwicklern zur Datenerfassung und -aufbereitung;

●     Unterstützung des Managements im Bereich Business Development.

 

Dein Profil

●     Abgeschlossenes Studium der Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einschlägige Berufserfahrung;

●     Strukturiertes, reflektiertes und analytisches Denken

●     Sicherer Umgang mit Methoden zur Analyse und zur Aufbereitung von Daten;

●     Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL);

●     Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement, idealerweise auch im Produktmanagement;

●     Sicheres und kompetentes Auftreten bei unseren Kunden;

●     Sehr gute Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch;

●     Zielorientierte, sorgfältige und eigenständige Arbeitsweise.

 

Wir bieten

●     Eine umfassende und praxisorientierte Einarbeitung;

●     Ein familienfreundliches Unternehmen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und drei Tage Home-Office;

●     Flache Hierarchien für ein effizientes und zielorientiertes arbeiten;

●     Ein motiviertes und kollegiales Team;

●     Ein Umfeld mit Respekt vor dem Kunden und zwischen den Kollegen;

●     Offene, kooperative und vertrauensvolle Unternehmenskultur;

●     Fachliche als auch persönliche Weiterentwicklung im Job durch vielfältige Trainingsangebote und Coaching;

●     Einen verkehrsgünstig gelegenen Arbeitsplatz im Zentrum von Potsdam.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Pitch is the collaborative presentation platform for modern teams. With a focus on real-time collaboration, smart workflows, and intuitive design features, we make it fast and delightful for teams to create and deliver beautiful presentations. Our presentation and template galleries give everyone the ability to publish their own standout work, learn from one another, and find the creative spark for their next presentation. Tens of thousands of teams have made the switch to Pitch, including top brands like Intercom, Superhuman, and Notion. We've raised over $135 million to date, and have been recognized by FT-backed Sifted as Europe's Top B2B Soonicorn in 2022. And we're just getting started.

We built Pitch for people who are thirsting for a better way to design, collaborate on, and share presentations. In order to improve our product, we continuously seek to improve our understanding of the user journey from first hearing about Pitch, to creating the first deck, to inviting team member to collaborate, and beyond.

One lens we've relied on to better understand this complex journey is data.

As a Senior Data Analyst on our Analytics team, you'll shed numerical light on the many mysteries that await us as we build and position Pitch as the greatest presentation tool known to humanity in 2023 and beyond.

What You'll Get To Do...

Inform and influence our growth and product strategy through data exploration.
Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, User Research, Customer Support, Finance and Product to make data-driven insights and recommendations.
Play a key role in enabling and promoting self-service analytics among stakeholders in the wider organization.
Guide teams through experimentation-based execution.
Partner with Data Engineering to maintain and extend our Data Warehouse (SnowFlake), improve data quality and documentation.


This role is perfect for you if you bring...

4+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or in a relevant field.
High proficiency in SQL and comfortable navigating data to perform a wide range of analyses.
High proficiency in using BI tools.
Experience with Git.
Strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Experience in playing the role of "project manager" when the occasion calls for it.


Not a must, but it would be great if you have…

Experience in SaaS business models.
Experience with marketing analytics.
Experience with dbt.
Understanding of statistical concepts like causal analysis.


Curious what it's like to work at Pitch? Find out more about how Pitch operates as a remote-first company through using powerful collaboration tools and dogfooding our own products!

Pitch was founded in Berlin, but as a remote-first company, our team works together from all over the world. With that mindset, we're building an inclusive workplace that invites diverse perspectives, and values talent from diverse personal and professional backgrounds. For more specifics on how we honour our commitment to diversity in our hiring process, check out our Recruiting D&I Pledge.

Sounds like a good fit? Join us on our mission to enable every team's best thinking - we look forward to hearing from you!

Not quite sure whether that's a role for you? No problem! If you can't find any open role that caught your eye, but are interested in working at Pitch, you can always submit your resume here. We will follow up as soon as we open up a position that matches your skillset and aspirations!

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Vinted Go
Description:
Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.

A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.

Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.

As a Decision Scientist at Vinted Go, you will be part of a newly introduced Vinted business – our own VGo Platform designed to provide shipping services for external clients. You will help the team to make data-driven decisions by performing data analyses, applying statistical methods and building automated dashboards. In this position you will apply decision science principles to optimise platform’s growth, visualise data, and identify opportunities. To achieve that, you will work together with a dedicated cross-functional product team which consists of engineers and a product manager.

Within Data Science & Analytics at Vinted, we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly-sized business impact, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To better understand your role as a Decision Scientist, here are brief descriptions of each role in the department:

Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and developing automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identifying algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, developing and maintaining production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation: Translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll:

Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad-hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Set-up and own key performance indicators for the team, including activity tracking, and proactively flagging customer related issues
Design experiments and track their performance to provide data-driven insights
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker)
Help to create a backlog with prioritised hypotheses and analyses
Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation


About you:

Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
Analytically curious with strong business acumen and strategic thinking
Fluent in SQL and working experience in an analytics language (Python, R, etc.)
Experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Extensive work experience in analytical / data / BI fields
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Advantage: Experience working in a tech company or in a cross-functional product development team


Work perks:

Opportunity to join our share options programme
Learning budget (10% from net yearly salary)
30 working days of holiday
Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic
Frequent team-building events
A personal budget for shopping on Vinted
A daily allowance for ordering lunch
Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year
Dog-friendly office
Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget for home workplace furniture)


We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.

Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.

The salary range for this position is 51,400 – 81,700 € (gross) per year.

If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

Title: Market Data Analyst
Description:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.




About The Unit




The Continental Europe business unit is one of three commercial business units in Yara Europe Region together with BU Nordics and BU South. BU Continental is comprised of the commercial teams - agronomy, marketing, and sales - of several major European markets, including UK and Ireland, France, Germany and Benelux, Poland, Czech Republic, Romania, and Ukraine. At the BU level are roles working across these markets, supporting business development of core fertilizer products as well as digital agronomic tools and services to customers in these markets.




The Market Data Analyst role is responsible for analyzing user data from our digital tools and services to provide meaningful insights which enable effective, data-driven decision making for the markets within the business unit and the business unit overall. This position will support the local commercial teams to understand and interpret data from various tools including Atfarm, N-Tester, N-Sensor, Megalab, Yara Premium Program, Salesforce, and Request for Quote. This analysis will be used to implement actions for improving growth, engagement, and retention of customers and product, and service development opportunities of our digital solutions, in line with our strategic ambitions.




The Market Data Analyst will report to the Marketing & Agronomy Director and act as a trusted advisor to the local teams and as a liaison towards other units within the regional and global organization when it comes to use of relevant data for marketing, commercialization, development, and continuous improvement of our digital solutions.




Responsibilities




Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations on acquisition, retention, and activation to support implementation and market development of Yara's digital offering
Guide and facilitate discussions concerning identification of opportunities for growth, activation, and churn reduction through data-driven analysis and insights and contribute to marketing strategies
Analyze data and provide insights to support product development and improved user experience of our digital tools and services
Dive into behavioral data to support markets in understanding the user-base and, together with the local commercial teams, determine how to optimize marketing, user journey, and user experience of the digital tools
Improve existing dashboards and develop new dashboards or information-sharing tools to make data more accessible and understood by relevant stakeholders; prepare and present recommendations, reports, and findings using relevant visualizations
Oversee KPIs, establish a dynamic reporting cycle, based on which decide on and implement responsive actions
Map and structure data from existing sources, for example Atfarm, Premium Program, RFQ, to create integrated "360° views" of customers to support customer-centricity across our portfolio of products, tools, and services




Profile




At least Bachelor degree in business analytics, data science, marketing, user experience, agribusiness, statistics or any other related field
Minimum 5 years of experience in market data analyses and growth and engagement; experience in the agricultural industry - an advantage
Experience participating in strategic discussions, interpreting and integrating data from various sources and clearly communicating the findings from analyses to a diverse collection of stakeholders to drive and support decision-making
Excellent data analysis skills with strong business acumen and understanding of how data insight can meet business needs and contribute value
Experience increasing retention and engagement, managing churn, translating insight into improvements and implementing feature adoption strategies
Proactive, resourceful and experienced working in a complex matrix organization with excellent collaboration, listening and communication skills
Experience with digital marketing and other user-data oriented products
Good understanding of Yara's business in Europe, its strategy and change agenda - an advantage




Additional Information




Periodical visits to the local markets throughout the year for workshops are expected
Operational language - English, knowledge of any other language spoken in the Continental Europe markets (i.e., French, German etc). is an advantage
The location for this role can be any Yara site relevant to Continental Europe markets




Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply.




Contact details




Rūta Povilaitytė




Senior HR Advisor




ruta.povilaityte@yara com




Allison O'Dell




Director, Marketing & Agronomy




allison.odell@yara.com




Apply no later than




February 22, 2023




Knowledge grows through differences




Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassadors networks.




Show more Show less
HTML:
We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.


About The Unit


The Continental Europe business unit is one of three commercial business units in Yara Europe Region together with BU Nordics and BU South. BU Continental is comprised of the commercial teams - agronomy, marketing, and sales - of several major European markets, including UK and Ireland, France, Germany and Benelux, Poland, Czech Republic, Romania, and Ukraine. At the BU level are roles working across these markets, supporting business development of core fertilizer products as well as digital agronomic tools and services to customers in these markets.


The Market Data Analyst role is responsible for analyzing user data from our digital tools and services to provide meaningful insights which enable effective, data-driven decision making for the markets within the business unit and the business unit overall. This position will support the local commercial teams to understand and interpret data from various tools including Atfarm, N-Tester, N-Sensor, Megalab, Yara Premium Program, Salesforce, and Request for Quote. This analysis will be used to implement actions for improving growth, engagement, and retention of customers and product, and service development opportunities of our digital solutions, in line with our strategic ambitions.


The Market Data Analyst will report to the Marketing & Agronomy Director and act as a trusted advisor to the local teams and as a liaison towards other units within the regional and global organization when it comes to use of relevant data for marketing, commercialization, development, and continuous improvement of our digital solutions.


Responsibilities


  • Analyze data and provide insights and recommendations on acquisition, retention, and activation to support implementation and market development of Yara's digital offering
  • Guide and facilitate discussions concerning identification of opportunities for growth, activation, and churn reduction through data-driven analysis and insights and contribute to marketing strategies
  • Analyze data and provide insights to support product development and improved user experience of our digital tools and services
  • Dive into behavioral data to support markets in understanding the user-base and, together with the local commercial teams, determine how to optimize marketing, user journey, and user experience of the digital tools
  • Improve existing dashboards and develop new dashboards or information-sharing tools to make data more accessible and understood by relevant stakeholders; prepare and present recommendations, reports, and findings using relevant visualizations
  • Oversee KPIs, establish a dynamic reporting cycle, based on which decide on and implement responsive actions
  • Map and structure data from existing sources, for example Atfarm, Premium Program, RFQ, to create integrated "360° views" of customers to support customer-centricity across our portfolio of products, tools, and services


Profile


  • At least Bachelor degree in business analytics, data science, marketing, user experience, agribusiness, statistics or any other related field
  • Minimum 5 years of experience in market data analyses and growth and engagement; experience in the agricultural industry - an advantage
  • Experience participating in strategic discussions, interpreting and integrating data from various sources and clearly communicating the findings from analyses to a diverse collection of stakeholders to drive and support decision-making
  • Excellent data analysis skills with strong business acumen and understanding of how data insight can meet business needs and contribute value
  • Experience increasing retention and engagement, managing churn, translating insight into improvements and implementing feature adoption strategies
  • Proactive, resourceful and experienced working in a complex matrix organization with excellent collaboration, listening and communication skills
  • Experience with digital marketing and other user-data oriented products
  • Good understanding of Yara's business in Europe, its strategy and change agenda - an advantage


Additional Information


  • Periodical visits to the local markets throughout the year for workshops are expected
  • Operational language - English, knowledge of any other language spoken in the Continental Europe markets (i.e., French, German etc). is an advantage
  • The location for this role can be any Yara site relevant to Continental Europe markets


Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage qualified applicants from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Data Analyst & Performance Marketing Specialist
Description:
For this position previous Experience in Paid Performance (facebook & Google) for E-commerce and in Data Management (preferably Tableau) are needed

About Us

Avea is a Swiss longevity startup with the vision to become the leading player in the evidence-based longevity supplement industry. We offer science-based longevity supplements to target multiple hallmarks of aging, allowing individuals to improve their well-being by slowing down aging itself. Our mission is to optimize people's health- and lifespan, helping them keep or regain their vitality to live as healthily as possible for as long as possible.

The Role

As a Performance Marketing Specialist you will be responsible for initiating, executing, and reporting on digital marketing initiatives to drive awareness and conversions. You'll set the strategy, optimise our existing performance channels, test new channels and own the results in our main markets (Europe and APAC).

This is a great opportunity to join a fast pace and mission driven start-up on where you will be exposed to incredible learning and growth opportunities.

Tasks And Responsibilities

Drive our digital performance marketing across all channels e.g Facebook, Google and TikTok
Plan and set up online marketing campaigns in coordination with the Co-Founder in charge of marketing
Monitor performance of individual assets (e.g. pictures, articles, videos), identify what works best and coordinate with the rest of the marketing team to produce more high performance assets and to implement best practices
Measure and analysis campaigns on a daily basis by using Google Analytics, Google data studio, Google Ads Dashboard & Facebook Ads Dashboard, Excel and other dashboards needed.
Identify improvement opportunities in digital performance marketing growth and efficiency by constantly testing ideas with audience targeting, split tests and A/B tests etc.
Test new channels and opportunities


You'll Fit Great With These Skills And Values

University degree, quantitative majors like engineering, physics, mathematics are strongly preferred
Data Driven, you are analytical, like looking at data and derive conclusions from it
Team player who is able to work independently on dynamic work environment that requires own thinking and problem solving
Eager to learn and adopt new tools/technologies as well as share knowledge with others
Very good command of Ms.Excel
You understand online shopping and have collected some experience in optimizing a conversion journey and online customer acquisition
At least 1 year experience in either Google AdWords platform or Facebook Ads Manager, ideally both
Basic understanding of google analytics, certification is a plus
Interest in the longevity industry


Why join us

We believe that the best companies help you live your life the way you want and become the person you want to be. That's why we focus on promoting your personal freedom and growth. Here are some of the benefits you'll enjoy as a member of our team:

Work at a well-funded, early-stage startup in the longevity industry
Be part of a dynamic, high-performing, and fun team
A high degree of personal responsibility, creative freedom and opportunities
Work with the brightest researchers within longevity and with successful and well-known serial entrepreneurs
Fully remote opportunity where you are free to live and work wherever you want
Strong team culture with regular team events and off-sites

Title: Data Analyst Healthcare - Consulting (w/m/d)
Description:
Das erwartet dich bei uns – Erfahrungen, von denen du ein Leben lang profitierst




Als Expert:in für Healthcare-IT-Lösungen und Mitglied im EMEIA Digital Health Excellence Center Team in Hamburg, Berlin, Frankfurt/Main, Stuttgart, München, Köln oder Hannover wirkst du an vielen Digitalisierungsinitiativen für unsere Healthcare-Kund:innen in ganz Europa mit. Dabei übernimmst du vielfältige Aufgaben, z. B.:




Entwicklung und Implementierung moderner Data Analytics Lösungen für unsere europäischen Kund:innen
Darstellung und Demonstration von Data Analytics Lösungen in Angeboten, Ausschreibungen und Kunden-Meetings
Entwicklung und Weiterentwicklung unserer digitalen Healthcare-Lösungen zusammen mit unseren Kund:innen und unseren internationalen Healthcare-Teams
Unterstützung unseres Thinktanks und Beiträge zu unseren Thought-Leadership-Initiativen mit deiner Data Analytics Expertise




Das bringt du mit – Fähigkeiten, mit denen du die Zukunft gestaltest




Hervorragender Bachelor- oder Masterabschlusses in Data Science, Business Analytics, Statistik, Mathematik, Ökonometrie, Ingenieurwesen, Operational Research, Informatik oder einem anderen verwandten Bereich mit starkem quantitativen Schwerpunkt
Mindestens 2-5 Jahre Berufserfahrung, davon vorzugsweise mindestens 2 Jahre im Gesundheitswesen, mit besonderem Schwerpunkt auf Datenmodellierung und -verwaltung, Integration und Bearbeitung großer unterschiedlicher Datensätze (d. h. strukturiert, halbstrukturiert oder unstrukturiert)
Erfahrung mit gesundheitsbezogenen Daten- und Sprachformaten wie HL7 / FHIR, xDT, openEHR, OMOP, SNOMED
Nachgewiesene praktische Erfahrung im Bereich Datenbank- und/oder Data-Warehouse-Design und Datenmodellierung.
Erfahrung mit fortgeschrittenen Datenvisualisierungstools wie Tableau, Spotfire, Qlikview, PowerBI und anderen für die Integration unterschiedlicher Datenquellen, den Entwurf und die Implementierung von KPIs und die Erstellung automatischer und skalierbarer Visualisierungen, die die Gewinnung von Geschäftseinblicken erleichtern




Das bieten wir dir – ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld




Bei EY setzen wir alles daran, dass die Welt besser funktioniert. Dafür hinterfragen wir täglich den Status quo und suchen schon heute die Antworten von morgen. Stillstand? Keine Option. Wandel? Sehen wir als Chance und Treiber für Innovation.




Wenn du auch so tickst, dann bist du bei uns genau richtig. Wir suchen Macher:innen, die Unternehmen, Entrepreneuren, Privatpersonen und der öffentlichen Hand helfen, über sich hinaus zu wachsen. Das erfordert Zusammenarbeit auf Augenhöhe und das Verlassen ausgetretener Pfade. Diese beschreitest du als Teil von interdisziplinären Teams – innovativ und multikulturell aufgestellt in Deutschland, Europa und der ganzen Welt.




Damit auch du persönlich und beruflich über dich hinauswächst, begleiten wir dich auf deinem Karriereweg mit auf dich zugeschnittenen Arbeitsmodellen sowie Trainings- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten on- und off-the-Job. Das Tempo und Ziel auf deinem Weg bestimmst du selbst.




Wir wissen: Erstklassiger Service für unsere Mandant:innen und Kund:innen beginnt bei zufriedenen und motivierten Mitarbeitenden. Deshalb reicht unser Angebot von flexiblen Arbeitsmodellen, Auslandeinsätzen und Weiterbildungen über Sport- und Freizeitangeboten bis hin zu Rabatten bekannter Marken und Anbieter sowie Altersvorsorge. Erfahre mehr über deine Benefits bei EY.




Du hast Lust was zu bewegen? Dann werde Teil unseres Teams.




Bewirb dich jetzt über unser Jobportal: www.de.ey.com/karriere.




Mehr Informationen zum Bewerbungsprozess bei EY findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.




Deine Fragen beantwortet gerne unser Recruitment Center unter: +49 6196 996 10005.




Was andere über uns sagen, findest du auf kununu und Glassdoor.

Title: Junior Data Protection Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
We don't wait for the future, but shape today´s digital world. Grow along our company and take on responsibility.

Join Helios Global Health's Data Protection team as a

Junior Data Protection Analyst (m/w/d).

Das erwartet Sie


Participate to the continued development and improvement of Helios Global Health’s data protection program
Serve as a liaison between the data protection department and external third parties e.g. Consultants, contractors, service providers, etc.
Draft, review and update the data protection policies, SOPs and guidelines and be an instrumental part of the data protection’s monitoring program to enhance and insure internal compliance
Actively participate and assist with all data protection specific processes including Subject Access Requests, Data Privacy Impact Assessments, Transfer Impact Assessments, Unauthorized Disclosure, Company Trainings, (…)
Review company´s new products, features and designs and provide guidance on data protection requirements and applicable industry standards
Support the maintenance of the data protection relevant documentation like the records of processing activities (ROPA) and all the data protection related inventories


Das bringen Sie mit


Bachelor´s degree or prior experience in data protection, compliance, legal, audit or equivalent function, preferably within an international organization. Experience with Governance, Risk and Compliance programs is a plus
Ability to communicate comfortably with stakeholders across the organization including Heads of department and higher management in German and English
Strong knowledge of global and international data privacy laws and regulations and of compliance standards and frameworks, such as (ISO 27001, NIST, etc.)
Willingness to develop and in-depth understanding of Helios Global Health’s business model and trends in the global healthcare industry
General interest in new technologies and aspiration to learn more about information technology, data flows, cloud solutions, databases, access management etc.
Willingness to travel (approximately 10-20% of time) and to work independently with minimal supervision


Freuen Sie sich auf


A flexible schedule including remote work and an attractive and modern work environment (Frankfurt - Berlin)
A comprehensive benefits package including competitive salary
Direct contact with World-class managers
Learning and development opportunities
Real and impactful tasks with the possibility to learn and grow as a professional
Mission-driven work that changes the lives of people around the world


Jetzt liegt es nur noch an Ihnen!

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact HK-Personalmanagement-Zentrale[at]helios-gesundheit.de.

Helios Global Health is offering a unique opportunity for young professionals wishing to learn and develop in the field of data protection.

The address of your new job as a Junior Data Protection Analyst (m/w/d) is: Friedrichstraße 136, 10117 Berlin or Speicherstraße 49-51, 60317 Frankfurt/Main

We are looking forward to your application.

Equal chances at the workplace are important to us. Therefor, we explicitly encourage people of any sexual identity and ethnicity or with disabilities to apply.

Title: Data Analyst / Data Product Manager (m/w/d)
HTML:
Lust „Big Data“ mit Leben zu füllen? Den Umgang mit großen Datenmengen zu revolutionieren? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig!

Gegründet 2011 mit Firmensitz in Potsdam hat sich die Lot Internet GmbH auf das Erfassen und Analysieren strukturierter Daten aus dem Internet spezialisiert.

Als Data Analyst / Data Product Manager liegt Dein Schwerpunkt in der Nutzbarmachung von heterogenen Online-Datenquellen durch die Entwicklung von effizienten Daten-Services. Du berätst und unterstützt unsere Kunden bei der digitalen Transformation und hilfst diesen, durch Daten einen echten Mehrwert zu generieren.

Ziel ist die Erkennung von Zusammenhängen und Mustern in den Datenwelten, sowie die Schaffung von Transparenz im Marktgeschehen. Der Branchenschwerpunkt liegt dabei im Bereich Automotiv, wo große Konzerne unsere Kunden sind.

Aufgaben
  • Erstellung von ganzheitlichen Analysen, basierend auf Datenbankabfragen;
  • Interpretation und Bewertung von Datenanalysen und Kennzahlen;
  • Konzeption von Online-Applikationen zur Datenanalyse;
  • Verantwortlich für die Datenqualitätssicherung, u.a. durch fortlaufende Optimierung von Datenverarbeitungsprozessen;
  • Strategische Beratung unserer Kunden bei Big Data-Analysen;
  • Fachlicher Key Account Manager;
  • Produkt- und Projektmanagement bei unseren Daten-Services;
  • Steuerung von Entwicklern zur Datenerfassung und -aufbereitung;
  • Unterstützung des Managements im Bereich Business Development.
Profil
  • Abgeschlossenes Studium der Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einschlägige Berufserfahrung;
  • Strukturiertes, reflektiertes und analytisches Denken
  • Sicherer Umgang mit Methoden zur Analyse und zur Aufbereitung von Daten;
  • Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL);
  • Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement, idealerweise auch im Produktmanagement;
  • Sicheres und kompetentes Auftreten bei unseren Kunden;
  • Sehr gute Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch;
  • Zielorientierte, sorgfältige und eigenständige Arbeitsweise.
Wir bieten
  • Eine umfassende und praxisorientierte Einarbeitung;
  • Ein familienfreundliches Unternehmen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und drei Tage Home-Office;
  • Flache Hierarchien für ein effizientes und zielorientiertes arbeiten;
  • Ein motiviertes und kollegiales Team;
  • Ein Umfeld mit Respekt vor dem Kunden und zwischen den Kollegen;
  • Offene, kooperative und vertrauensvolle Unternehmenskultur;
  • Fachliche als auch persönliche Weiterentwicklung im Job durch vielfältige Trainingsangebote und Coaching;
  • Einen verkehrsgünstig gelegenen Arbeitsplatz im Zentrum von Potsdam.

Title: Assistenz (m/w/d) Data Analyst
Description:
Du hast Dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder des Wirtschaftsingenieurwesens erfolgreich abgeschlossen und interessiert Dich für den Bereich Datenanalyse? Zudem hast Du praktische Erfahrungen in der Verarbeitung und Aufbereitung von Daten und besitzt eine eigenständige und präzise Arbeitsweise? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig! Als Assistenz (m/w/d) in der Datenanalyse übernimmst Du vielfältige Aufgaben im Datenmanagement zur Optimierung der Qualität der Einkaufsprozesse.

Unser Kunde ist ein weltweit führender Premium-Hersteller von Automobilen und Motorrädern sowie Anbieter von Premium-Finanz- und Mobilitätsdienstleistungen. Bewirb Dich noch heute und profitiere neben spannenden Tätigkeiten außerdem von vielen möglichen Benefits wie die Betreuung durch Deinen persönlichen Talent Coach oder auch den vielfältigen Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in unserer e-Academy.

Das erwartet Dich bei uns

Mitarbeit im Datenmanagement, inkl. Aufbereitung, Analyse und Visualisierung der Daten
Zusammenführung und Aktualisierung von Berichten zu Arbeitsdateien
Unterstützung bei der Auswertung von Systemprozessen
Dokumentation und Pflege der KPIs
Präsentation von Ergebnissen mit MS PowerPoint
Das bieten wir Dir

Ein jährliches Gehalt zwischen 43.000 und 46.000 €
Arbeiten im Home Office für 1-2 Tage möglich, nach Einarbeitung vor Ort
Betreuung durch einen persönlichen Talent Coach
Vielfältige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in unserer e-academy
Corporate Shopping und Rabatte für ausgewählte Fitnessstudios
Das bringst Du mit

Ein abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, des Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder vergleichbar
Erste praktische Erfahrungen in der Datenanalyse, -aufbereitung und/oder -visualisierung
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Umgang MS Excel sowie idealerweise mit Python und/oder VBA
Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Eine eigenständige und präzise Arbeitsweise

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermin einen Marketing Data Analyst (m/w/d) in Vollzeit am Standort Berlin.




Ihre Mission:




Sie sind die Schnittstelle zwischen Daten und Strategie. Mit Ihrem bereichsübergreifenden Blick auf unseren Marketing Funnel analysieren und bewerten Sie den integrierten Erfolg unserer Marketing-Aktivitäten. Von Media-Kampagnen über PR und bis hin zu Event- und CRM-Aktivitäten, nicht nur im HQ-Team, sondern weltweit, begutachten und analysieren Sie die Effekte auf Schnittstellen wie Sales und Business Transformation und leiten daraus Handlungsempfehlungen für unsere Markenstrategie ab.




Sie stellen unsere Maßnahmen und Ergebnisse in den Kontext von Marken- und Vertriebszielen, unseren bisherigen Marketing-Aktivitäten sowie externer Consumer & Market Intelligence.




Zusammen mit den Experten aus dem Marketing-Team und weiteren Fachbereichen finden Sie die richtigen Fragen und Antworten, erstellen Handlungsempfehlungen und arbeiten aktiv an der zukünftigen Ausrichtung unserer Marke.




Als Teil des Brand Strategy & Analytics Teams beeinflussen Sie aktiv die Ausrichtung unseres Marketings, das Image unserer Marke, bauen den Marketing-Anteil unserer bereichsübergreifenden Reporting-Struktur aus und entwickeln effiziente und effektive Reports mit klaren strategischen Ableitungen. Sie kreieren dafür die richtigen Tools und Analysen für verschiedene interne Zielgruppen und auf Konzernseite.




Ihre Aufgaben:




Vollständige Begleitung von Marketingkampagnen, von der Kampagnenentwicklung bis zur Bewertung und Erklärung der Performance vs. der definierten Marketing- und Sales-Ziele, sowie Entwicklung von Handlungsempfehlungen für die Zukunft
Tracking, Reporting und Analyse sämtlicher relevanter Performance KPIs und Entwicklung von standardisierten Reports
Bearbeitung von Ad-hoc Analysen und Realtime Tracking zur optimierten Kampagnensteuerung
Konzeption von Testszenarien für AB-Tests zur Analyse von User-Verhalten und Conversion-Optimierung
Vollständiger Aufbau des Marketing Performance Dashboards in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Brand Strategy Team
Weiterentwicklung der Client Equation, unter Berücksichtigung relevanter KPIs und deren Bedeutung und Auswirkungen
Kontinuierliche Analyse und Verbesserung der Datenquellen, -qualität und Datenkompetenz mit den Channel Ownern, für die effektive Verknüpfung aller Touchpoints
Schnittstelle zur Analytics Community und des Marktforschungs-Teams auf Konzernseite




Ihre Fähigkeiten:




Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit der Fachrichtung Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Informatik, Mathematik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder eines verwandten Studiengangs mit analytischem Schwerpunkt
Mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Position
Fundierte Erfahrung im Bereich Data Science und dem Analysieren, Auswerten und Aufbereiten von Daten
Programmierkenntnisse in SQL, Python, R o.ä. von Vorteil
Ausgeprägte Problemlöser-Mentalität
Hohes Maß an Selbständigkeit, Proaktivität und Zielorientierung
Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit, stark im Bereichs- und Hierarchie-übergreifenden Netzwerk-/Beziehungsaufbau
Bereichs- und funktionsübergreifendes Verständnis von betrieblichen Abläufen und dem Zusammenhang von Geschäftsprozessen im interkulturellen Management
Fließende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch zwingend erforderlich




Was wir bieten:




Leistungsgerechte, attraktive Vergütung mit 13. Gehalt und Teilnahme am Bonusprogramm
Hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung und Möglichkeit zur Umsetzung eigener Ideen
Internationale Zusammenarbeit innerhalb des Richemont Konzerns
Ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld im Herzen von Berlin
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zu Homeoffice
Zuschuss zum Jobticket
Arbeitgebergefördertes Altersvorsorgemodell und vermögenswirksame Leistungen
Jährliche Mitarbeitergespräche und individuelle Personalentwicklung
Gesundheitserhaltende Maßnahmen und betriebsärztliche Betreuung
Zuschuss zu den Kinderbetreuungskosten für nicht-schulpflichtige Kinder
Kostenfreie Nutzung digitaler Weiterbildungsangebote in LinkedIn Learning
Kostenfreie Nutzung der konzerninternen digitalen Sprachsoftware Speexx
Umfangreiche Corporate Benefits Angebote




Es erwartet Sie eine anspruchsvolle Aufgabe in einem modern ausgerichteten Unternehmen des Richemont-Konzerns. Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte und hinterlassen Sie Ihre Fußspuren. Bereichern Sie ein Team, das mit Leidenschaft und starkem Gemeinsinn das Werk von Ferdinand A. Lange in die Zukunft trägt - getreu unserem Motto "Never stand still".




Wir freuen uns über die Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen inklusive der Angabe Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellungen für diese Position.




Bitte klicken Sie auf "Jetzt bewerben". Wir freuen uns, von Ihnen zu hören.

  • Hohes Maß an Eigenverantwortung und Möglichkeit zur Umsetzung eigener Ideen
  • Internationale Zusammenarbeit innerhalb des Richemont Konzerns
  • Ein modernes Arbeitsumfeld im Herzen von Berlin
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und die Möglichkeit zu Homeoffice
  • Zuschuss zum Jobticket
  • Arbeitgebergefördertes Altersvorsorgemodell und vermögenswirksame Leistungen
  • Jährliche Mitarbeitergespräche und individuelle Personalentwicklung
  • Gesundheitserhaltende Maßnahmen und betriebsärztliche Betreuung
  • Zuschuss zu den Kinderbetreuungskosten für nicht-schulpflichtige Kinder

Title: Google Analytics & Data Studio Analyst*innen (m/w/d) - Fully-REMOTE
Description:
FIRST STARS gehört zu den Top-Agenturen für Performance Marketing. Alle Kunden, vom kleinen E-Shop bis zum internationalen Trademark, finden bei uns ihre individuelle Unterstützung. Als Digital Analytics & Tracking Profi brauchen wir Deine Unterstützung in der Betreuung unserer Kunden.

Aufgaben

Dafür brauchen wir deine Power

Eigenständige Betreuung von Google Data Studio Kundenprojekten
Plattformkontakt, Austausch & Strategie
Setup von neuen Google Data Studio Reportings
Tracking Kontrolle, Google Tag Manager und GA4 Setup
Zielgruppen- und Wettbewerbsanalysen
Google Analytics Auswertungen und Optimierung der Kundensetups
Erstellung von Reportings, Analysen und Präsentationen
Beratung von Kunden und Kundenkommunikation
Trainer bzw. Mentor für Trainees


Qualifikation

Du passt zu uns, wenn…

Du eine Berufsausbildung oder ein abgeschlossenes Studium hast
Du mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung hast im Bereich Digital Analytics & Tracking
Du ein Team-Player bist und dich gerne einbringst
Du engagiert und eigenverantwortlich arbeitest
Du über eine ausgeprägte Hands-on-Mentalität verfügst
Du für deinen Job brennst
Exzellente Deutsch- (mindestens Level C2) und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse


Benefits

Warum FIRST STARS?

Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag oder Freelancer Tätigkeit
Spannende Kunden, vom Nischenprodukt bis zur internationalen Marke
Externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Bis zu 30 Tage Urlaub
Fully Remote in Deutschland gemeldet
Zahlreiche Teamevents und Firmenfeiern im In und Ausland
Arbeiten mit fortschrittlichen Tools und Google Partner Benefits
Flache Hierarchien und familiärer Umgang
Kollegen, die zu Freunden werden
Events national & international USA


Voraussichtliches Einstiegsdatum: Sofort

Art der Stelle: Vollzeit, Stundenweise als Freelancer oder Festanstellung, Deutschland, Remote - Arbeite wo du willst!

Bewirb Dich jetzt!

Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung

Title: Forecasting Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join eBay – a company you can be proud to be with.




Company Perspective




The eBay Global Customer Experience (GCX) team is responsible for building experiences that customers love in Service Delivery. The role we are hiring for is a Forecasting Analyst as part of the Workforce Operations team within the GCX organization. This team is responsible for extracting learnings and insights from our customer interactions and influencing direction inside GCX through volume forecasting and analysis.




Forecasting




Primary Job Responsibilities:




Analyzing and understanding call volume drivers and trends
Developing and Implementing a closed loop to feed these learnings back into both the business and the forecast
Developing a short, mid and long-term forecast based on our service delivery strategy using statistical modelling
Creating Region, Channel and Staff Group level forecast at weekly/monthly level based on strong analytics
Proactively determining risk and opportunities through scenario analysis
Supporting planning strategies with clear, concise review of volume drivers
Providing variance analysis of volume forecast vs. Financial Forecast, Budget and Various Scenarios
Communicating critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answer questions about the inputs and outputs of Demand Forecasting systems and improving their performance
Communicating verbally and in writing to business customers with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our systems, as well as sharing insights and recommendations




Process Management & Improvement




Implementing continuous improvements in the forecast including opportunities to streamline and automate.
Developing Forecast Accuracy measurement methodology
Implementing Forecast Accuracy measurement reporting and communication strategy




Special Analysis




Analysis of special cause drivers including billing, bugs, outages, etc.
Executive Summaries of volume risks and opportunities
Addition Ad Hoc Analysis as needed




Minimum Qualifications




Demonstrated forecasting experience using statistical modelling
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 4 years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
Must be open to Hybrid work out of our Draper, UT office




Preferred Qualifications




Demonstrated SQL experience
5+ years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
Advanced forecasting, statistical modelling, Excel, SQL, PowerPoint, business presentations




Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.




Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about eBay’s Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/




eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. View our accessibility info to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement.




Jobs posted with location as "Remote - United States (Excludes CO, HI, NM, NYC)" excludes residents of Colorado, Hawaii, New Mexico and New York City.




This website uses cookies to enhance your experience. By continuing to browse the site, you agree to our use of cookies. Visit our Privacy Center for more information.
