Title: Data Engineer (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Our highly ambitious team around serial entrepreneur Mario Kohle is supported by experienced investors like Alexander Samwer (Picus Capital) and Lukasz Gadowski (Team Europe, Delivery Hero). In addition, we were able to bring Princeville Climate Technology (advised and funded among others by Leonardo DiCaprio) and Peter Rive (SolarCity) on board. As the first green unicorn in Germany, we see it as our duty to continuously drive forward our mission of green energy for all. Be part of our success story and change the world by joining us!

Job Description

Disrupting the conservative energy market, that’s what Enpal is all about! We offer speed, agility, and steep career opportunities. Our vision is to make sustainable solar energy available to everyone. Join us to develop your professional skills, take part in the solar-energy revolution, and let us take ownership of the sustainable change we want to see in the world together!

As Data Engineer in our Data Platform Team, you will be responsible for working with Enpal’s data collection and projects. You will be in charge of developing and improving our data infrastructure and evaluating new tools and services we can use to extend our data offerings.

Your Responsibilities

Create and maintain data ingestion ELT pipelines to the Data Warehouse
Ensure high data integrity and implement solutions to constantly improve data reliability and quality
Build required infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading of data from various data sources using Azure and SQL technologies
Assemble large, complex, high-quality data sets that meet business requirements
Work together with members of Business Intelligence and efficiently communicate both solutions and results to stakeholders
Develop efficient solutions to problems alongside cross-functional communication with other project team members


Qualifications

You have 2+ years experience as a Data Engineer or a similar role
You have working knowledge of Python & SQL
You acquired prior experience with one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS or GCP) and its services
You possess a deep understanding of databases
High level of written and spoken English to work in an international team


Additional Information

The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Direct impact on our corporate success and exciting career opportunities: leave your footprint.
Close cooperation with the management team while shaping Enpal’s tech DNA: you will be part of our first Tech Team.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A great work environment in our Berlin office, or focused work from home - you decide. Your location should be in Germany or at least willingness to relocate. At the moment we don't offer full remote Jobs.


At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Forecasting Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Looking for a company that inspires passion, courage and creativity, where you can be on the team shaping the future of global commerce? Want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, connect, and share around the world? If you’re interested in joining a purpose driven community that is dedicated to crafting an ambitious and inclusive work environment, join eBay – a company you can be proud to be with.




Company Perspective




The eBay Global Customer Experience (GCX) team is responsible for building experiences that customers love in Service Delivery. The role we are hiring for is a Forecasting Analyst as part of the Workforce Operations team within the GCX organization. This team is responsible for extracting learnings and insights from our customer interactions and influencing direction inside GCX through volume forecasting and analysis.




Forecasting




Primary Job Responsibilities:




Analyzing and understanding call volume drivers and trends
Developing and Implementing a closed loop to feed these learnings back into both the business and the forecast
Developing a short, mid and long-term forecast based on our service delivery strategy using statistical modelling
Creating Region, Channel and Staff Group level forecast at weekly/monthly level based on strong analytics
Proactively determining risk and opportunities through scenario analysis
Supporting planning strategies with clear, concise review of volume drivers
Providing variance analysis of volume forecast vs. Financial Forecast, Budget and Various Scenarios
Communicating critical data in a format that is immediately useful to answer questions about the inputs and outputs of Demand Forecasting systems and improving their performance
Communicating verbally and in writing to business customers with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our systems, as well as sharing insights and recommendations




Process Management & Improvement




Implementing continuous improvements in the forecast including opportunities to streamline and automate.
Developing Forecast Accuracy measurement methodology
Implementing Forecast Accuracy measurement reporting and communication strategy




Special Analysis




Analysis of special cause drivers including billing, bugs, outages, etc.
Executive Summaries of volume risks and opportunities
Addition Ad Hoc Analysis as needed




Minimum Qualifications




Demonstrated forecasting experience using statistical modelling
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 4 years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
Must be open to Hybrid work out of our Draper, UT office




Preferred Qualifications




Demonstrated SQL experience
5+ years of experience forecasting in either a multi-channel contact center or operations environment.
Advanced forecasting, statistical modelling, Excel, SQL, PowerPoint, business presentations




Benefits are an essential part of your total compensation for the work you do every day. Whether you’re single, in a growing family, or nearing retirement, eBay offers a variety of comprehensive and competitive benefit programs to meet your needs. Including maternal & paternal leave, paid sabbatical, and plans to help ensure your financial security today and in the years ahead because we know feeling financially secure during your working years and through retirement is important.




Here at eBay, we love creating opportunities for others by connecting people from widely diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and geographies. So, being diverse and inclusive isn’t just something we strive for, it is who we are, and part of what we do each and every single day. We want to ensure that as an employee, you feel eBay is a place where, no matter who you are, you feel safe, included, and that you have the opportunity to bring your unique self to work. To learn about eBay’s Diversity & Inclusion click here: https://www.ebayinc.com/company/diversity-inclusion/




eBay Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or other legally protected status. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at talent@ebay.com. We will make every effort to respond to your request for disability assistance as soon as possible. View our accessibility info to learn more about eBay's commitment to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. For more information see: EEO is the Law Poster and EEO is the Law Poster Supplement.

Title: Data Analytics Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Your impact

You collaborate with different teams and stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making in the organization
You develop advanced data models in SQL/ Python, add new data sources and enable other teams to turn those data products into insights, analyses, and dashboards
You own our core data pipelines end-to-end, from ingestion in our data warehouse to consumption in a dashboard or data product (Apache Airflow, dbt)
You enable our stakeholders to answer straightforward questions themselves via self-service tools (e.g. Metabase)
You perform ad-hoc analyses to answer business questions or generate data sets
Improvement of event tracking in close cooperation with product management, as well as collection and measurement of relevant data


Your skill set

You have several years of experience in data modeling and/or as a data engineer
You are experienced in advanced data modeling with dbt and SQL
You work with Github/ git version control on a daily base
You have experience with Python, git version control, Docker and a good understanding of Apache Airflow is a big plus
You get involved early in business specific discussions with the stakeholders and understand the requirements
You have been working with data exploration and visualization tools such as Metabase, Looker or Tableau
You are the bridge between the teams, organising, defining & translating requirements of event collection and quality
You are structured at work, able to handle and prioritise your tasks well in a dynamic environment
You can communicate complex problems with technical and business stakeholder in simple manner


Not a 100% match but you have knowledge that you think we can't do without?

We’re always looking forward to meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply anyways. We are also hiring for attitude, values, and personality and we love to develop our skills together at kollex!

Why kollex?

Communication, Culture & Commitment:

Communication at eye level, a feedback and error culture with regular feedback meetings and, most importantly, respectful interaction at all times!
A lot of room for creativity and not only the possibility, but also the clear expectation to contribute yourself and your ideas at any time.
International and dynamic work environment and with the backing of leading industry partners with long-term secured financing and permanent employment contracts


Flexibility, Remote Policy & Hybrid Model:

Work from Anywhere - work 6 weeks a year from anywhere in the world.
With a mix of onsite days and remote work, we offer you the opportunity to work flexibly


Team, Benefits & Employee Development:

Language courses, further education budget, leadership training and other internal development opportunities
Regular company events such as wine and beer tastings, game nights or boat trips as well as budget for team events
Benefit packages: Mobility, sports or rather shopping - with us you can spend €50 per month in the way that suits you and your preferences best.


Well-being, Health & Retirement:

Employee Assistance Programme: Our external employee counselling service supports you 24/7 on topics such as legal advice, (mental) health or family.
Company pension scheme: If you are already thinking further ahead, we support your pension scheme in the form of individual advice and an allowance.
Cereal bar, drinks, fruit and weekly company lunch


Additional Information

At kollex, we would like to have more diversity! We’re committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or origin. We take care of each other and are grateful for each person’s individual contribution to our mission!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Adtech team supporting our adtech team in improving the performance of all our adtech products. If you're a creative problem solver who is eager to deliver solutions and hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your Mission

You develop accessible, creative and engaging data visualization to facilitate access to insight using Tableau.
You create new data analyses based on business requirements from stakeholders.
You are engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights.
You are analyzing trends in our data and providing insight and explanation to our local teams to improve their operations using data.
You help identify, define and specify future insight and data needs to support the different business units.
Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, product managers and business stakeholders to build well-crafted, pragmatic data products.

Your Heroic Skills

You have 3 years experience as a BI/Data analyst.
You have at least a Bachelor's degree in a quantitative subject, e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, economics, engineering or demonstrable relevant practical experience.
You are highly proficient in SQL.
You are creative in data visualisation (Tableau or other modern visualisation tool, is a must).
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail.
You are a team player and love to think outside the box.
Practical experience with big data tools (e.g Redshift, BigQuery).
Experience using git.
Excellent English communication skills.

Why Delivery Hero?

Exchange ideas and meet colleagues from different teams in our active guilds and through our global tech & product community.
We offer visa & relocation support globally to our permanent employees.
Enjoy our free online yoga classes and a subsidized Urban Sports Club or Gympass membership.
Take care of your mental and emotional well-being with our free Headspace subscription and unlimited access to our confidential Employee Assistance Program.
Participate in our health campaigns such as seasonal flu vaccines.
Benefit from subsidised products e.g. BVG ticket, meal vouchers, fruit or vegetable box or our bike rental program
We support child care needs where we partner with an external service to support tasks such as Kita search and application, Au Pair or childminder search
Join the global market leader and a publicly listed company with a competitive remuneration package.
Develop your skills with your personal educational budget for conferences and external trainings.
Access our e-learning platform MyAcademy and participate in our various inhouse trainings, including German learning options.
Save responsibly with our attractive corporate pension options.
Join company parties, team, cultural and sports events - due to the current situation on a virtual basis.
And much more

Have we caught your attention? If you are looking for an environment where our company DNA is defined by our values and People Leadership Principles, please send us your CV.

We’re looking forward to your application!

About Us

Delivery Hero is building the next generation global on-demand delivery platform. We have grown rapidly from inception in 2011 to become one of the leading global online food ordering and delivery platforms and are now innovating and creating new services such as groceries, pharmacies, and other convenience articles in multiple markets.

Our awesome international team already operates in 40+ countries worldwide and we are looking for the most talented people to join us on our mission to ‘always deliver an amazing experience.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.

Title: Online Data Analyst (m,f,d)
Description:
We are hiring freelance English and German speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.







This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.







Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English and German
You must be living in Germany for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.







Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.







Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community







TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com










If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam17@telusinternational.ai

  • You must be living in Germany for the last 2 consecutive years
  • Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
  • You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Germany
  • Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
  • Applicants must be 18 years or over.



Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.



Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?

  • Earn extra income
  • Access to our community wellbeing initiative
  • Remote work & Location Independence
  • Be your own boss
  • Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
  • Be a part of an online community



TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com




If you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam17@telusinternational.ai

Title: (Senior) Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Our highly ambitious team around serial entrepreneur Mario Kohle is supported by experienced investors like Alexander Samwer (Picus Capital) and Lukasz Gadowski (Team Europe, Delivery Hero). In addition, we were able to bring Princeville Climate Technology (advised and funded among others by Leonardo DiCaprio) and Peter Rive (SolarCity) on board. As the first green unicorn in Germany, we see it as our duty to continuously drive forward our mission of green energy for all. Be part of our success story and change the world by joining us!

Job Description

Develop a deep understanding of our end-to-end business model.
Develop analytical infrastructure by designing, implementing, and optimizing the BI capabilities for either our HR or New Venture Teams using Tableau/Python/SQL/Azure/Excel.
Support senior management and business teams with technical and statistical analysis around key business drivers.
You create data-driven analysis with the goal to formulate effective strategies and recommendations for action.
You see eye to eye with all internal stakeholders, understand their business needs, and actively look for innovative solutions to their problems
You create analytical output and visualizations in Tableau/Power BI/SQL that enables automated reporting and you help them with your deep knowledge of the underlying data


Qualifications

You have at least a bachelor's degree in a quantitative (Physics, Math, Computer Science, etc.), statistical (Machine Learning, Data Science, Statistics, etc.), or economic (econometrics, etc.) field
You have professional experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst (min. 2 years)
If you have worked with HR or Finance Teams before, it's a big plus
You have experience working in a fast-growing, high pace environment like consulting or a Start-Up
You have professional experience with creating analysis and visualizations of large and complex data sets with the purpose of gaining business insights
You have 3+ years experience in SQL
You have worked with data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI
You like to work with a multitude of stakeholders and you manage to turn their problems into quantitative solutions
Ideally, you have worked with Azure before
You speak English fluently


Additional Information

The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Direct impact on our corporate success and exciting career opportunities: leave your footprint.
Close cooperation with the management team while shaping Enpal’s tech DNA: you will be part of our first Tech Team.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A great work environment in our Berlin office, or focused work from home - you decide.


At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d) Credit Risk
Description:
Daten sind Ihr Werkzeug, Analysen Ihr Schlüssel und Sie bereiten beides so auf, dass es jeder versteht? Sie erwarten - wie unsere mehr als 9 Millionen Kunden - dass digitales Banking einfach, persönlich und intelligent ist? Perfekt! Nehmen Sie den Schlüssel zu unserem Kundenverständnis in die Hand und sorgen Sie dafür, dass unsere Marke hält, was sie verspricht!




Ihre Aufgaben:




Sie sorgen dafür, dass unser Datenbedarf sowohl quantitativ als auch qualitativ gedeckt ist. Dafür arbeiten Sie eng mit Credit Risk Data Scientists und Ingenieuren aus dem gesamten Unternehmen zusammen, um unseren Datenbedarf sowie die Dateninfrastruktur und den -rahmen zu verstehen, die Anforderungen zu definieren und Lösungen zu entwerfen. Darüber hinaus entwickeln Sie effiziente und automatisierte Datenqualitätskontrollen und verfolgen die Ursachen möglicher Probleme. Dank Ihnen und der Risikodatenmodelle, zu denen Sie durch Bereinigung, Prüfung und Umwandlung der Kreditrisikodaten beitragen, können wir vorhersagen, was auf uns zukommt. Unterstützung schreiben Sie groß und wir können auf Sie zählen, sowohl z. B. bei globalen und lokalen Kreditrisikodatenprojekten als auch bei der Pflege der Dokumentation und Definitionen von Kreditrisikodaten. Nicht zuletzt unterstützen Sie das Team durch die Bereitstellung modernster Datenanalysen bei fortgeschrittenen Geschäftsproblemen.




Ihr Profil:




Master-Abschluss in Data Science, Statistik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Ingenieurwesen, Finanzen, Mathematik oder einem verwandten quantitativen Bereich
Erfahrung im Bereich Kreditrisiko sind von Vorteil
Gutes Verständnis von Datenbanken, Datenstrukturen, ETL- / ELT-Design und Testmethoden
Fit in SQL und Python; SAS-Kenntnisse sind ein Plus
Know-how in Datenorchestrierung, Datentransformation und BI-Tools (z. B. Looker) ist wünschenswert
Analytische Denkweise, ausgeprägte Problemlösungs- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten gepaart mit Zuverlässigkeit
Fließendes Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift




Wir Bieten Zahlreiche Benefits




Betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Vermögenswirksame Leistungen, regionales Jobticket & Bike LeasING, Betriebsrestaurant
Mobiles Arbeiten je nach Position und Abteilung im Rahmen von betrieblichen, regulatorischen und gesetzlichen Anforderungen, individuelle Arbeitszeitmodelle, Sabbatical, Bezuschussung von Pflege- & Kinderbetreuungskosten
Eigene Budgets für persönliche Entwicklung und Gesundheit plus persönliches Ausstattungsbudget für Ihren mobilen Arbeitsplatz

Title: ERP Data Analyst
Description:
sennder is Europe’s leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We are a growing team looking for a Data Analyst to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. You would join our Finance System Technology team in the Berlin office.

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst you’ll work on interesting responsibilities like solving ERP technology-specific problems that span across order-to-cash, procure-to-pay, travel and expense management and its core accounting and finance process areas. You will run analysis that are carried both by the system and the end users, spot on gaps and discuss it with the stakeholders to bring improvement and change. You’ll be collaborating closely with ERP Product Owners, Consultants, Developers, Architects, Engineers, Product Analysts, Support and business users across Europe to develop a suitable solution to digitally transform the day-to-day life of the finance and accounting department of sennder.

IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL…


Lead and facilitate business requirements' session to understand business process problems and document business requirements in Customer Data Management, Order-to-Cash, Supplier Data Management PR/PO-to-Pay, Travel & Expense Management and other accounting processes (Intercompany, Tax, Fixed Asset Management, Revenue Recognition)
Develop business process solutions proposals, prepare flowcharts (Swim lane, concept map, root-case, SWOT) and others presentation such as AS-IS/TO-BE processes
Conduct qualitative/quantitative analysis by collecting data from all internal and external sources and identify the most efficient means of satisfying user needs
Involve in testing and works functional, technical and support teams to continuously understand requirements, defects and end users issues
Collaborate with Services and Support management to ensure timely, appropriate implementation of processes to drive corporate initiatives and services results
Write epics (features) and stories (user specifications) in the manner understandable to bridge the gap between the business and finance systems technology team
Highly involved in the integration between upstream systems (in-house, Salesforce, other systems)) and NetSuite as well as the NetSuite ERP expansion by working closely with NetSuite Product Owner, Developer, Project Manager and the business stakeholders
Bridge the gap between technical needs and the requirements of users including providing detailed product requirements for implementation of changes to our systems


PREFERABLY YOU HAVE…


3 to 5 years prior working experience as an Accountant and/or with an accounting and finance team and passionate towards ERP or finance systems digital transformation or 1 to 3 years prior working experience as a Business Analyst, Process Owner or System Analyst
A relevant degree such as Bachelor's and Associate Degree in Computer Science, Business, Education, Business/Administration, Information Systems, Technical, Information Technology, Finance, Accounting, Engineering
Good hands-on experience on Excel and SQL or experience using BI tool like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills - ability to develop hypotheses, understand and interpret data within the context of the business solve problems and distil data into actionable recommendation
A working experience as an ERP user, such as SAP, NetSuite, JD Edwards or other ERP system. If you have happened to used NetSuite, it will definitely be a plus, otherwise, willingness to learn NetSuite is needed
Demonstrated attention to detail, strong analytical, organization and communication skills with a high degree of both technical and business acumen with excellent judgement and problem-solving skills
A recent experience in implementation of ERP to tech/digital companies and/or IT Project Management experience or any licenses like PMI-BA, APICS, GSEC, CBAP, I/II, FSCM, PMP, CAPM, PMI, E1, CPIM is a plus


ABOUT Sennder

sennder is moving trucks with the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at unparalleled quality. Through our proprietary transportation operating system, built by our in-house tech teams, we not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Get to know us, our culture, green business, funding history, and more on our blog here.

What You Can Expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual’s potential for all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit, respect, and kindness to build trusted relationships across teams. Learn more on our career site.


A fast-growing, start-up-oriented international team of 1000+ people with 65+ nationalities spread across 8 country offices with English as our company language.
Continuous feedback and bi-annual review process for personal development, professional growth, and career opportunities. We also use “Objectives and Key Results” for company goals.
A structured promotion process, providing everyone with fair and transparent career growth.
Learning and development opportunities on the job and through conversations with your manager.
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues, formally and informally, digitally or in-person (when allowed), through regular team events, company get-togethers, and partnership events with other companies and local organizers.
Office first work policy (three days a week), that complies with local COVID-19 restrictions and policies. We also provide flex/hybrid remote working options.
When in office: unlimited snacks, drinks, and fruits.
All interviews are currently conducted on a remote basis.


Please send your application in English and help us reduce negative unconscious bias by leaving out your picture, age, address, and other unnecessary information in your CV. We only want to know the merits on which you’d be great for this role.

If you have any questions or problems please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. We do not accept applications via email.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders)
Description:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders), who wants to join our core BI and reporting team of 4 members. As a part of this team, you develop and manage highly frequented central dashboards across multiple platforms and own innovative data products, like the vendor analytics portal.




Your role




You are part of the central BI and Reporting team, responsible for the internal reporting landscape and owner of several internal and external data products
You will work closely with a large variety of stakeholders to develop dashboards with actionable insights, automate essential business processes and collaborate with data analysts, engineers and scientists, developing individual solutions for data usage and consumption
As our data advocate, you are responsible for increasing data literacy across flaconi by offering courses for new joiners and mentor colleagues
Furthermore, you inspire the team members with best practices and/or modern approaches to data visualization and open new revenue streams by continuously developing data products for external suppliers
You proactively identify the needs of business stakeholders and deliver actionable insights and support in generating insights for business partners and c-level
You also continuously improve/develope the reporting landscape, work on a large variety of business reports and become an advocate for data literacy across the entire company.
Your profile




At least 4 years of experience as a BI Analyst, at best previous experience in E-commerce or digital services
Expert in dashboarding/ BI reporting, good conceptual know-how of data visualization and storytelling
Strong knowledge of Tableau or similar data visualization tools
At least 3 years experience in SQL and/or Python on a moderate level, knowledge of Apache Superset is a plus
Experience in working with multiple stakeholders across different teams in an e-commerce environment is a plus
Good written and verbal English proficiency. German is a plus
What we offer you




Full transparency: For this role, we have a salary band between 50000€ and 63000€ gross per year. The salary that we will offer you will always be within this span and is based on the skills that you show during the recruitment process.
Our employees matter to us: We offer you a permanent contract, a BVG ticket and relocation support for international applicants moving to Germany.
Work-life balance: 29 vacation days, flexible working hours, up to three days of working from home a week and in specific cases the option to work 100 % remotely; the possibility of a paid sabbatical.
flaconi Academy: Actively shape your own career path by taking advantage of our internal and external training opportunities.
We care about your well being: We want to support you also during difficult times. For this, we offer you and your close relatives counseling sessions with mental health professionals.
flaconi Fitness: a wide range of sports options & discounts on memberships.
Family first: Our “emergency-daycare” is there for you in out-of-the-ordinary situations to look after your child on site at our office.
Thinking about tomorrow together: flaconi subsidizes your savings contribution to the company pension scheme with an additional 20%.
A comfortable working space with everything you need: High end technical equipment, fruits and drinks, no dress code and dogs are welcome in our office!
Other perks: Great discounts in our online shop as well with our partner companies, cool team events & company parties!
About flaconi




With more than three million active customers, flaconi is one of Germany’s leading online beauty and self-care retailers. The online shop’s extensive portfolio consists of almost 1000 national and international brands and 50.000 products. From drugstore over organic cosmetics to premium and luxury, the online shop covers all product segments and offers a diverse selection of products for a unique and daily self-care routine.




Founded in 2011 as one of the first online perfumeries, flaconi is honored to work with more than 700 people from 60 different nations at the flaconi headquarters in Berlin-Charlottenburg and its fulfillment center in Halle.




With the Flaconi Concept Store in the historic Tuteur House in Berlin, flaconi is also represented in the stationary trade and offers its customers an exquisite range of niche and premium brands as well as an integrated hair salon.




flaconi has received numerous awards and is also represented in Austria, Poland and France.




Shape our company’s success with us and apply now online! We look forward to receiving your complete application documents, including your earliest starting date. Please direct your application to Pia Niemuth (Talent Acquisition).
Show more Show less
HTML:
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders), who wants to join our core BI and reporting team of 4 members. As a part of this team, you develop and manage highly frequented central dashboards across multiple platforms and own innovative data products, like the vendor analytics portal.


Your role


  • You are part of the central BI and Reporting team, responsible for the internal reporting landscape and owner of several internal and external data products
  • You will work closely with a large variety of stakeholders to develop dashboards with actionable insights, automate essential business processes and collaborate with data analysts, engineers and scientists, developing individual solutions for data usage and consumption
  • As our data advocate, you are responsible for increasing data literacy across flaconi by offering courses for new joiners and mentor colleagues
  • Furthermore, you inspire the team members with best practices and/or modern approaches to data visualization and open new revenue streams by continuously developing data products for external suppliers
  • You proactively identify the needs of business stakeholders and deliver actionable insights and support in generating insights for business partners and c-level
  • You also continuously improve/develope the reporting landscape, work on a large variety of business reports and become an advocate for data literacy across the entire company.
Your profile


  • At least 4 years of experience as a BI Analyst, at best previous experience in E-commerce or digital services
  • Expert in dashboarding/ BI reporting, good conceptual know-how of data visualization and storytelling
  • Strong knowledge of Tableau or similar data visualization tools
  • At least 3 years experience in SQL and/or Python on a moderate level, knowledge of Apache Superset is a plus
  • Experience in working with multiple stakeholders across different teams in an e-commerce environment is a plus
  • Good written and verbal English proficiency. German is a plus
What we offer you


  • Full transparency: For this role, we have a salary band between 50000€ and 63000€ gross per year. The salary that we will offer you will always be within this span and is based on the skills that you show during the recruitment process.
  • Our employees matter to us: We offer you a permanent contract, a BVG ticket and relocation support for international applicants moving to Germany.
  • Work-life balance: 29 vacation days, flexible working hours, up to three days of working from home a week and in specific cases the option to work 100 % remotely; the possibility of a paid sabbatical.

  • We care about your well being: We want to support you also during difficult times. For this, we offer you and your close relatives counseling sessions with mental health professionals.
  • flaconi Fitness: a wide range of sports options & discounts on memberships.
  • Family first: Our “emergency-daycare” is there for you in out-of-the-ordinary situations to look after your child on site at our office.
  • Thinking about tomorrow together: flaconi subsidizes your savings contribution to the company pension scheme with an additional 20%.
  • A comfortable working space with everything you need: High end technical equipment, fruits and drinks, no dress code and dogs are welcome in our office!
  • Other perks: Great discounts in our online shop as well with our partner companies, cool team events & company parties!
About flaconi


With more than three million active customers, flaconi is one of Germany’s leading online beauty and self-care retailers. The online shop’s extensive portfolio consists of almost 1000 national and international brands and 50.000 products. From drugstore over organic cosmetics to premium and luxury, the online shop covers all product segments and offers a diverse selection of products for a unique and daily self-care routine.


Founded in 2011 as one of the first online perfumeries, flaconi is honored to work with more than 700 people from 60 different nations at the flaconi headquarters in Berlin-Charlottenburg and its fulfillment center in Halle.


With the Flaconi Concept Store in the historic Tuteur House in Berlin, flaconi is also represented in the stationary trade and offers its customers an exquisite range of niche and premium brands as well as an integrated hair salon.


flaconi has received numerous awards and is also represented in Austria, Poland and France.


Shape our company’s success with us and apply now online! We look forward to receiving your complete application documents, including your earliest starting date. Please direct your application to Pia Niemuth (Talent Acquisition).

Title: People Data & Compensation Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
We are looking for a skilled People Data & Compensation Analyst to join our ride at Blacklane's People & Culture team. You will use tools, data, and analytical thinking to provide clear and constructive reward & data insights advice internally, in order to ensure Blacklane stays competitive and attractive to talents.

Your Responsibilities

Provide support and assist with a range of total rewards initiatives including salary band review benchmarking, remuneration, bonus and long-term incentive schemes incl. Employee Stock Option Program (ESOP), pay equity analysis and so on.
Support and assist with the design and the implementation of a yearly feedback cycle.
Support to train and guide People & Culture colleagues and people managers about various compensation guidelines.
Review and develop current benefit schemes at a global scale. Collaborate closely with the People Operations team to implement the enhanced benefits if any.
Work closely with the People Business Partner team, business leads, recruitment team and relevant stakeholders to build up and implement insightful reports and dashboard systems at Blacklane.
Analyze people data and provide insights per request where necessary.
Continue to review current systems/ processes/ documentations and improve it continuously.


About You

Strong analytic background. Ideally you have already solid knowledge of Compensation & benefits programs, trends and practices, preferably global exposure and people data
An advanced proficiency in G-suit, particularly Google sheets. You are capable of manipulating and presenting data accurately and efficiently.
Analytical and critical thinker. With your solution-oriented approach, you are comfortable analyzing and communicating complex concepts, understanding trends, and formulating recommendations for actions based on the analysis.
Demonstrated ability to design conceptually and implement people programs in scale-ups.
Innovative and flexible. You are the champion of staying up to date with global HR trends. You are comfortable working in ambiguity and creating solutions that achieve time-sensitive goals.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy for both numerical and written work.
Great communication and interpersonal skills. You communicate clearly with different audiences by combining narratives and data. Fluent English is required.


MORE THAN A JOB:

Blacklane is a scale-up started in 2011, founded by Jens Wohltorf and Frank Steuer who wanted to create the first global chauffeur service. We started by filling chauffeurs' 'empty leg' journeys and have grown with our partners to over €100 million in annual revenue (pre-pandemic). Backed by Daimler and other investors in Germany, Japan, Switzerland, and the UAE, we're now a trusted brand within corporate travel.

We believe in ethical business practices and have a strong company culture. Responding to the pandemic, we've successfully managed the crises and retained our talented crew!

Continuous Learning: We believe that open and actionable feedback is the essential component of continuous development. Set your personal development plan and take an active role in our internal learning communities to progress your career.
Flexible Working: Even the most ambitious Blacklaner needs some time to unwind. Find out what works for you and your team with flexible working hours and home office days (working from home is the new normal).
Become Part of the Crew: Get to know your fellow Blacklaners through our regular team socials. Our success comes from a collaboration of more than 350 people from 70 nations and we are looking for more exceptional people to join us!
Employee Stock Options Plan: We want all Blacklaners to benefit from the company's success, so every employee gets virtual stock options.
Fair Remuneration: We've banded salary levels and matched them to the local costs of living, meaning you're always paid fairly and you know that the rest of the crew is too.
Sustainability: We care for both people and the planet, having launched the mobility's industry first global carbon offset scheme in 2017. Blacklane has pledged to deliver 75% of its journeys in electric vehicles by 2025.
Equal Opportunity: We are committed to inclusion and diversity. A company is only as strong as its crew, so we developed a work environment that is inclusive, inspiring and open. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.


Upgrade your career with Blacklane

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (w/x/m)
Description:
Puls Project is at the verge of an exhilarating journey. Our mission is to create the entire financial world in one platform for German small to midsize enterprises and entrepreneurs, across all sectors and industries.We are building a platform that will enable the client to have money, where the client needs it just at the right time when they actually need it. The aim is to free up their time to make sure it can be spent on growing their business, not just managing to survive. Puls connects all your bank accounts in one place, business as well as private. The client will be able to have an overview of their financial history, as well as actually get forecasting for their cash flow with that data. You will be able to make all payments in one place, instant and easy. And what if money gets tight? The future with Puls will give the opportunity to get business loans for SME without the hassle of a complicated bank checkup. At Puls Technologies GmbH you can expect a high caliber work environment. You work directly with the founders - an energetic team that is highly motivated to create impact in the world of German SMEs.

Tasks

Review and validate customer data as it’s collected
Oversee the deployment of data to the data warehouse
Monitor analytics and metrics results
Implement new data analysis methodologies
Review customer files to ensure integrity of data collection and utilization
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies
Collaborating with team members for the purpose of collecting data and executing the company’s mission


Requirements

Data modeling
Data mining
Business analysis
Database management and reporting
Strong Microsoft Excel and VBA skills
Critical-thinking and problem-solving
nice to have, but not obligatory:


Tableau and data visualization, German

Benefits

You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart people in the heart of Berlin - City West. Come and join us on this journey!

Get in touch with us now.

Title: Data Engineer - Marketing
Description:
Data Engineer - Marketing Services - Berlin, Germany




Cititec are exclusively partnered with one of Berlin's most popular and heavily funded FinTech's to scale out their data & engineering functions.




The app is currently used by millions of customers around the world and it has become a pivotal product especially in the European market.




Due to their continued success & rise they are looking to further expand their data team across data engineering, analytics engineering, data science, product & growth analytics.




With your team, you will take full responsibility for the Marketing data and projects centered around Attribution, ROAS, CLV etc and aim to provide an excellent data foundation for all marketing services.




Requirements:

2 Years experience in a Data Engineering role (or similar)

SQL

Python

Previous experience within marketing, tracking would be a big plus




Benefits:

Generous Stock Options

Relocation and Visa Assistance




Hybrid Working Model

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Datum: 21.01.2023

Standort:

Düsseldorf, NW, DE, 40474 Teltow, BB, DE, 14513 Hamburg, HH, DE, 22297 Nürnberg, BY, DE, 90449 München, BY, DE, 80992

Unternehmen: GER - Telefónica Germany GmbH & Co. OHG

Vertragsart:Vollzeit, unbefristet

Standort:München, Düsseldorf, Hamburg, Nürnberg, Berlin (Teltow)

Eintritt:ab nächstmöglichem Zeitpunkt

Working anywhere. Wir arbeiten dort, wo es am produktivsten ist. Darum hast Du, nach erfolgreichem Bewerbungsprozess, die Möglichkeit deutschlandweit zu arbeiten. Bei Telefónica setzen wir auf ein flexibles Hybridmodell, das sowohl die Vorteile von Remote- als auch Vor-Ort-Arbeiten angemessen berücksichtigt. Du wirst entsprechend Deinem Wohnort, dem nächsten Telefónica Standort zugeordnet. Weitere Details besprechen wir mit Dir im Bewerbungsprozess.

Wer wir sind

Wir sind O2 Telefónica – mit unseren Mobilfunkmarken verbinden wir Millionen von Menschen und bieten unseren Kunden mobile Freiheit in der digitalen Welt. Darüber hinaus gestalten wir als führender Telekommunikationsanbieter maßgeblich die Digitalisierung in Deutschland mit. Unsere rund 7.400 Mitarbeiter hierzulande treiben die Transformation jeden Tag ein Stück voran – auch in unserem eigenen Unternehmen. Telefónica zählt zu den Top-Arbeitgebern in Deutschland und ist Teil des globalen Telekommunikationskonzerns Telefónica S.A. mit mehr als 110.000 engagierten Mitarbeitern weltweit.

Werde auch Du Teil unseres einzigartigen Teams und lass uns gemeinsam etwas bewegen!

Was Dich erwartet

Du analysierst bestehende und neue Geschäftsstrukturen/ -vorfälle, zum Beispiel Kundensegmente, Produktsegmente oder Angebotsstrukturen
Du entwickelst eigenständig Vorschläge, um den Wertbeitrag unseres Geschäfts zu optimieren. Dabei helfen dir deine Analyse-Ergebnisse, der Blick auf den Markt und die kommerziellen Rahmenbedingungen sowie deine Fähigkeit, Präsentationen für das Top Management zu erstellen
Das Mitwirken bei unseren Planungen - z.B. langfristige Geschäftspläne, Budgets und Forecasts – gehört auch zu deiner Rolle
All das gelingt dir durch deine proaktive Zusammenarbeit mit Experten aus den Bereichen Marketing, Sales, Controlling, Strategie, Business Excellence und vielen mehr


Was Du mitbringst

Studium oder vergleichbar in Fachrichtung Betriebswirtschaft, Volkswirtschaft oder ähnlichem
Mindestens 5 Jahre einschlägige Berufserfahrung in analytisch geprägten und/oder Management-beratenden Bereichen
Fähigkeit komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich darzustellen und zu präsentieren
Sehr gutes Zahlenverständnis und analytisches Denkvermögen
Sehr eigenverantwortliche, strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Kenntnisse in den Fachgebieten Mobilfunk und/oder Festnetz
Gute Deutsch- und Englisch-Kenntnisse


Was wir Dir bieten

Modernes, flexibles Arbeitsumfeld: Du hast die Möglichkeit, in Absprache mit der Führungskraft, im Home-Office zu arbeiten oder im Büro, mit kostenlosem Wasser, Tee oder Kaffee.

Weiterbildung & Entwicklung: Alles, was Du für Deinen individuellen Wachstumsweg brauchst. Mit einem persönlichem Entwicklungsplan, Learning Journeys und der Möglichkeit von Job Rotations, erreichst Du mit uns Deine Ziele – entsprechend unserem Leitgedanken „connect, learn and move2grow".

Finanzielle Vorteile:Ein Smartphone zur dienstlichen und privaten Nutzung sowie die Möglichkeit über ein Guthaben auch Partner, Freunde und Familie zu versorgen, ist für uns selbstverständlich. Darüber hinaus profitierst Du von einer Vielzahl an Corporate Benefits.

Gesundheit: Unser „Feel Good“ Programm sorgt dafür, dass es Dir gut geht. Unter anderem bieten wir Fitnesskurse, Ernährungsberatungen und Angebote zur Verbesserung der Ergonomie am Arbeitsplatz sowie der Work-Life-Balance an.

Soziales Engagement: Wir engagieren uns auch außerhalb der Unternehmensgrenzen. Du kannst im Rahmen von Volunteering Days / Holidays oder Spendenläufen soziale Projekte unterstützen.

Wie Du dich bewirbst und was Du noch wissen solltest

Überzeuge uns mit Deinem aussagekräftigen Lebenslauf sowie dazugehörigen Zeugnissen. Ein Motivationsschreiben oder Anschreiben brauchst Du bei uns nicht. Bitte beachte, dass Bewerbungen nur über unser Bewerberportal möglich sind und Bewerbungen per E-Mail nicht berücksichtigt werden können.

Du hast Fragen zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess und Interesse an weiteren Informationen zu der Stelle? Dann wende dich bitte an unser Talent Operations Team (de-recruiting@telefonica.com).

Bei gleicher Eignung werden Bewerber:innen mit einer Schwerbehinderung bevorzugt berücksichtigt. Alle Geschlechter sind gleichermaßen willkommen.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Working Student/Intern) (m/w/d)
Description:
RECARE is one of the leading digital startups in the German healthcare industry, on a mission to transform healthcare through its platform for digital care coordination. We search, find and coordinate service capacities so that hospitals can focus on their patients rather than processes.

Within a very short time, Recare was able to onboard over 750 acute care and rehabilitation clinics as well as over 14 000 other service providers on its platform. Renowned hospitals and hospital groups such as Vivantes, Sana Kliniken AG, München Klinik, Hannover Medical School, and Essen University Hospital are among Recare's customers, as well as major health insurances such as TK, BKK and Barmer.

Example product use case - Rehabilitation

When a patient needs to be transferred to a rehabilitation clinic after a hospital stay, hospital staff currently have to:

fax (yes, fax...) forms to the patient's insurance to ask whether they are eligible for rehabilitation
find an available clinic offering the needed services (generally done by calling many and sharing patient data via fax).


With RECARE, hospital staff upload all relevant patient information in one place with the click of a button directly from the hospital’s information system, and can share it securely with all parties involved. An automated search is then started to find an available spot within our network of rehabilitation clinics.

Rehabilitation is just one of our use cases, we also cover care, transport, medical supplies and hospital transfers. Our product combines a SaaS with a marketplace to automate time-intensive tasks and free up hospital resources for patients rather than processes.

Aufgaben

How you will make an impact as a working student/intern in business intelligence:

Our teams are constantly using data products, be it for reporting to customers, managing sales and onboarding pipelines, reporting and communicating internally or simply keeping an eye on the marketplace’s performance metrics. As a BI Analyst, you will be supporting the BI team in designing, building and maintaining such products.

You improve and maintain our Looker instance.
You incorporate new data sources to our warehouse.
You collaborate with technical teams on data related projects.
You build dashboards to support our operations and product teams.
You use data to identify trends and root causes of business problems.
You participate in AGILE ceremonies and planning sessions as an active member of the BI team; you provide input in process optimisations and support addressing stakeholder feedback.


Your future tools

Database/Warehouse: Postgres/Snowflake
ETL: Stitch/DBT
Visualisation: Looker
Analytics: Jupyter


Qualifikation

Before anything else : this is not a Machine Learning position, your interest should lie in analytical and data visualisation tasks, we will of course consider applicants with a ML background if they demonstrated experience and interest in the latter.

What you will need to succeed as a working student/intern in business intelligence:

You are currently pursuing a Master's degree in university or business school with a quantitative focus (computer science, economics, engineering, mathematics, statistics or related field).
You have some prior experience working in the data analytics fields either as an intern or working student
You have a good eye for detail and you possess the ability to work and solve problems autonomously, to think critically and to be able to produce high quality analysis which create real value for stakeholders.
You have experience in using SQL and data visualisation tools (Looker, Tableau, etc.) and are motivated to develop your skill set.
You have a good understanding of data modelling and descriptive and inferential statistics.
You have solid communication and collaboration skills across technical and non-technical audiences.
You have an excellent command of English both in writing and speaking; German would be a plus.
Working Student : You can work 20 hours per week / Intern : You are available for 6 months


Benefits

This is what you can expect from us as a working student/intern in business intelligence:

Work with purpose - what you do has a concrete impact on healthcare professionals and patients.
Develop both professionally and personally while gaining insights into many parts of a start-up as part of a cross-functional team.
A motivated, international team that fosters a start-up atmosphere with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes.
Flexible remote and/or on-site work
A monthly mobility budget with Rydes to use on many transportation means (BVG, Uber, DB or FlixBus, Swapfiets)
An Urban Sports Club membership (M), to take care of your physical and mental health.
13,5 days of holidays + 1 additional day on your birthday


To apply, please provide your CV and a short motivational statement

Title: BI DATA ANALYST / BUSINESS ANALYST* SCHWERPUNKT MICROSOFT
Description:
BI DATA ANALYST / BUSINESS ANALYST* SCHWERPUNKT MICROSOFT




DAS SIND WIR
Do IT yourself ist unser Credo. Um den ständig neuen Anforderungen an unsere IT gerecht zu werden, gibt es die NEW YORKER Information Services International (ISI), in der wir alle Kernkompetenzen inhouse halten. Über 200 Mitarbeiter in zehn Fachabteilungen wirken aktiv bei der Prozessgestaltung mit und bringen alle IT-Themen voran - von A wie Application Management über K wie Kassensysteme bis W wie Windows Server.




DAS IST DER JOB

Definieren von BI-Anwendungsfällen, Kennzahlensystemen, Berichten und Dashboards als konstruktiver Sparringspartner für unsere Fachbereiche und das Controlling
Entwicklungen im MS BI-Stack: Umsetzung von DAX-Abfragen, Kennzahlen, Berichten und Dashboards in SSAS, SSRS und PowerBI
Ziel- und Nutzenorientiertes Aufbereiten und Visualisieren der Analyseergebnisse
Selbständiges Durchführen von (Ad-Hoc)-Analysen für unsere Geschäftsführung und die Fachbereiche
Strukturiertes Analysieren der Datenqualität der Unternehmensdaten und Identifizieren von Optimierungspotential
Umsetzen von BI-Projekten in einem interdisziplinären Team




DAS ÜBERZEUGT UNS

Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, BWL mit Schwerpunkt IT, Ökonometrie oder ein vergleichbarer Studiengang
Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in einem BI-Beratungsumfeld oder Handelsunternehmen in einer vergleichbaren Position
Gutes Verständnis für Geschäftsprozesse und Daten, idealerweise schon im Handelsumfeld
Gute Kenntnisse in MSSQL, SSAS (DAX), SSRS und PowerBI
Solide Kenntnisse im MS BI Stack (SSDB, SSIS) sowie BI-Architektur-Modellen, Patterns und Vorgehensmodellen
Fundierte quantitative und analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Erfahrung im Umgang mit Kunden aus der IT und Nicht-IT
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit agilen Methoden im BI Umfeld
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Dienstleistungsverständnis, Kommunikationsstärke und Hands-on-Mentalität




DAS SPRICHT FÜR UNS
Als inhabergeführtes Modeunternehmen mit weltweit über 1.200 Filialen vereint NEW YORKER die flachen Hierarchien eines Familienbetriebs mit der Internationalität eines Großkonzerns. Kurze Entscheidungswege und viel Spielraum für eigene Ideen ergeben ein einzigartiges Arbeitsumfeld, in dem du dein Talent gewinnbringend zum Einsatz bringen kannst.




*Dein Geschlecht spielt für uns keine Rolle, NEW YORKER ist offen für alle Menschen – Hauptsache, du passt zu uns! Zur leichteren Lesbarkeit verwenden wir bei personenbezogenen Begriffen im Text die männliche Form.




SO SIND WIR ERREICHBAR
NEW YORKER Information Services International GmbH




Ansprechpartner: Karyna Gembarovska | Junior Recruiting Specialist




P +49 30 236 2839 - 101




www.newyorker.de/Jobs




Redaktionell empfohlener externer Inhalt

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Req ID: 221110




Competitive salary | fully remote




At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.




NTT DATA Services is currently looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) for our growing team in Germany.




Duties And Responsibilities




Responsible for exporting and compiling data; analyzing statistics to drive strategic business solutions
Support field escalation and Webex spaces to identify possible Reporting, Routing and/or IVR issues
Support CAET and Service Technology in establishing Test Plans for Deployment validation including regression testing




Required Skills And Education




several years of relevant experience in Data Analytics
knowledge in Advanced Office Suite, Data Analytics & Contact Center Technology and Tools
Oracle, SQL, Data Analysis and data presentation
Daily access and data extracts from IVR, Genesys and Contact Center Tools, Support Internal End User inquiries
Tableau experience
Advanced Excel experience




Benefits




Our people are the most critical component of our long-term success and their health and wellbeing are our priority. You will enjoy a comprehensive, locally competitive benefits package.




About NTT DATA Services




NTT DATA Services is a global business and IT services provider specializing in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services. We are part of the NTT family of companies, a partner to 85 % of the Fortune 100.




NTT DATA Services is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants without regarding to race, color, religion, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter so that we may connect you with the appropriate team.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst | Finance Industry | £40,000 - £50,000







💵 Sector: Finance

🌍 Location: Hybrid with offices in London

🏆 Multiple Awards

📈 Steep Learning Curve







Are you a Junior Data Analyst with an interest in the finance Industry ? Do you have passion for combining your analytical mindset with your ability to speak to clients and deal with complex stakeholders?







🌟 Then this is the Junior Data Analyst role for you 🌟







I am partnering with an industry leader in the Capital Markets space who have been a part of over 1000 corporate transactions across the largest 500 companies across the globe. They deliver leading market intelligence, offer insights to consult on mergers and help make sensible investment decisions all over the world !







As you can imagine a company of this size collects a lot of financial data across all their clients and the markets which is difficult at times to interpret. This company is looking for a Junior Data Analyst with knowledge of the financial markets to help them make sense and to unlock these commercial insights 🔐







What is in it for you?







✔️ Work with challenging data sets using SQL and Python

✔️ Work in one of London’s most impressive Finance companies

✔️ Deal with complex stakeholders and clients from all over the world

✔️ Take on a steep technical and commercial learning curve







If this sounds like the Junior Data Analyst role for you then apply now !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our product is all about collaboration and innovation. So are our people. We’re a small team, but we’ve got a big vision: to build a brand-new infrastructure for operational risk management. It’s not easy. We’re redefining the way some of the world’s biggest financial services companies and banks work with data. There are a lot of challenges – but a lot of opportunities to think and act creatively, too.

Backed by banks (JP Morgan, Citi, Barclays, Lloyds, BNP) and ratings agencies, Acin helps banks objectively manage their risk control landscape. Based on a network of peers, Acin’s data protocols connect a bank’s risk control data across their firm and industry leading to greater cost savings, and creating huge efficiency savings across the bank both in front and back-office operations.

The role:

The Data Analyst role within the Data Operations team is instrumental in delivering value to our customers. In this role you will connect customer data to the Acin Network, assisted by senior colleagues and while building a good knowledge of what’s important in a risk and control framework. You will also be involved with ensuring that Acin’s Network data continues to represent a consensus view of customers’ risk and control data.

The Data Operations team is responsible for delivering the data that drives the Acin Platform. The team connects customer risk and control data to the Acin Network, which customers interact with via the Platform and during meetings with the team’s subject matter experts. The team defines and maintains Acin’s consensus-based risk and control inventories, defines and applies Acin’s data connectivity protocols, maintains the business rules used to build Network consensus and ensures all Acin data is of the highest quality.

Responsibilities:

Connect customer data to the Acin network via Acin’s data matching protocols and tooling
Collaborate closely with senior analysts and the firm’s subject matter experts to deliver more accurate results and grow your own knowledge
Work with Acin’s product and Engineering teams to facilitate faster and better data processing
Support the team’s Data Specialists in preparing materials for customer meetings
Ensure consistent and quality application of Acin’s technical standards to our core risk and control content and beyond


Requirements

You have 1-3 years’ experience in a data focussed role
You can work in a fast-pace FinTech environment
You're a self-starter with a down-to-earth approach and a high level of pragmatism and proactivity
You have strong organisational skills, with impeccable attention to detail
Can work under time pressure
You would enjoy being part of the Acin team – we're looking for someone who is flexible, supportive, collaborative and will contribute positively to our strong team dynamic and culture from day one
You have strong MS Office skills, particularly Excel
You have concise written and verbal communication skills


Benefits

This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing, dynamic fintech that is creating huge momentum in the market. Alongside a friendly, dynamic, and inclusive culture, we offer…

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Share options – we like to offer our employees a stake in our success
A company pension to help save for your future
Enhanced Private Health Insurance for you and your family
Life insurance, including access to their Smart Health services such as unlimited access to an online GP as well as a range of other health and wellbeing experts
Enhanced maternity and paternity leave policies
Perkbox - a discount platform and wellbeing resource centre.
Employee Assistance Program – access to free counselling sessions and support through Perkbox.
Cycle to work scheme
A laptop and home office equipment – whatever you need to do your best work
Hybrid working options. We currently we have offices in Farnborough and Central London.
Regular company events and socials – we call these events InterfAcin
A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together. Our core company values are get up and go, keep going, and always further.


Acin is an equal opportunity employer. We value a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, sex, colour, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation and gender identity or expression.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
GoHenry is a London and New York-based fintech company that pioneered the youth fintech and financial education category. We are on a mission to make every kid smart with money and to delight our community of 2 million parents, kids, and teens with innovative, market-leading tools to help parents raise financially healthy kids.

GoHenry offers a debit card and app for kids and teens and companion apps for the family, with in-app tools for sending money, automating allowance, managing chores, setting savings goals, giving to charity, and in-app financial education lessons where kids can watch videos, take quizzes and earn points & badges. This is all designed to help kids and teens build good money habits that will last a lifetime.

The Tech team at GoHenry is looking to recruit a Mid-Level Data Analyst to closely work with the Growth Product teams and other areas in the business. We are a rapidly growing fintech company and are looking for a self starter looking to make an immediate impact across the business. The successful candidate will leverage their business knowledge and technical skills to develop analysis and reporting capabilities to extract, deliver, and present data insights. These will be used to measure the impact of new initiatives, product improvements and overall company OKRs. The role will report to the Growth Analytics and Strategy Lead, while also working closely with the Onboarding PM and their team.

What You Will Do

Work with the Growth Product team to understand, document, and conduct relevant analysis
Present findings to high level stakeholders on a regular basis
Perform in depth data analysis to identify and understand anomalies
Use creative thinking to identify new tests to run, and new ways to measure results
Analyze, interpret, and extract results from various data sources
Build and maintain KPI reporting
Analyze and evaluate results of A/B tests, providing plans of action based on the measured results
Work across different stacks to ensure that you have a holistic knowledge of the Growth funnel and how it impacts the business as a whole
Use your knowledge of the business to identify areas of opportunity for growth and measurement


What We Are Looking For

At least 2-3 years work experience as a Data Analyst
Very strong knowledge of SQL
Self-motivated individual
Demonstrable experience working with Python
Experienced in B2C business, signup funnels, A/B testing, and analytic platforms
Experienced in creating and delivering reports/dashboards using tools such as Google Data Studio, Looker or others
Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets
Bachelor’s degree in STEM field, or relevant bootcamp course


Nice-to-have Skills

Looker/LookML
Experience working in a B2C Fintech business
Google Analytics
dbt
Airflow


Benefits

goFlex - flexible working that lets you choose how (& where) you work best (office / home / a mix of both)
33 days of holiday (including public holidays)
An additional birthday day off
Family-friendly leave policies
Enhanced maternity and paternity leave
Westfield Cash Health Plan (for you and your children)
Westfield surgery plan after 3 years’ service
Westfield Rewards (receive discounts at over 600 retailers)
Cycle to work scheme
Training opportunities to further develop your craft
Choose your own equipment


We are proud to say...

We help over two million members improve their money skills every single day.
We are one of Tech Track’s top 50 fastest growing UK companies.
We were nominated for ‘Best Personal Finance App’ at the British Bank Awards 2020.
We were voted 'Best Children's Financial Provider' at the British Bank Awards 2021.
Our kids and parents have donated over £200,000 of their own money to NSPCC via their GoHenry accounts.
We won the Kids' Cards category of Finder's Customer Satisfaction Awards 2022.


GoHenry is an equal-opportunity employer, and we are on a mission to foster a diverse and inclusive workplace. Individuals seeking employment at GoHenry are considered without regard to race, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Want to join our mission?

If GoHenry sounds like a place you would like to be, please apply using the link below.

HTML:
GoHenry is a London and New York-based fintech company that pioneered the youth fintech and financial education category. We are on a mission to make every kid smart with money and to delight our community of 2 million parents, kids, and teens with innovative, market-leading tools to help parents raise financially healthy kids.

GoHenry offers a debit card and app for kids and teens and companion apps for the family, with in-app tools for sending money, automating allowance, managing chores, setting savings goals, giving to charity, and in-app financial education lessons where kids can watch videos, take quizzes and earn points & badges. This is all designed to help kids and teens build good money habits that will last a lifetime.

The Tech team at GoHenry is looking to recruit a Mid-Level Data Analyst to closely work with the Growth Product teams and other areas in the business. We are a rapidly growing fintech company and are looking for a self starter looking to make an immediate impact across the business. The successful candidate will leverage their business knowledge and technical skills to develop analysis and reporting capabilities to extract, deliver, and present data insights. These will be used to measure the impact of new initiatives, product improvements and overall company OKRs. The role will report to the Growth Analytics and Strategy Lead, while also working closely with the Onboarding PM and their team.

What You Will Do
  • Work with the Growth Product team to understand, document, and conduct relevant analysis
  • Present findings to high level stakeholders on a regular basis
