Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a recent numerical graduate looking to build on your foundation experience and take the next step to become a data analyst? Do you have a passion for using data to solve problems?




If so, we would like to hear from you; we are a fintech start-up offering a rare development environment working closely with an experienced senior management team.




Opportunity




Reporting directly to the co-founders, you will join an entrepreneurial team in a driven, fast-paced environment. This role is a newly created role responsible for supporting the development and further build-out of our platform integrations which are used to acquire, clean and analyse investment data from a range of UK wealth platforms.




We can offer a challenging and constantly evolving career where you will have an impact and develop new skills and knowledge in software development or data analysis.




About The Role




We offer first-hand experience in obtaining, cleaning, transforming and analysing complex investment data with exposure to various wealth managers and other major financial services clients.




The role will include the following:




Monitoring daily data feeds and handling related data processing tasks
Supporting other developers to add new data feeds and build out API connections
Supporting design, implementation and testing of complex analysis and tax calculations
Attendance at client meetings, pitches and dealing with follow-up
Researching relevant technical issues (e.g. data processing technical solutions, new third-party API specifications and tax or performance analysis-related research)
Assisting with special projects





Additional Information




The position is based in our Soho office.




Salary & Benefits




Basic salary: c.£30,000, increasing with progression
Holiday 20 days, increasing with longevity
Axa Private Health
Pension
Discretionary Bonuses
Training / Exam support





Essential Criteria




Recently graduated or demonstrate 1-2 years of relevant experience
Strong analytical skills.
Background with mathematical and/or computer science skills will be an advantage.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python (in particular Pandas)
Unrestricted rights to work in the UK





Desirable Criteria




Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Proven team player who is happy to adapt to a wide range of roles and deal with clients, third-party developers, platforms and service providers;
Self-starter and able to stay focused and make decisions within the role profile while working towards tight deadlines
Independent/flexible problem-solver with the ability to cope positively with change
Familiarity with AWS an advantage





About The Company




Confidante is a start-up fintech that aims to revolutionise data integration, analysis and tax reporting for high-net-worth clients of wealth managers and accountants by simplifying workflow and reporting.




We are a former Barclays senior leadership team offering a cloud-hosted application which obtains, cleans and conforms data from a wide range of third-party financial institutions and provides wealth managers with consolidated performance, analysis and tax reporting.




Please view our website for more information about our company and philosophy.




Keywords: Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Analytics Manager, Business Intelligence Analyst, Operations Analyst, Research Analyst and Data Manager,




NO AGENCIES PLEASE




We are using Recruitment Rebellion to run and organise the response for this advert. Please do not contact us if you are a recruiter.




Candidates, please do not apply directly to us, as there is a chance your application will be missed if it does not go through the right channel.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
PM Dragonfly is a fun, friendly and dynamic environment to work in, where you can work on multiple projects at the same time.

The ideal candidate is self-motivated, creative, committed to developing innovative solutions and able to work easily and collaboratively with others. As a data analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for the development and delivery of big data platforms to optimize media spending and solve business problems.




You will be managing, analysing, and organizing data in a variety of ways to provide actionable suggestions or solutions based on that data. Providing the team with direction and guidance in the specific data modelling, data dictionary and data quality of the different platforms being integrated into the Google Cloud ecosystem, primarily using BigQuery as the main data warehouse.

The role offers an excellent opportunity to work on a wide variety of GMP/GCP technologies and business industries. You will have a natural curiosity and a desire to learn. You will develop domain expertise for the clients you will be working on and contribute to our growth culture by sharing relevant knowledge and thinking to optimize client solutions and outcomes.

Key Responsibilities

● Conduct analysis of large data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can be used to improve marketing campaigns, through the use of regression analysis, cohort analysis, cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, time series analysis, etc.

● Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and analyze data from a variety of marketing platform sources (GA, DV360, SA360, CM, Facebook, Amazon, etc) into Google BigQuery, primarily focusing on marketing activities at local, national and global levels.

● Develop, implement and maintain BigQuery databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality

● Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data. Ensuring that the data sets are of correct coverage, completeness and cleanliness.

● Prepare data for numerical and categorical analysis, resolving missing and inconsistent data that may affect the analysis.

● Using statistical methods, tools and modelling techniques to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets

● Preparing clean, visually compelling dashboards and reports for management to easily understand trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data

● Perform ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions, utilising the correct tools for the size of the job

● Understand and comply with data privacy and security policies

● Experience with data-driven attribution modelling, in particular multi-touch attribution models. Proprietary and Confidential. Not for Redistribution.

● Proactively identify opportunities for improvement in both processes and technology

● Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies

● Stay up-to-date on the latest analytical methods and tools and share knowledge with team members

● Mentor junior analysts and help them grow their skills

● Collaborating with training leads on developing training materials




Required Experience & Skills

● Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related field

● 2+ years of experience working with data

● Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

● Attention to detail and accuracy

● Excellent communication and presentation skills

● Knowledge of programming languages SQL, R, MATLAB, and Python

● Technical proficiency in database design, data models, and techniques for data mining and segmentation

● Experience within GCP is essential (BigQuery, BigQueryML, AutoML, Looker Studio and DataPrep/DataFlow)

● Experience with Jupyter Notebooks

● Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, and SAS to be used for data set analyzing

● Demonstrable experience working with data from different API sources –

Previous experience utilising GMP data is preferred (GA4, DV360, CM, SA360, Ads Data Hub) ● Experience working with low-code/no-code data pipeline software such as Fivetran and Data Fusion

● Familiarity with statistical analysis and machine learning

● Understanding of statistical patterns such as Mean & Median, percentiles, standard deviation, etc

● Practical experience with customer segmentation, behaviour analysis and personalization systems

● Strategic thinking and doing. Great written and verbal communication and the ability to work closely with senior stakeholders

Please contact Alison Smith for further details

Show more Show less
HTML:
PM Dragonfly is a fun, friendly and dynamic environment to work in, where you can work on multiple projects at the same time.

The ideal candidate is self-motivated, creative, committed to developing innovative solutions and able to work easily and collaboratively with others. As a data analyst, you will be part of a team responsible for the development and delivery of big data platforms to optimize media spending and solve business problems.


You will be managing, analysing, and organizing data in a variety of ways to provide actionable suggestions or solutions based on that data. Providing the team with direction and guidance in the specific data modelling, data dictionary and data quality of the different platforms being integrated into the Google Cloud ecosystem, primarily using BigQuery as the main data warehouse.

The role offers an excellent opportunity to work on a wide variety of GMP/GCP technologies and business industries. You will have a natural curiosity and a desire to learn. You will develop domain expertise for the clients you will be working on and contribute to our growth culture by sharing relevant knowledge and thinking to optimize client solutions and outcomes.

Key Responsibilities

● Conduct analysis of large data sets to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that can be used to improve marketing campaigns, through the use of regression analysis, cohort analysis, cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, time series analysis, etc.

● Design and implement scalable data pipelines to collect, process, and analyze data from a variety of marketing platform sources (GA, DV360, SA360, CM, Facebook, Amazon, etc) into Google BigQuery, primarily focusing on marketing activities at local, national and global levels.

● Develop, implement and maintain BigQuery databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality

● Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data. Ensuring that the data sets are of correct coverage, completeness and cleanliness.

● Prepare data for numerical and categorical analysis, resolving missing and inconsistent data that may affect the analysis.

● Using statistical methods, tools and modelling techniques to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets

● Preparing clean, visually compelling dashboards and reports for management to easily understand trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data

● Perform ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions, utilising the correct tools for the size of the job

● Understand and comply with data privacy and security policies

● Experience with data-driven attribution modelling, in particular multi-touch attribution models. Proprietary and Confidential. Not for Redistribution.

● Proactively identify opportunities for improvement in both processes and technology

● Working with programmers, engineers, and management heads to identify process improvement opportunities, propose system modifications, and devise data governance strategies

● Stay up-to-date on the latest analytical methods and tools and share knowledge with team members

● Mentor junior analysts and help them grow their skills

● Collaborating with training leads on developing training materials


Required Experience & Skills

● Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, or a related field

● 2+ years of experience working with data

● Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

● Attention to detail and accuracy

● Excellent communication and presentation skills

● Knowledge of programming languages SQL, R, MATLAB, and Python

● Technical proficiency in database design, data models, and techniques for data mining and segmentation

● Experience within GCP is essential (BigQuery, BigQueryML, AutoML, Looker Studio and DataPrep/DataFlow)

● Experience with Jupyter Notebooks

● Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, and SAS to be used for data set analyzing

● Demonstrable experience working with data from different API sources –

Previous experience utilising GMP data is preferred (GA4, DV360, CM, SA360, Ads Data Hub) ● Experience working with low-code/no-code data pipeline software such as Fivetran and Data Fusion

● Familiarity with statistical analysis and machine learning

● Understanding of statistical patterns such as Mean & Median, percentiles, standard deviation, etc

● Practical experience with customer segmentation, behaviour analysis and personalization systems

● Strategic thinking and doing. Great written and verbal communication and the ability to work closely with senior stakeholders

Please contact Alison Smith for further details

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
An exciting multinational insurance provider is looking for a Data Analyst to join their growing team!




This insurance company is driving decisions based on data and insights brought forward by their technology team. They are looking for a Data Analyst to join them and assist with data development, data extraction, and creating data dashboards.




This is a hybrid role, 3-4 days in the office in London, and it is offering a competitive £55,000 - £75,000 depending on experience.




Requirements:

More than 3 years of experience working with SQL and T-SQL.
Experience in financial services or insurance is preferred, with London market insurance experience being ideal.
Excellent communication skills along with experience in stakeholder management are required.
A Bachelor’s degree in business or technical discipline is preferred.




Don’t miss an opportunity to work with this exciting multinational leader in insurance and with a team of amazing data professionals that believe in collaboration.




Apply now below!

Title: Data Analyst - BBC World Service
Description:
Job Introduction




The BBC World Service has partnered with the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation in an ambitious project to deliver compelling stories across digital and broadcast platforms on the theme of Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) with a specific focus on ten African countries: Nigeria, Kenya, Zambia, Uganda, Ghana, Burkina Faso, Ethiopia, Niger, Senegal and Tanzania. We are looking to recruit a data analyst, who will be responsible for producing impact and audience reports, and supporting the smooth and effective running of the partnership project. They will work alongside the production teams in London, Lagos, and Nairobi, and keep abreast of all content produced and published on BBC platforms. They will oversee the social and digital output as well, and help ensure optimum impact and reach for this project. This is a fantastic opportunity for a talented data analyst/impact producer to join the team and create great content.




This is an 18-month fixed term contract. The team is based in London but we would be happy to consider applications from other locations. The BBC is committed to redeploying employees seeking suitable alternative employment within the BBC for different reasons and they will be given priority consideration ahead of other applicants. Priority consideration means for those employees seeking redeployment their application will be considered alongside anyone else at risk of redundancy, prior to any individuals being considered who are not at risk.




Role Responsibility




Monitor and audit the performance of assets which have been published across BBC and social media platforms using such tools as Emplifi, Facebook insights and BBC measurement tools.




Develop and maintain documentation, presenting complex data in accessible formats. This may include the partner’s custom trackers, internal documentation or project specific detail.




Use social media listening tools such as Brandwatch and Crowdtangle and search data to find the most compelling stories, topics and relevant audience profiles.




Are you the right candidate?




Specific Skills & Experience




Experience of using digital and social media analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Emplifi.
Proficiency in a data wrangling/analysis language e.g. R, Python.
Data visualisation principles and the ability to construct a narrative from data insight.
Ability to work in cross-disciplinary teams, collaborating with a variety of analysts and researchers.
Strong technical aptitude, with an interest in learning/improving programming skills that you will use every day.




Ideal Candidates Will Also Demonstrate Any Of The Following




Familiarity with SQL and data warehouses (e.g. Redshift)
Experience of using digital analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, AT Internet)
Experience with data visualisation tools e.g. Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, other
Understanding of media analytics, data, measurement, methodologies and industry standards including online and offline channels
Knowledge and experience of digital media




Package Description




Band: C




Contract type: 18 Months FTC/ Attachment - June 2024




Location: London - NBH, but can be flexible (hybrid working available)




We’re happy to discuss flexible working. Please indicate your choice under the flexible working question in the application . There is no obligation to raise this at the application stage but if you wish to do so, you are welcome to. Flexible working will be part of the discussion at offer stage.




Excellent career progression – the BBC offers great opportunities for employees to seek new challenges and work in different areas of the organisation.
Unrivalled training and development opportunities – our in-house Academy hosts a wide range of internal and external courses and certification.
Benefits - We offer a competitive salary package, a flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance and 26 days (1 of which is a corporation day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days, a defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more.




About The BBC




We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours in the document attached below.




Diversity matters at the BBC. We have a working environment where we value and respect every individual's unique contribution, enabling all of our employees to thrive and achieve their full potential.




We want to attract the broadest range of talented people to be part of the BBC – whether that’s to contribute to our programming or our wide range of non-production roles. The more diverse our workforce, the better able we are to respond to and reflect our audiences in all their diversity.




We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, socio-economic background, religion and/or belief. We will consider flexible working requests for all roles, unless operational requirements prevent otherwise.




To find out more about Diversity and Inclusion at the BBC, please click here




Attached documents




BBC Values

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You will join the team in delivering insight and analysis which allow ClearScore to rapidly scale and deliver a seamless experience for our users. Analysts play a key role within ClearScore, driving strategy and key decision-making, which ultimately benefits our users, partners, and other teams within the business.




ClearScore has an amazing analytical community which includes Data Analysts, Scientists and Engineers. The community works collaboratively to ensure a landscape in which team members can develop their full potential and deliver maximum business impact.




ClearScore is both a free credit score and report service and the UK's leading consumer credit marketplace. Working in the Marketplaces Analytics team, you will play a key role in monitoring and reporting on marketplace performance; supporting the commercial and product teams to run experiments and improve UX and monetisation and supporting the marketplaces leadership team in developing the overall strategy.




Responsibilities




Build out new monitoring and reporting dashboards, using SQL and Domo
Work closely with our commercial team to help them understand the performance of each of our partners
Analyse AB tests and experiments to enable us to continuously improve the marketplace and user experience
Deliver in-depth analytics projects, using data to identify opportunities and to analyse and solve complex business problems
Support the ongoing growth of the marketplace, including carrying out analysis needed to launch new products, improve existing products and unlock growth across verticals




Requirements




You must possess advanced SQL and Excel skills. Knowledge of Python and analytical tools such as Amplitude is a plus
Experience using Domo or other data visualisation tools such as Tableau
Ability to plan and prioritise your own workload and that of your team
Previous managerial experience is highly desirable, but not essential
You have a desire to learn and enjoy working collaboratively, with a desire to contribute to our culture.
You do not need to fit into a stereotype: we are really committed to closing our gender gap and are actively trying to create an environment where you, as an individual, can thrive.
Strong quantitative and numerical skills




About ClearScore




ClearScore is a workplace like no other. We've spent the past seven years disrupting an entire industry and building a user base of millions. At the heart of this success is our culture, where we work hard, relish change and treat each other with respect—helping everyone to reach their potential and deliver results that make a difference. We're on a mission to positively impact the lives of our users. Our product puts their needs at the centre of our thinking. Through cutting-edge tech, insightful analytics and beautiful design we want to help our users build their financial confidence and make better financial decisions. We want our people to perform at their best, so we trust everyone to work in a way that suits them—focusing on output, not time spent at a screen. We have an inclusive culture where everyone is encouraged to look after their own wellbeing whilst growing and developing their career. For more information on our tech stack check out our Tech Radar 2022, how we work is summarised in our Engineering Principles and we have many other Tech Blogs on Medium.




Benefits




25 paid holidays and a "duvet day" on your birthday
Private health and dental cover
GP office visits
Life assurance scheme
Up to 6% matched pension
Brown bags with guest speakers
Access to Perkbox
Dog-friendly office
Daily breakfast and free snacks
Free sports and social clubs
Generous training allowance
Fast progression
Leadership-led training
Regular wellbeing events
In-house psychotherapist
Financial coach to help you plan and achieve your goals
Physical and mental health support through BUPA
No clock-watching culture
Generous maternity and paternity plans
Culture and inclusion representatives




Inclusion Policy




We are always looking for talented individuals to join ClearScore. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. Please see our People Policy Notice at https://www.clearscore.com/people-notice.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Salary: Up to £40,000pa




About the role

The Data Analyst is a critical role within RWS Group Technology as the organization moves towards being more data and analytics driven. This change in organisational construct is driving the need to review, rationalize & refine the currently diverse operating models within the organisation. You will be responsible for defining and governing the group data model, global data catalogue and data management strategy.




You will be seen as a trusted advisor on behalf of data across the organisation with development operations, business applications and IT.




This is a growing team with a high bar in terms of inviting new people to join us. We seek people who will help drive our business forward and challenge norms by striving for more. Aside from your skills and experience, we’re most interested in your growth mindset and development potential.




This is a full-time role that’s based in one of our European offices, but we expect to maintain a culture of flexibility and a mix of WFH and office time.







What you’ll do

Work with a vast array of data sources including translation, operational & financial to develop data processes and models which support our insight goals
Develop and maintain our group data model in line with our long-term business objectives
Providing technical leadership and direction for the companies engineering team
Advise on duplications & conflicts within the data models of the RWS Group (originating from the different entities) and identify practical solutions for aligning the data models.
Support the alignment of data governance across the RWS group and enforce through solution reviews and audits
Provide guidance as to how data quality and meta data management should be embedded in business processes & systems
Building effective relationships with senior technical staff so there is a common understanding of goals and challenges







What we’re looking for

Recent, working experience in a Data Analyst role
Experience with assessing and implementing enterprise-wide meta data management tools, data models and data catalogues
Expertise in SQL & SSIS is essential
Strong English communication skills
An expert understanding of data integration
Knowledge of information principles and policies
Strategic mind-set with the ability to focus on the “bigger picture”
Experience in integrating complex and cross-corporate processes
Analytical skills — Outstanding analytical and problem-solving abilities
Experience with data visualization in a tool such as Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Sisense is a bonus
Experience working with Cloud Based solutions is a bonus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Quality Analyst | London | Hybrid | £40,000 - £45,000 + 15% bonus

Are you looking to take the next step in your career as a Data Analyst?

Do you want to join an established and expanding pharmaceutical distribution company, serving patients globally to ensure they’re receiving the medicines they require?

Do you want to be a part of an organisation that is working on greenfield projects?




What you’ll be doing:

💥 You’ll be joining a newly formed data governance team – a chance to grow into this role and make it your own

💥 Supporting the business with their data quality – identifying the gaps and providing solutions

💥 Working closely with the Data Quality Manager & stakeholders to promote best practices & recommendations




What you’ll need:

✅ 2-3 years’ commercial experience as a data quality analyst / data analyst

✅ Hands on experience working with SQL & data viz tools (e.g Power BI)

✅ Understanding of data quality & best practices

✅ Experience with Alteryx or equivalent is a plus!




What to expect in return:

⚡️ Flexible hybrid working model – 2 days a week to the London office

⚡️ Learning & development – you’ll have time spent during the week for upskilling

⚡️ A base salary ranging from £40,000 - £45,000 + 15% bonus

⚡️ Juicy benefits like 27 days holidays + 4.5% pension match




Next steps:

Hit apply and we’ll be in touch to go through your experience and discuss the opportunity & client in more detail with you.

As an employer and service provider, we are committed to Equity, Equality, Diversity and Inclusion. Please feel comfortable to let us know if you have a difference or disability that would require us or our clients to make any helpful adjustments for you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: West End, London (hybrid working)

Salary: £40000 - £50000 depending on experience

Bonus: 20-30% of salary




Company: Global FinTech SaaS company that works with private equity / credit and real estate investors. They provide data science that provides insights into client’s portfolios. Investors make important decisions and produce significant returns based on the data from the platform.




Job role: The Data Analyst will provide financial analytics to support clients, including significant focus on financial modelling / statistical analysis for alternative investors & financial services companies, as well as supporting on-going performance reporting and monitoring.




Responsibilities:




Performance Analysis

· Development of Asset Management analytics across many geographies and asset types

· Maintenance and on-going development of models used to analyse performance, refine key assumptions, re-forecast cash flows and update valuations

· Monitor and analyse credit and service performance of portfolio investments, including forecasts and key covenants tests

· Deliver analytics to support optimisation of performance, aimed at improving returns as well as managing risks

· Monitor and assist in the preparation of internal / investor reports

Investment Analysis and Transactional Support

· Build financial models to assess the value and review risk of potential investments, incorporating asset-based cash flow and credit risk analysis

· Prepare investment analysis, including asset level analysis and risk-based simulations for presentation to internal / external constituents

· Assist in broader market research and source external benchmark data

Experience:

· Experience working in the analytics function of a data driven company preferably within the financial services sector.

· Experience using R and Python to interrogate large datasets and undertake complex behavioural analysis.

· Hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing statistical models to predict consumer behaviour.

· Numerical degree, preferably at a Masters level (i.e. mathematics, science, engineering or economics). Batchelor’s degree will be considered.

· Development and improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive analysis

· Data modelling, profiling and cleansing techniques.

· Experience translating data from multiple sources (from different countries/language) and map them to UK standardised data

Desirable:

· Familiarity with Microsoft technology stack, including data integration, collaboration and business Intelligence tools and their underlying technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Visual Studio and TFS).

Show more Show less
HTML:
Location: West End, London (hybrid working)

Salary: £40000 - £50000 depending on experience

Bonus: 20-30% of salary


Company: Global FinTech SaaS company that works with private equity / credit and real estate investors. They provide data science that provides insights into client’s portfolios. Investors make important decisions and produce significant returns based on the data from the platform.


Job role: The Data Analyst will provide financial analytics to support clients, including significant focus on financial modelling / statistical analysis for alternative investors & financial services companies, as well as supporting on-going performance reporting and monitoring.


Responsibilities:


Performance Analysis

· Development of Asset Management analytics across many geographies and asset types

· Maintenance and on-going development of models used to analyse performance, refine key assumptions, re-forecast cash flows and update valuations

· Monitor and analyse credit and service performance of portfolio investments, including forecasts and key covenants tests

· Deliver analytics to support optimisation of performance, aimed at improving returns as well as managing risks

· Monitor and assist in the preparation of internal / investor reports

Investment Analysis and Transactional Support

· Build financial models to assess the value and review risk of potential investments, incorporating asset-based cash flow and credit risk analysis

· Prepare investment analysis, including asset level analysis and risk-based simulations for presentation to internal / external constituents

· Assist in broader market research and source external benchmark data

Experience:

· Experience working in the analytics function of a data driven company preferably within the financial services sector.

· Experience using R and Python to interrogate large datasets and undertake complex behavioural analysis.

· Hands-on experience designing, building, and implementing statistical models to predict consumer behaviour.

· Numerical degree, preferably at a Masters level (i.e. mathematics, science, engineering or economics). Batchelor’s degree will be considered.

· Development and improvement of data to support continuous evolution of a more competitive analysis

· Data modelling, profiling and cleansing techniques.

· Experience translating data from multiple sources (from different countries/language) and map them to UK standardised data

Desirable:

· Familiarity with Microsoft technology stack, including data integration, collaboration and business Intelligence tools and their underlying technologies (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, SharePoint, Visual Studio and TFS).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Charity Sector - £50K – London/Remote




Our Charity client now requires a Data Analyst with Power BI experience to join their team with the purpose to support a data strategy from an Insights perspective and partner with strategy stakeholders.




As the Data Analyst you will be responsible for establishing the baseline KPIs based on performance, pipeline, activity and status.




Key responsibilities and experience required:

Monitor data trends and maintain quality checks with the finance and database team
Platform user of PowerBI
Produce regular reports and dashboards
Experience of data analysis and reporting within a Fundraising, Digital Marketing or Communications remit
Ability to interpret data from different sources
Experience of data analysis from external data sources
Experience with SQL & GoogleAnalytics




This role is based in central London working in a hybrid model.




The role is offering up to £50,000 per annum depending on experience.




If you are a experienced Data Analyst with PowerBI experience, we are keen to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

When you look at L’Oréal, what do you see? If all you see is lipstick, look again and experience the Freedom to go Beyond the ordinary. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal. We operate in 150 countries on 5 continents. With 36 international brands and 86,000 employees worldwide, we’re well on our way to fulfilling our common purpose: to create beauty that moves the world.

By 2030 we want to capture over another 1 billion consumers around the world. How? By creating cosmetic products which meet the infinite diversity of consumers beauty needs and desires, and always through digital innovation. Not only that, but taking our sustainability goals seriously; moving us to a more inclusive and sustainable society, for every generation.

Our brands, dynamic culture, and always being our own challenger mean that we offer freedom and opportunity you won’t get anywhere else.

If you want the Freedom to go Beyond, we’ll see you at L’Oréal.

Our Corporate Division supports the 4000+ strong workforce in L’Oréal UK & Ireland. It’s a fast-paced and dynamic environment when you’ll have visibility over our 4 Divisions and play an integral role in moving our business forward. The Ecommerce Acceleration Team exists to make L’Oreal UKI a digital first business by 2024 and drive market share across all our brands and divisions.

We embrace our entrepreneurial spirit in everything we do, always challenging ourselves to new ways of doing things. That means looking for innovative solutions, sustainable developments, and having the freedom to go beyond the ordinary.

Our founder Eugène Schueller once said that “a company is not walls and machines, it’s people, people, people”. Joining our corporate teams means joining the world leader in beauty, at the cutting edge of innovation. But above all, it means becoming part of a team of talented and inspiring people.

You will

Define and steer data quality improvement plan for all data regarding A&P and Promo

>define new templates

>Review the improvement roadmap implementation with key stakeholders: data owners within all divisions of the UKI and Global Data PO

Collect and transform Data

>Test, implement and upgrade a Semi-automation process for collection and transformation of our manual A&P data

>Lead the collection of all data regarding A&P management and required for MMMs across the UKI

>Manage and extract in autonomy media data from the Essence Data Platform and other sources:

Define the right extraction parameters
Give feedback to the EDDS via the Global PO

>Give feedback to local providers on corrections that should be applied at sourcing data

Automate Data sourcing

>Upgrade data sourcing and support central data automation

Define local data governance
Identify local data assets per domain (sell out, O+O)
Define owners depending on levers, domains, and tools
Increase data availability and literacy

You have

The ability to make appropriate decisions when supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems, and products
Knowledge of data management and business knowledge – particularly media to be able to translate and apply data driven solutions
The ability to build processes supporting data transformation, data structures and dependency
The ability to coordinate data collection across different teams and sources
Highly numerate, analytically strong and a great eye for detail
Power BI, DAX, Advanced Excel, VBA (essential)
GCP, SQL, Google Cloud Platform, Python (desirable)
Strong organisational skills
Experience of agile project management and strong organizational skills
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

You are

Demonstrates entrepreneurship
Manages Complexity
Achieves results with integrity
Acts/Leads with human sensitivity
Displays sensitivity to the métier
Interacts effectively
Innovates

You get

We put people development and learning at the heart of our business; we’ll help you master your role, develop your technical expertise and you’ll benefit from exceptional management and leadership programmes. From face-to-face workshops to our global online learning resources, you’re actively encouraged to embed learning into your daily life and are rewarded for continuous improvement. Don’t forget that every employee gets 3 Coursera credits; that means you can get qualifications from over 1000 universities from around the world, with thousands of courses to choose from.

Looking for a good work/life balance? With our new hybrid working scheme, you can take a flexible approach to work as well as benefit from early finishes on Fridays during the summer...so you can enjoy more time with your friends and family.

As any great employer should do, we make sure we look after your financial wellbeing. That’s why we have a great pension plan, profit share scheme and many more incentives to give you the security you deserve. We also put employee health and wellbeing at the front of everything we do; fully training employees as mental health ambassadors to support and educate ourselves further. There’s also the chance to enrol in medical and dental insurance, gym discounts, health check-ups and even yoga and Pilates classes to employees in all of our locations.

Oh, did we mention that as an employee you also get discount sales of up to 70% off throughout the year on our 36 brands? Plus, you also get the option to share that in our Friends and Family sales as well!

How we recruit

At L’Oréal, we take pride in creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where everyone is welcome and their contributions are valued. When we recruit, hire, train, promote or engage in any other employment practice, we are committed to being an inclusive employer regardless of race, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, socioeconomic status, medical condition or disability, or any other protected status. When we look for talent, we welcome difference - different backgrounds, experiences, personalities and perspectives. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That’s the beauty of L’Oréal.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Reference #




264662BR




Job Type




Full Time




Your role




Are you an analytical thinker and data-driven problem-solver? Do you know how to gather and translate business requirements, working with large risk datasets and own these solutions through to implementation? Would you like to work in a truly collaborative environment to find effective and efficient solutions to the reporting needs of our risk business?




We are looking for a Data Analyst like you to:





capture and translate the risk reporting requirements we need to meet regulatory and business change initiatives
work with key stakeholders such as IT, data owners, risk reporting officers & associates plus our business sponsors to create high quality reports and dashboards
provide innovative, robust solutions which contain clear insight and highlights reflecting the status and/or changes in our risk
create the sub-tasks needed to deliver these reporting solutions, allocate the tasks to the appropriate teams and then track to completion
support our business to embed these solutions into live and ensure that we are achieving the full business value from these reports and dashboards
drive standardization, automation and continuous improvements of data collection, analysis, and reporting processes





Your team





you will be working as part of a global team responsible for providing reporting analysis to our business colleagues
you’ll be part of the newly created Agile pods and have the opportunity to play a critical role in enabling the high-paced Agile transformation
our team is part of the wider Group Risk Control organization and is an agent of change for our Risk Control colleagues. We are a diverse team of specialists with different backgrounds and we enjoy finding and implementing first-rate solutions for our business





Your expertise





degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Technology or equivalent
ideally 5 years of experience working in a similar role within the banking industry, preferably in credit and/or market risk
proven experience using Business Intelligence and reporting software and data visualization (e.g. Power BI, MicroStrategy, Tableau)
technical skills are an advantage, including Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Experience with SQL, Python or similar languages
confident communicator able to convey information and ideas clearly, good at building relationships across geographically distributed teams
strong customer focus and passion to enable data-driven decision-making and improvements
effective time management and ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously
attention to detail along with structured organization and planning skills





About Us




UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.




With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?




Join us




At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.




From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?




Disclaimer / Policy Statements




UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
💻 Data Analyst – Focus on Transport Analytics

🚄 Transport Tech Firm

💵 Up to £50,000 + Bonus

👩‍💻 2 Interview Stages

🏢 Wider Data Science & Analytics team of 9

🏠 Hybrid WFH Setup (1 – 3 days in the office, you choose which, and how many)

🔍Work from the London, Milton Keynes, or Derbyshire Offices – 37 hours pw, with flexibility




Summary

We’re currently working with a British tech firm that specialises in providing cutting edge digital solutions to transport challenges in the UK and beyond.
Work on a range of mission-critical and confidential projects for some of the largest private and public transport companies.
Have great exposure to the commercial side of the business – understanding external client needs and providing solutions driven by analytics.




What you’ll do:

Data manipulation
Data Preparation
Producing BI dashboards using tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Understanding commercial challenges, and translating them into a hypothesis that can be tested through data analysis
Working with a range of different types of database types




What we’re looking for:

Essential:

1+ year in a data & analytics centric role
A strong understanding of statistics
Technical proficiency using SQL and Python libraries for data analytics
The ability to visualise data using visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Google Analytics etc

Desirable:

Building and maintaining data pipelines
Experience using a cloud data platform, such as AWS, Azure, or GCP




Interested?

Great, apply now! 📥

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – London & Lloyds Market

Location: London

Package £Negotiable + Benefits




Lonmar is going from strength to strength over the last few years, to ensure this continues we’re looking to appoint a Data Analyst to the team.




You’ll be working within the Binding Authority Division, which handles most non-marine classes of business for clients Worldwide.




Whilst embedded within the Lonmar team you’ll also be able to utilise the group wide data community and continue to develop your career.




Responsibilities:




Production of monthly Management Information Performance Packs
Working closely with clients and insurers in analysing performance to drive value from the data
Identifying new opportunities and build data models and dashboards to support
Supporting the journey of moving from descriptive to prescriptive analytics
Building and maintaining performance dashboards for existing client base
Performing ad-hoc analysis for clients and insurers
Data analysis for new business projects
Data validation / cleansing
Manage the written premiums, paid premiums and claims statistics
Own the production of the earned to incurred triangulation figures for all clients and insurers




The Rewards:




A competitive and negotiable basic salary coupled with all of the normal benefits (Holiday, Pension, Share Save Scheme, DIS) as well as a range of flexible benefits post probation

A client first environment where the team work together to achieve common goals and benefits for clients and stakeholders

Full support for ongoing professional development including fully funded professional qualifications




About You:




Proficient in the use of MS Power BI and MS Excel, with a working understand of any of the Microsoft database technologies
Data analytical mindset
Knowledge of the non-marine insurance sector from a risk and claims perspective
Portfolio management
Problem solving capabilities
Ability to work on the own or as part of a team in different situations




Wider about us:




Lonmar Global Risks are part of GRP, the GRP Group aims to be one of the UK's leading insurance intermediaries delivering the best outcomes to clients, insurers, investors and our people. We acquire and develop businesses with the velocity of a start-up with a focused, straight talking, professional and accountable leadership who put the customer first and act with integrity and pride in what we do and meet our compliance responsibilities. We expect the same from everyone we hire. With a federated group of businesses, we can offer a diversity of experience and with our overarching mission we can ensure the success of our people and business.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity at a progressive and successful media agency where you will provide support to the ARMLabs team and media planner buyers at All Response Media by way of data wrangling, analysis and econometrics.




You will be joining a passionate and supportive team of economists who crave answers, enjoy learning, and thrive off working on multiple tasks and projects ranging from data extraction through SQL/Snowflake to analysing the impact of advertising campaigns using time series econometrics models.




This a is great opportunity for newcomers to the data analytics world. You will be trained by the senior members of the team, who will soft manage you on a day-to-day basis, but you will report to the head of data science. There are many opportunities within the role to gain responsibility and develop creative thinking through actionable insight.




A BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or successful completion of a level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship is required to be considered for this role.




About The Company




All Response Media is Europe’s leading performance media agency, providing clients with an “Unfair Competitive Advantage” since 1995, with offices in London, Leeds and Amsterdam




We are progressive, dynamic and a rewarding company where you can develop your skills and build a long-term career in advertising, as part of a highly talented and driven team of over 150 professionals. As a growing agency, you will be a part of a fast-paced, exciting and social company culture that truly enriches employee careers. We show a great level of passion and care for all we do, and our leaders appreciate that embedding a strong team culture is important to the success of ARM. As such, we are passionate about developing strong leaders from within the business.




We provide industry-leading media performance to a growing global client base and partner with some of the most innovative and established businesses to continue our mission to disrupt and innovate the advertising industry. Our success is achieved through the success of our clients, and we do this by cultivating strong working relationships through collaboration, innovation and integration which drives engagement, helping them build strong brands and performance.




We plan and buy across all media channels, on and offline. Our bespoke campaign measurement suite, ARMalytics®, gives us a competitive advantage and is at the core of our model, underpinning the data-led operations of our integrated client business teams and ARMlabs data and systems unit. We actively encourage integration across the agency, therefore those who join us soon find that they have a wealth of knowledge across all marketing disciplines.




Your key responsibilities will include:




Access, investigate and extract data as needed (using Snowflake and SQL)
Manipulate data (format, remove and add data and tables)
Test data for completeness and correctness
Format client reports and data extracts (mainly in Excel and R)
Create own visualisation and dashboards and maintenance of dashboards using an advanced suite of visualisation tools
Manage the log of weekly requests from the ARM teams
Provide web tag data to ARM teams
Assist ARM team with queries regarding the bespoke ARM RAPS system
Assist ARM teams with client setup and configuration on the RAPS system
Analyse Direct Response advertising effectiveness
Compile and report on competitor insights
Run simple econometric regressions in R
Econometrics modelling to answer questions about the effect of advertising
Maintain GDPR compliance with regards to handling of first- and third-party data
Troubleshoot data problems that extend to attribution queries
Identify areas of opportunity with regards to automation and streamline processes
Contribute to further development around wider industry research and use cases




Requirements




BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
Data manipulation skills in R (or Python)
Timeseries econometric regressions experience (Eviews/SAS/R/etc.)
Advanced MS Excel Skills (VLOOKUP's, etc.)
Strong number orientation through abilities in maths, accounting, statistics .
Good communication skills
Good story telling with data skills
MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
Media experience (preferred)
Eligible to work in the UK




Benefits




Competitive salary and bonus
25 days annual leave + bank holidays
Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
Progression and development




Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.
Show more Show less
HTML:
This is a fantastic opportunity at a progressive and successful media agency where you will provide support to the ARMLabs team and media planner buyers at All Response Media by way of data wrangling, analysis and econometrics.


You will be joining a passionate and supportive team of economists who crave answers, enjoy learning, and thrive off working on multiple tasks and projects ranging from data extraction through SQL/Snowflake to analysing the impact of advertising campaigns using time series econometrics models.


This a is great opportunity for newcomers to the data analytics world. You will be trained by the senior members of the team, who will soft manage you on a day-to-day basis, but you will report to the head of data science. There are many opportunities within the role to gain responsibility and develop creative thinking through actionable insight.


A BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or successful completion of a level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship is required to be considered for this role.


About The Company


All Response Media is Europe’s leading performance media agency, providing clients with an “Unfair Competitive Advantage” since 1995, with offices in London, Leeds and Amsterdam


We are progressive, dynamic and a rewarding company where you can develop your skills and build a long-term career in advertising, as part of a highly talented and driven team of over 150 professionals. As a growing agency, you will be a part of a fast-paced, exciting and social company culture that truly enriches employee careers. We show a great level of passion and care for all we do, and our leaders appreciate that embedding a strong team culture is important to the success of ARM. As such, we are passionate about developing strong leaders from within the business.


We provide industry-leading media performance to a growing global client base and partner with some of the most innovative and established businesses to continue our mission to disrupt and innovate the advertising industry. Our success is achieved through the success of our clients, and we do this by cultivating strong working relationships through collaboration, innovation and integration which drives engagement, helping them build strong brands and performance.


We plan and buy across all media channels, on and offline. Our bespoke campaign measurement suite, ARMalytics®, gives us a competitive advantage and is at the core of our model, underpinning the data-led operations of our integrated client business teams and ARMlabs data and systems unit. We actively encourage integration across the agency, therefore those who join us soon find that they have a wealth of knowledge across all marketing disciplines.


Your key responsibilities will include:


  • Access, investigate and extract data as needed (using Snowflake and SQL)
  • Manipulate data (format, remove and add data and tables)
  • Test data for completeness and correctness
  • Format client reports and data extracts (mainly in Excel and R)
  • Create own visualisation and dashboards and maintenance of dashboards using an advanced suite of visualisation tools
  • Manage the log of weekly requests from the ARM teams
  • Provide web tag data to ARM teams
  • Assist ARM team with queries regarding the bespoke ARM RAPS system
  • Assist ARM teams with client setup and configuration on the RAPS system
  • Analyse Direct Response advertising effectiveness
  • Compile and report on competitor insights
  • Run simple econometric regressions in R
  • Econometrics modelling to answer questions about the effect of advertising
  • Maintain GDPR compliance with regards to handling of first- and third-party data
  • Troubleshoot data problems that extend to attribution queries
  • Identify areas of opportunity with regards to automation and streamline processes
  • Contribute to further development around wider industry research and use cases


Requirements


  • BSc in Maths, Statistics or Econometrics, or level 4 Data Analyst Apprenticeship.
  • Data manipulation skills in R (or Python)
  • Timeseries econometric regressions experience (Eviews/SAS/R/etc.)
  • Advanced MS Excel Skills (VLOOKUP's, etc.)
  • Strong number orientation through abilities in maths, accounting, statistics .
  • Good communication skills
  • Good story telling with data skills
  • MS SQL 2012+ experience (preferred)
  • Media experience (preferred)
  • Eligible to work in the UK


Benefits


  • Competitive salary and bonus
  • 25 days annual leave + bank holidays
  • Annual company away day and socials - we're all about the socials!
  • Daily drinks fridge, free fruits, breakfast on Mondays and lunch on Fridays
  • Private healthcare with Vitality (50% off at Virgin Gyms!) and eye test
  • Flexi Fridays and time off on your birthday
  • Long term service rewards up to £10k and sabbaticals to travel the globe!
  • Life cover 4x your annual salary, enhanced sick pay, income protection
  • Perkbox and Wellbeing programme
  • Season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
  • Media, technical and managerial training, including LinkedIn Learning!
  • Progression and development


Accelerate and fast-track your career with All Response Media.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst

Salary: From £24,000 per annum negotiable depending on experience

Contract: Fixed Term Contract (9 months) .05 FTE (part time)

Location: Hybrid - flexibility to work from home or at any of our main hubs (London, Bristol, Manchester and Harwell)




Jisc is the UK higher, further education and skills sectors’ not-for-profit organisation for digital services and solutions. We believe education and research improves lives, and technology improves education and research.







Our vision is for the UK to be a world leader in technology for education and research and our mission is to power and empower our members with the technology and data they need to succeed. We know that digital technology has the ability to transform the student experience. We have the experience, expertise and know-how to drive that transformation.







At Jisc, everyone plays a key role and gets the chance to feel part of it, that to us is the definition of a meaningful career. We want to create a culture of lifelong learning. You can look forward to a rewarding job with opportunities to develop and make a real difference to the education and research sectors.







We celebrate diversity, embrace our differences and know that this is critical for our success. We work hard to make sure we’re inclusive and we are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. So, if you are great at what you do and share our values, we want to hear from you.




About the role:

The purpose of this role is to support the Intelligence and Analytics team to gather, analyse and present data to effectively benchmark, analyse, and monitor the Licensing portfolio to enable presentation to Digital Resources Senior Leadership Team and with other areas of Jisc; drive and inform licensing negotiations; and inform, support, and provide value to our members.







Responsibilities will include:

Work as part of the Intelligence and Analytics team to prototype, develop, launch, maintain and enhance a portfolio of licensing data analytics products that are quality assured, user focused, automated, reliable and secure
Work closely with the Data Analysts, to understand project aim, product vision and timescales and to contribute to sprint backlogs that are understood by everyone, and deliver discrete increments of the project and product
Creating statistically valid, user friendly visualisations and dashboards
Explore opportunities for improved collection, analysis, use and presentation of data and information, both within and without Digital Resources, including identifying where data is missing, needed and how to or who to collect it from







Key Skills and Experience:

Excellent organisational, analytical, problem solving and time-management skills and is detail-focused
Strong IT skills, including MS Office suite or similar, particularly Excel
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal such as creating clear documentation and reports
Experience in gathering data and information using surveys or other routes
Experience of combining and analysing data using software such as MS Excel
Experience of presenting and summarising data and information in written and/or visual ways through tools such as MS PowerPoint or other graphical software







Please refer to the job description for full details.







Don’t meet every single requirement?

We know that sometimes people can be put off applying for a job if they think they can’t tick every box but we realise the ‘perfect candidate’ doesn’t exist. So, if you can do most of what we’re looking for, go ahead and apply. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles!







Why work at Jisc:

At Jisc we believe a balance between your personal and professional life is essential to your happiness and fulfilment. We work flexibly at Jisc and focus on outputs rather than presenteeism and are open to a whole range of ways of working. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life.







We offer hybrid working and although the majority of our staff work from home, getting face to face is something we value and find time for when we can. If you prefer an office environment all our hubs are open and offer a great space to work.







Our benefits are great too. We offer:

Flexible work pattern, which can adapt to suit your schedules and personal commitments
28 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) and an additional three closure days over Christma
A generous pension scheme with above average employer contributions
A range of leave options, including parental leave, volunteer leave and even career breaks.
A generous budget to attend conferences and in-person training
Allocated allowance of up to £250 to equip your home office
A company culture which supports and promotes personal learning and development, including access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn Learning
Mental health first aid trained staff and supportive environment, plus your own Wellbeing allowance to spend on wellbeing for you
Financial well-being support
Discounts on big-name high-street stores
Cycle to work scheme
Employee recognition awards and travel loans







Equality, diversity and inclusion

At Jisc, we strive to be best in practice and are working hard to achieve progressive change. ‘Always inclusive’ is one of our six guiding principles - a principle which actively encourages acceptance of differences within individuals.







We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, neurodivergence, trans status, veteran status or gender identity.







Application process:

Please do let us know what reasonable adjustments you need made to the application or selection process so you can do your best. We will be happy to help you.







Just so you know, we review CVs as we receive them, and interview as soon as we have applications that look like a good match (usually within a week). We don’t use closing dates. So, please apply as soon as possible to avoid missing out on this role. We advertised this role on 24/01/2023

Please do let us know what reasonable adjustments you need made to the application or selection process so you can do your best. We will be happy to help you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Cititec has partnered exclusively with the UK's Top Global Market Leaders who are looking for a Data Analyst on a MINIMUM 6-month contract.




Key Responsibilities:




Lead initiatives to engage with the business units across the whole company to collect and consolidate business-related data requirements
Analyze and evaluate the current business processes and identify areas of improvement with the help of data
Work collaboratively with data stewards, data engineers, and BI/Reporting Leads for fulfilling business requirements ranging from data science, AI, ML, data quality, data management, business intelligence and reporting.




Key Skills Needed:




Strong SQL experience
Power BI is preferred but any other relevant technology will be considered
Experience in data storytelling, using data to help improve the business by communicating with various different business units.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Does working for Multi-National Lottery Operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy sound like the perfect place of employment for you?

Over the next two years we are going to embark on a large-scale transformation journey, unparalleled in the existing market, and a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for anyone both within and outside the betting and gaming industry. They can’t talk too much about their plans – you’ll have to speak to us to find out more – but they can promise a fast-paced, exciting environment, innovative projects like none you have worked on before, and the opportunity to transform a core pillar of the UK economy, while contributing to good causes that benefit society.




Job Description:

Data Analyst - Full Time - Hybrid










Join our journey to create a new experience for the National Lottery and help us to power change for the greater good.

About us:

Allwyn UK is part of Allwyn Entertainment Group – a multi-national lottery operator with a market-leading presence in Austria, the Czech Republic, Greece, Cyprus, and Italy. In 2022, Allwyn was selected in a Government tender as the Preferred Applicant to operate the UK’s National Lottery from February 2024.




Over the next two years we are embarking on a largescale transformation journey to build a bigger, better and safer National Lottery that delivers more money to Good Causes. Once-in-a-lifetime opportunities exist for people from within and outside the betting and gaming industry to join us play a part in giving the National Lottery a fresh start




Role Purpose:

Working in the Commercial team that are data and insight driven – proactively supporting all team members across the product team and working closely with the Consumer Insights Manager. Also working as part of the wider team executing on the Transition plan for Consumer Insights.

This role will be focused on data analysis for product but may at times be asked to support analysis needs for other areas such as marketing, CRM and digital.

This role will have functional reporting into the Consumer Insights Manager and subject matter reporting into the Head of Product, working closely with the team of Product Managers.




Role Responsibilities:

Analyse a broad array of data points from internal and external sources related to Company IP, Product and Library Assets
Combine and analyse data sets to gain insights into the National Lottery product portfolio and sales performance
Respond to insight queries from the product team
Present analytical outputs to key stakeholders, taking complex information and communicating it as clear and actionable insights.
Execute aspects of quantitative and qualitative research where required, including questionnaire design and development
Proactively analyse research findings to develop Allwyn UK friendly internal reports for both quantitative and qualitative reporting, using a story-based reporting approach
Support product lifecycle research programs to ensure product and planned marketing campaigns will resonate with relevant target audiences
Ensure highest level of data quality and validation




Key Measures of Success:

Respond to queries within the agreed timeframe
Provide high quality outputs with digestible summaries and recommendations
High quality of data visualisation
Proactive approach to data analysis with insights and recommendations actively raised to the team
Support the business planning process with insights, modelling and forecasting inputs
Work closely with other Consumer Insights team members to develop internal qualitative and quantitative best practices




Key Skills and Experience:

Experience with application development is a plus
Experience in using either: SPSS, SAS, SQL
Experience in manipulating data in excel and using other platforms e.g. Tableau
Bachelor’s degree from a recognized university, Master’s degree/MBA strongly preferred
3 + years of relevant job experience working in areas of data analysis
Ability to understand and translate technical, numerical data
Experience in data analysis for product development and management
Experience in the interactive entertainment industry a plus, with a preference on gambling
Consumer research or research agency experience a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Largely Remote Working - 1/2 days travel to London per Quarter




My client, a leading Utilities company, have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to join their team and provide data driven insights, driving quality, growth and reporting in the business. This is a great opportunity to join a highly motivated, supportive, and experienced team in a role that provides a high degree of project accountability and ownership.




This role will be integral to their continued growth and development as a brand. You will need to work with all business departments and levels of management, to create and develop our internal quality reporting, presenting and working with internal departments to identify and manage data quality across multiple systems while also developing and providing reporting focused on data driven insights.




Their infrastructure modernisation over the last couple of years meant moving to Microsoft Azure where we use Azure Services such as VM Hosting, Azure APIM, Logic Apps and Web Apps. Capacity improvements have facilitated growth of IT services and their upcoming milestone is to improve the quality of the data in our CRM and finance systems, reporting and insights.




Initial focus will be on 3 core areas:

Consolidation and improvement of internal reports and Ad Hoc reports
Data import quality
CRM data improvements




Key experience from previous roles would include:

Previous experience with ETL processes and data cleansing
Experience of data gathering, documenting, analysing, and reporting
Experience using large relational databases
Experience providing data insights and interpretations to senior managers to support the decisions and business strategies




Technical Skills Required:

Transact-SQL including Stored Procedures and Functions
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience enforcing data quality
ETL processes
Data cleansing




If you are a self-starter who is exciting by the prospect of taking ownership and responsibility for a range of business critical projects, coupled with a passion for Data Technology (specifically within Microsoft stack) then please get in touch ASAP with your CV

Title: Data Analyst - Hybrid - £60K +
Description:
Data Analyst - Hybrid - £60K




Our client is a leading (and growing!) games development company




Offering Hybrid working, their offices are based in London they’re looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst.




You’ll have the chance to design data models and pipelines, work with developers and data engineers to build warehousing solutions and be able to take the lead on the development of dashboard and visualizations solutions.




You’ll have real ownership and autonomy in the role and work directly with senior stakeholders to define data best practices, how insights are used and start building out Machine Learning and NLP tools.







Requirements:




· Great experience in a similar data analyst role

· Great understanding of data warehousing and pipelines

· Good experience with looker

· Knowledge of GCP, Big Query and (ideally) Google Analytics

· Excellent SQL skills

· Experience with visualization tools such as Qlikview, Power BI or Tableau

· Scripting skills (Python, R etc)

· Data mining experience

Title: Data Insight Analyst – Asset Management – up to £65,000 + Bonus
Description:
Do you know the basics about bonds, loans, credit default swaps and other fixed income products?




Add to that your knowledge of Tableau and SQL and you’ve got the making for your next position. You’re not expected to be the finished article and your learning and development will be a large focus here. Over time, you’ll become an expert with fixed income data and data analysis/insight in general.




You’ll be working closely with the front office of the business, creating a range of dashboards using Tableau to provide all kinds of insight around the fixed income markets. Requirements will vary and you will gather them directly from various stakeholders within the business. Sometimes all you’ll need to use is Tableau, whereas other may require slightly more data manipulation, giving you more exposure to Python, SQL and Snowflake.




You will of course get the training that you need across the asset class and technology.




With this role sitting within the business arm rather than technology, you’ll have great exposure to the front office, often seen as the most exciting part of financial firms. Of course, when you need technical help or training, the technology side of the business will be there to lend a hand.




In terms of your experience, you’ll need to have experience in another data analytics position, using Tableau. Python and SQL skills would be a huge plus, as would any prior exposure to Tableau.




The culture here is changing and with that you’ll only need to come to the office to work twice a week as a minimum. Starting salary will be up to £65,000 plus a performance related bonus and a range of benefits.




Want to learn all about fixed income investments? Get in touch.




No up-to-date CV required.

Title: Data Analyst - £45,000 - Central London, Mayfair
Company: Centrum pro výzkum energetického vužití litosféry
Description:
A highly successful, reputable brand with offices in Central London (Mayfair) are looking for a commercially minded Data Analyst to join their team. Reporting to the Head of Operations you will partner Sales, Marketing, Finance and Commercial teams to provide data reports across the business. This is a newly created role for an established business with aggressive growth plans.

As the Data Analyst you will take responsibility of revenue management and business reporting across operations, marketing and sales. You will use data reporting to assess pricing, revenue growth and performance; creating weekly / monthly performance reports that enable trend analysis and management decision making. This role will require you to use your analytical skillset to translate complex data sets into actionable insights and recommendations. In addition, you will assess marketing data, including impressions, website visits and enquiries providing analysis on conversion metrics and insights that can support conversion optimisation.

The ideal candidate for this Data Analyst role will have strong data visualization skills using Excel, VBA, SQL or Power BI. Any exposure to Tableau would be beneficial but not essential. Strong communication skills are required as you partner with a number of stakeholders across the business.

The salary on offer for this role is £45,000 plus benefits. This role is predominantly office based but offers flexibility to work from home one day per week.
