Title: Database Administrator and Data Analyst
Description:
Job Brief

We are seeking a Database Administrator/Data Analyst to join our great team of IT professionals at Graymont. We are an innovative, technology driven, global leader in lime and limestone solutions that operates throughout North America and Asia-Pacific.

Canada - Hybrid - Richmond, BC

Database Administrator and Data Analyst

About Graymont

Graymont is a global leader in lime and limestone solutions. With operations across North America and Asia-Pacific, Graymont’s growing business focuses on technology and application innovation.

Graymont’s Information Services department is instrumental in delivering on Graymont’s strategy, exposing employees to information, technology, and opportunities they might not see in other companies. Visit www.graymont.com to find out more.

Role

We are seeking an experienced Database Administrator/Data Analyst to join a global team of IT professionals. The position reports to an Enterprise Applications Manager and is responsible to design, install, monitor, conduct performance tuning, and maintenance of production databases while ensuring high levels of data availability for a variety of on-premise enterprise applications. In your new role, you will be working in an exciting multi-tasking environment that allows you to demonstrate your core skills of data and performance management. Other activities will require you to envision and develop solutions such as data integration, automation of manual processes, data management, to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, and proactive performance and data quality enhancements.

This position will be based out of Graymont's newly renovated head office in Richmond, BC under a hybrid/flexible work from home and in-office arrangement

Primary Responsibilities

Maintain and manage a robust set of modern highly-available enterprise Microsoft SQL Server systems, and production databases including regular system patching.
Maintain and evolve redundant systems, policies, and procedures for disaster recovery and data archiving to ensure effective protection and integrity of data assets.
Proactively monitor database logs, execution times and resolve performance issues.
Stay current with security alerts and best practices to recommend proactive and remedial actions.
Lead applications team to troubleshoot any service outages, and to maintain efficient application performance.
Design, build and maintain resilient data integrations between both in-house and cloud based applications/systems.
Assist applications team to troubleshoot complex data and other issues.


Requirements

In-depth knowledge of SQL Server (2012 or higher).
Experience using SQL Server High Availability Clusters and Always On Availability Groups
Strong T-SQL development skills
Experience with scripting and automation using PowerShell, Python or similar tools
Experience supporting Enterprise Data Warehouse environments running on SQL Server would be an asset.
Experience with data integrations using Microsoft SSIS, Informatica PowerCenter, or other data integration products would be an asset.
Excellent analysis and data exploration skills to understand complex application schemas and data.
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate within a distributed team across the organization.
Some after-hours work will be required.


Qualifications

Diploma in Computer Science, Information Systems and/or equivalent work experience.
3 or more years of experience in an Application Database Admin and/or Database System Admin or similar role
Certifications such as MSCA (SQL Database Administration), MSCE (Database Management and Analytics) or equivalents would be an asset.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for designing and maintaining critical business intelligence metrics in support of the National Shipbuilding Strategy and the Canadian Coast Guard and Royal Canadian Navy vessel construction projects underway at the Seaspan Vancouver Shipyards.




This position focuses on enhancing the accessibility of and business value derived from key organizational data. This includes both development of new analytics, and support of analytics users throughout the business as well as the development of innovative new methods of collecting, analyzing, presenting, or actioning data.




Note: Due to business needs, this position is required to be fully on-site based at 2 Pemberton Avenue in North Vancouver.




Duties & Accountabilities

Validate data sources, transformations, and analysis against reference data to ensure quality, accuracy, and completeness of derived reports.
Complete data discovery and mapping of shipyard enterprise applications.
Develops documentation of business requirements, data sources, infrastructure, and reports to provide clarity and context for data consumers throughout the shipyard.
Develop dataflows and datasets using Power Query, M, DAX & SQL
Build dataset requirements, metrics, data/report definitions and establishes reporting governance processes.
Optimizes and standardizes all stages of the data analysis process, from extraction through to modelling & visualization.
Collects, validates, interprets, and organizes various types of data into relevant metrics and reports and/or summaries for designated business objectives.
Supports ad hoc and other unplanned analysis and reporting needs as determined by management priority and business changes.
Collaborates with and provides training and knowledge transfer to business end-users of reports and data sources.
Coordinates with Functional Department and Program Resources to define, collect and report departmental, program and shipyards level metrics.
Acts as a Business Intelligence Subject Matter Expert (SME) by supporting team members in the use and interpretation of data and understanding of metrics and reporting requirements.
Understanding business objectives and providing ad hoc data extracts by working with business partners
Effectively use the main data sources for reporting purposes within the business unit and maintain expert knowledge of all of these data sources




Education and Experience

Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Business or a relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and/or work experience will be considered
Minimum 7 years of experience with business analytics, statistical analytics, KPI development and metrics reporting, preferably in a Program & Project Management environment with quantitative, financial or metric analysis on multiple large-scale data warehouses.
Experience with ground-up / full stack analytics solutions is an asset, including development of data sources, loading/transformation, analysis/modelling, reporting, and end user experiences.




Skills, Knowledge and Required Competencies

Well developed understanding of database structure, business object models, and large-scale data processing techniques.
Significant experience with Microsoft Power Query, M, DAX & SQL
Proven experience working with data and databases, including working experience with programming languages and business intelligence tools such as SQL and Power BI, to build dataflows, datasets and analytical solutions and create visual insights and dashboards
Familiarity and understanding of KPI analysis, performance measurement, financial systems and project scheduling/controls systems
Demonstrated data analytic skills including demonstrable ability to merge multiple data sources into substantial information, review incomplete data, problem solve to fill in gaps and provide recommendation for meaningful solutions
Deep technical communication ability, including the ability to clearly and concisely document and communicate complex data structures and process maps.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal/written communication and interpersonal skills for optimally communication
Well-developed organizational skills, including ability to prioritize a variety of work assignments
Experience with Azure Analytics Services, including Azure Analysis Services, is an asset.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and outstanding time management skills.
Experience with the Microsoft Power Platform, including Power Apps and Power Automate (Flow) is an asset




Seaspan is committed to Employment Equity, supports diversity in the workplace, and encourages applications from all qualified individuals including, women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous persons, and persons with disabilities. Furthermore, we are committed to providing an inclusive and accessible environment. If you require reasonable accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know, and we will work with you to support your request.

Title: Data Developer Intern - May 2023
Description:
Who We Are

Olympic Industries ULC is a leading international forest products trading company with our annual revenue exceeding $500 million. Our expertise includes the trading, importing/exporting, and manufacturing of forest products from the comfort of our office located in the heart of the vibrant and breathtaking Lonsdale Quay in North Vancouver, BC.




Established in 1972, we have a strong record of success and a clear vision for our industry's sustainable future. With over 30 active Commodity Traders in house, we are proud to have a corporate culture that rewards hard work, entrepreneurship, and team collaboration.




Opportunity

Olympic Industries ULC is currently searching for a highly motivated and passionate Data Developer to join our team from May through August 2023. Working alongside the derivatives & data team, the Data Developer will gain hands-on experience upkeeping, designing, and implementing analytical models and software.




Responsibilities

The Data Developer is responsible for the following as well as other related duties as assigned to support the business objectives and purpose of the company:

1. Collaborating with the team in the design and implementation of analytical software:

Develop API endpoints on Flask with SQL database.
Develop dashboard UI on React with Material UI and chart libraries.
Analyze data for various departments and communicate findings to relevant stakeholders.




2. Building and upkeeping analytical models to provide a dynamic analysis of the business:

Perform code optimization in existing data projects.
Create statistical and forecasting models on complex inventory and trading data.
Create and improve automation processes for routine data processing tasks.
Testing and debugging programs.




Position Requirements

To be successful in the Data Developer position, an individual must be committed to developing, maintaining, and demonstrating the following:




Education and Experience

Working towards a degree or diploma in a related program such as Computer Science, Statistics, and Software/Electrical Engineering.
Experience in scripting languages, preferably Python.
Experience in web frameworks such as Node, Django and/or Flask.
Experience or knowledge in writing SQL queries and data pipeline.
Experience or knowledge in basic JavaScript, CSS, HTML, or frontend development.
Experience or knowledge in react.js, chart.js, recharts, and/or jQuery.js.
Basic understanding or interests in learning Material UI and Bootstrap.
Familiarity with good practices, programming patterns, and algorithm complexities.
Experience or knowledge in machine learning, data mining, statistical modelling and forecasting considered an asset.




Competences

Proven ability to complete work in a timely manner with exceptional accuracy and attention to detail.
Outstanding verbal, written, and visual communication skills.
Ability to use strong judgement in analyzing, troubleshooting, and evaluating problems.
Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks based on communicated expectations.
A high degree of initiative, work ethic, integrity, and honesty.
Ability to listen and understand instructions and work independently or with others to complete tasks.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, including Outlook, Word, and Excel.
Ability to act with good judgement and discretion: keeping sensitive business data secure.
Desire and capacity to acquire new knowledge and develop new skills, specifically in the commodities trading industry.
Ability to conduct research into systems issues as required.
High-energy with an entrepreneurial spirit.




Compensation

$45K-50K per annum.
On-site kitchen with a Nespresso bar.
On-site gym.







Why Join Us?

Small Company with Big Perks

Olympic is a mid-sized company with an open door/open concept layout where anybody you may need is easily accessible. This layout not only helps to support individuals in their career growth and development but also encourages individuals to interact and be curious about how different departments support each other in their roles.




Great Central Location

Located in the Lonsdale Quay, Olympic is transit accessible from any location in the lower mainland. There are many great shops, restaurants, and parks within a walking distance and the mountains are just a 10-minute drive away.




For more information on Olympic Industries, please visit our website at www.olympicind.com . To apply, please submit a resume in confidence to careers@olympicind.com and follow our company's LinkedIn Page.




﻿

We thank all applicants for their interest! However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. At Olympic Industries, we embrace diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, cultures, perspectives skills, and experiences. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from all qualified individuals.

Title: Data and Business Intelligence Analyst II
Description:
At Edward Jones, we help clients achieve their serious, long-term financial goals by understanding their needs and implementing tailored solutions. To ensure a personal client experience, we have located our 15,000+ branch offices where our more than 7 million clients live and work.

In a typical branch office, a financial advisor meets with clients and receives branch office support, so they can focus on building deep relationships with clients. Headquarters associates in St. Louis, Tempe and Mississauga provide support and expertise to help U.S. and Canada branch teams deliver an ideal client experience. We continue to grow to meet the needs of long-term individual investors.Within Edward Jones Canada, we are growing our Data Analytics capability to service the analytical priorities of all functional areas within Canada.The primary purpose is to increase data acumen across Home Office and our branch teams, and incorporate analytics into our decision-making and prioritization. In this role, you will be responsible for developing and evolving best in class analytics in partnership with functional areas to determine business needs and recommended solutions.

Do you like thinking outside the box? Are you a big picture thinker? This is the kind of thinking Edward Jones Canada - Data Analytics needs to grow impact and enhance both client and branch experience.

Responsibility Summary:

Business Intelligence (BI):

Build specialized reporting packages, dashboards, and scorecards to inform senior leaders and functional areas.
Validate the quality and integrety of data included in all reporting; ability to test and maintain BI products developed while following governance procedures.


Storytelling & Communication:

Generate and incorporate insights into a cohesive story that clearly addresses business questions and influences decision making.
Effectively lead the creation and communication of tailored messages to influence senior leaders regarding analytic ideas, approach, key takeaways and actionable insights.
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences.


Business Understanding:

Maintain a strong understanding of division results and business drivers; understanding to analytic approach to influence key strategies and business performance.
Drive measurement, improvement and optimization strategies by connecting business activity to outcomes that will help achieve stated goals.


Business Consulting & Data Coaching:

Develop and manage business relationships with project team members and senior leaders across the organization.
Consult with business owners to understand the business problem; independently identify the appropriate analytic approach to solve the problem.
Provide mentorship and feedback to others on analytic approach and leverage systems thinking to connect work to other strategic initiatives.
Serve as a functional and technical data subject matter expert; educate senior and executive leaders across the firm on analytical concepts and best practices.


Analysis:

Understand and apply statistical concept; proactively identify opportunities with impact where analytics can inform the business.
Provide actionable insights to support business decisions and strategy by performing root cause, exploratory, sensitivity and scenario analysis, hypothesis testing, economic modeling and data visualization to identify trends for business needs
Actively participate in industry and trade data and analytic communities in order to bring fresh ideas to the organization.


Data:

Define business and data requirements for analytic efforts while building cross-functional relationships.
Build and maintain an understanding of data flows, sources, and data transformations across multiple domains; extract, merge, cleanse and transform data from multiple sources as needed for analysis.
Apply critical thinking to pressure test and validate logic and outputs against known sources and understanding of business.
Proactively identify data quality issues and collaborate with other subject matter experts to identify solutions.


Operational Efficiency:

Document, monitor, and improve processes and controls related to areas of responsibility.
Proactively identify opportunities for efficiency with moderate to broad impact and visibility, propose solutions to relevant parties and drive implementation of solutions.
Bachelor's Degree required in relevant discipline, preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or Analytics or relevant work experience.
3 - 5 years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, Statistics
Strong analytical, critical and systems thinking required.
Apply innovation and creativity to improve work efficiency; effective in managing multiple priorities with strong organization and time management skills.
Experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, required.
Proficiency interacting with various database and file storage systems (Oracle, Hadoop, NoSQL).
Understanding of statistical concepts and analytic techniques/types (descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, prescriptive).
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Access); advanced knowledge of VBAs, Macros
Experience with Data Visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBi, or QlikView


100 Best Workplaces for Millennials in 2022, published Fortune July 2022, Great Places to Work® data as of March 2022. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.
Edward Jones was recognized as one of the Best Workplaces for Millennials by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. The privately held firm ranked No. 2 overall, in its fourth appearance on the list.
2022 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, published September 2022, research by Great Places to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.
Edward Jones has been named to the 2022 Best Workplaces for Women list by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine, ranking No. 45.
2022 Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For, published April 2022, research by Great Place to Work®, data as of August 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.
For the 23rd time, Edward Jones has earned a spot on the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® ranking by Great Places to Work® and Fortune® magazine. Edward Jones ranked No. 35 on the prestigious 2022 list.
2022 Best Places to Work For LGBTQ+ Equality, Great Place to Work® in partnership with Human Rights Campaign Foundation, published Equity Magazine January 2022, data as of July 2021. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.
Edward Jones scored 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign Foundation's 2022 Corporate Equality Index (CEI) the nation's foremost benchmarking survey and report measuring corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ+ workplace equality. The ranking designated Jones as one of the best places to work for LGBTQ+Equality.


Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Title: Marketing Performance & Insights Analyst (Hybrid)
Description:
Working at Vancity you’ll be a part of a values led organization on a mission to change our world for the better. You’ll also be joining an organization that puts people first and is continually looking for ways to promote our employee’s well-being. This shows up in many ways, including: 



Generous vacation days (starting at 4 weeks). 
A defined benefit pension (you may have to ask around what they are as they are pretty uncommon these days) with generous employer contributions. 
Up to $2,400 towards self-directed professional development each year 
Flexible work schedules available. 
Remote work arrangements.

The Marketing Performance & Insights Analyst identiﬁes opportunities for future marketing initiatives based on past performance, insights obtained through analysis and/or research and develop solutions to track performance and to reach target audiences. If you have proven experience in this space, we want to hear from you!



In this role, you will:



Work closely with business stakeholders and marketing colleagues to deliver targeted marketing campaigns to support Vancity’s Member Contact Strategy.
Design and build solutions to provide ongoing reporting and tracking of marketing eﬀorts.
Deﬁne KPIs and conduct post implementation reviews to measure success of marketing campaigns & programs.
Analyze internal & external data to identify growth marketing opportunities to meet business objectives.
Apply organizational risk and compliance standards, policies, procedures and controls to meet regulatory requirements and mitigate risk.
Develop increasingly deep knowledge around Vancity’s products, services and members.

You are:



Resourceful and a self-starter
Engaged team player who is comfortable working in a collaborative environment and using data to make marketing decisions.
Passionate about leveraging data & analytics to drive business results.

You have:



Undergraduate degree in Business, Statistics, Computer Science or related discipline
3 - 5 years of proven analytics experience.
Solid research and analytical skills to perform qualitative/quantitative analysis, applying accepted methods to carry out analytical procedures.
Advanced knowledge of business intelligence techniques, data manipulation & data visualization tools such as Microsoft SQL Server, Power BI etc.
Financial Industry knowledge would be an asset
Experience working with Google Analytics and marketing automation tools would be an asset.
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Strong relationship-building skills and the ability to work collaboratively
Exceptional attention to detail 

The team:



In this role, the Marketing Performance & Insights Analyst will report directly to the Manager, Marketing Performance and Insights.



Posting Deadline:  Open until filled.



At Vancity we’re committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive workplace to help our people and communities thrive and prosper. Diversity in our workforce is integral so that we can truly represent, understand and respond to our community needs and deliver on our member experience.



 



As part of this commitment we are taking action to learn more about our applicants and ask that you complete a short and anonymous Diversity Survey that will influence the design and execution of Vancity’s overall DEI initiatives and programs, one of which aims to advance our commitment to become a financial force for change and build a fair world.​ Please click this hyperlink to complete the Diversity Survey.  Your responses are collected anonymously and will never be linked to your job application.



 



Please note that all shortlisted candidates for this role will be required to complete a background check which includes resume verification, credit check, criminal record check. Vancity is an inclusive and equitable employer and actively seeks to advance racial equity, inclusion and belonging across the organization.



Vancity offers required accommodations in all stages of the recruitment process.  If you require an accommodation, please advise us, and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Must Haves

4+ years of experience working as a Data Engineer implementing large scale solutions
2+ years of experience with Snowflake
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or a related field
Strong experience with Airflow
Strong experience with RedShift
Proficient experience with SQL and Python
Knowledge on agile software delivery methodologies
Good communication skills both verbal and written

Plusses

Gaming experience

Day-to-Day

Insight Global is looking for a Data Engineer to join a large employer remotely in Vancouver, BC. This candidate will join a large business unit that specifically supports other major line of business within the company. More specifically, this person will help design, build, and launch scalable and reliable data pipelines to move and transform data. This is a highly collaborative position where the candidate will be working with Data Architects, Analysts and BI Developers to understand and develop technical specifications. In addition, this candidate will be joining a fast-paced environment and will be expected to make an impact at the forefront.

Title: Data Analyst, Strategic Partnerships( Bangkok based)
Description:
About Agoda




Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.




Key Areas of Focus:




In this role, you’ll get to:




Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.




Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.




Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.




Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers




Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.




Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.




Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.




What you’ll Need to Succeed: 




4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields
Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations
Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areas
Entrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work
Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment 
Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders 




It’s Great if you have: 




Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn 
Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn
Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Show more Show less
HTML:
About Agoda


Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.


Key Areas of Focus:


In this role, you’ll get to:


Strategy: Conduct analyses to identify growth opportunities and prioritize investment areas in APAC for Strategic Partnerships team based on analytical insights, industry trends, and changing competitive landscape.


Analytics: Leverage data & tools to analyze SP performance and identify appropriate levers to improve performance.


Cross-functional projects: Work with different teams inside SP (B2B, White Label, Affiliates, Financial Institutions, different markets across APAC, etc.) and outside of SP (product, marketing, supply, finance, etc.) to drive initiatives.


Performance management: Maintain and optimize a performance management system for the department, including a large team of account managers


Data & tools: Oversee SP data infrastructure to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness. Design, manage, and oversee the maintenance of data tools to support decision making.


Performance reporting: Preparing updates on business performance, proposals, and recommendations to senior management.


Pricing Experiments: Optimize pricing strategy and make decisions based on A/B experiments.


What you’ll Need to Succeed: 


  • 4 years and above of experience with Consulting, Data Analytics, Strategy, Business Development, Business Intelligence, or other relevant fields
  • Proven ability to leverage analytics and quantitative methods to break down ambiguous problems and come up with recommendations
  • Growth mindset and excited to work on a variety of functional areas
  • Entrepreneurial and not afraid to be hands-on on the work
  • Experience working in a fast-paced and high growth environment 
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written in English) with ability to work well across multiple stakeholders 


It’s Great if you have: 


  • Ability to write in SQL a plus, or willingness to learn 
  • Ability to use Tableau a plus, or willingness to learn
  • Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics a plus

Title: HR Data & Systems Analyst
Description:
COMPANY BACKGROUND

The Atlas Corp. and Seaspan teams are goal-driven and share a high-performance culture, focusing on building services offerings to become a leading asset manager. Seaspan provides many of the world's major shipping lines with alternatives to vessel ownership by offering long-term leases on large, modern containerships combined with industry-leading ship management serves. Seaspan's fleet has evolved over time to meet the varying needs of our customer base. We own vessels in a wide range of sizes, from 2,500 TEU to 14,000 TEU vessels. As a wholly-owned subsidiary of Atlas Corp (NYSE: ATCO), Seaspan delivers on the company's core strategy as a leading asset management and core infrastructure company.




ROLE DESCRIPTION

The HR Data & Systems Analyst provides HR Department support with a primary focus on managing and developing HR systems to provide an effective Systems, Data & Analytics capability for Atlas/Seaspan. This role develops and broadens our reporting and analytic support to the global HR team, including building reporting capability to strengthen the HR team’s data-driven decisions. This role enhances our overall workplace culture through more enhanced and targeted people investment and decision-making capabilities.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Leverage HCM systems to realize their full potential to drive value add within the organization, enhancing functional efficiency via increased automation and retirement of manual processes.
Provides HCM and systems support to HR processes including performance management, employee data management, workforce planning & reporting, ATS and audit compliance, such as preparing performance review reporting, supporting salary planning and incentive program processes, and fulfilling audit documentation requests.
Manage and maintain (configuration, integration, and support) companywide HCM systems; troubleshoot all issues and manage software upgrades and implementations.
Continually improves the extraction and usage of HCM data and interpretation, further providing business leaders with actionable insights.
Ensure accuracy and completeness of HR reporting, analytics, and metrics.
Create internal materials related to HCM & HR processes, reporting and FAQ materials for consumption by business stakeholders.
Participates in the generation and preparation of scheduled and ad-hoc reports, including the gathering and validation of data.
Assists with department analytics and financial reporting, including inputs into Board and Executive reporting
Actively participates in projects, including focusing on improvement, reporting and delivery for the HR team
Performs other duties as required




REQUIREMENTS:

4+ years of experience in an HR role with focus on systems, data, analytics, reporting and processes
System proficiency in Excel and HCM System (SAP Success Factors preferred, but not essential)
Good verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (including Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint)
Sound organization skills
High attention to detail




If this sounds like a great opportunity for you, click on the APPLY FOR THIS POSITION button below and take a few moments to complete an application and upload your resume. Seaspan employees can apply through the Internal Career Centre, please check SeaNet for the instructions on how to do so.

Atlas Corp. and Seaspan Corporation are an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

We thank all applicants in advance. If your application is shortlisted to be included in the interview process, one of our team will be in contact with you. No agency calls please.

Title: Principal Data Analyst (Plentyoffish Media ULC)
Description:
Founded in Vancouver, Canada in 2003, Plenty of Fish is one of the early pioneers in the online dating industry, with one of the largest and most diverse communities of singles. We're one of the top revenue-driving brands in the Match Group (comprised of Tinder, OkCupid, Hinge and Match.com).




We love what we do, and have the ability to profoundly impact millions of people's lives every single day! Named one of BC’s Top Employers, Plenty of Fish is a great place to build friendships, grow your career and collaborate with top talent.




Please Note: You will have a choice of being Remote-First OR Office-First.




Remote First: You will have the option to work remotely from the Lower Mainland area, but we will require attendance at our downtown Vancouver office for quarterly planning, important meetings, team get togethers or whenever you want to "crew together" IRL!




Office-First: You will get to work from our downtown Vancouver office 2-3 days a week, and work remotely the remainder of the week!




So, what will you do?




Evaluate and monitor the health of our product and member ecosystem on a daily basis
Explore & understand our members’ behaviours at a deep level to inform strategic and tactical decisions
Validate the impact of our product initiatives and changes on our members
Be the go to analyst for the POF Executive team
Coach & mentor other data / product analysts on the team




You'll be a match for this role if you have..




5+ years of hands on experience leading exploratory analysis and driving insights for a social and/or marketplace product autonomously
5+ years working directly with and communicating to members of the executive team
Strong business acumen with a deep understanding of freemium monetization and business models
Effective collaborator and influencer across teams and functions
We would love to hear from you, even if you don't match 100% of the requirements**




Why Plenty of Fish?




We're recognized as one of BC's Top Employers 2022!
We have remote options available
Generous vacation, flex days, professional development days
RRSP matching, and employee stock purchase plan
Professional development budget and unlimited access to Udemy from the day one
Match Group mentorship program
Parental leave top up and fertility preservation benefits
Extended health & dental benefits from day one
Corporate ClassPass membership and other wellness benefits
And many more on our careers page




Our Values




Be Proud - It's OUR sh*p. Own it! We see challenges as opportunities and take action.
Make Waves - We profoundly impact millions of peoples' lives, every day.
Dive Deep - We empathize with our members and use data to surface smart decisions.
Crew Together - We love what we do, have fun, and are free to be ourselves.




Want To Dive Deeper?




LinkedIn




Glassdoor




We’re committed to creating an equal and inclusive environment; we welcome all crew (and prospective crew) members regardless of race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, political belief, religion, marital status, family status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, conviction unrelated to employment, or any other prohibited ground of discrimination recognized by applicable law. Plenty of Fish is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.




Value

Title: Business Systems Analyst, IT Application Support
HTML:
Our client has an immediate opening for a Business Systems Analyst, IT Application Support to join their team in Vancouver.


The Business Systems Analyst, IT Application Support is a key role that will work closely with the various IT teams, business units, and third-party vendors to manage enhancements with focused responsibility on information technology support and project work. This will require an ability to manage, analyze and synthesize complex system requirements and work with a diverse group of business users and IT team members to develop, implement and support solutions, coordinate second-level triage for production incidents, including technical analysis and application troubleshooting with the immediate team and other support groups, work with Back Office stakeholders and IT team members to complete current state analysis and business process redesign, interface with vendors by providing detailed business and functional requirements and/or details of a reported application issue for troubleshooting purpose, liaise with business groups and other IT teams in capturing requirement change requests, identifying business / technical impacts and managing client expectations, lead in testing of system changes and coordinate User Acceptance Testing by creating and executing Test Plans, assist in coordinating system releases to the production environment, perform post-production deployment testing, actively participate in daily change advisory board meetings, create and maintain system documentation, including operations manuals and team knowledge bases, exercise and promote service transition and operations best practices, build ad-hoc reports and data extracts using SQL.


As an ideal candidate, you have the following qualifications:


  • Completion of a diploma or degree in a technical or business field with a minimum of 3 years of experience in a Business Systems Analyst role or other relevant field;
  • Good understanding of quality assurance and testing methodologies;
  • Good working knowledge of SQL Server database with the ability to build queries, analyze raw data and build reports;
  • Intermediate to advanced knowledge of the XML, HTML;
  • Ability to organize and document system requirements;
  • Strong technical aptitude and understanding of practical uses of technology to solve business problems;
  • Excellent communication, interpersonal and facilitation skills and ability to grasp abstract concepts;
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail;
  • Project a mature, professional and optimistic attitude;
  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment with moderate supervision;
  • Strong time management and organizational skills with demonstrated ability to set and commit to multiple deadlines;
  • Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing business needs;
  • General understanding of the finance industry an asset.
  • Must be flexible to work after-hours and weekends at times during production release deployments.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
SAXX Underwear Co. is looking for a BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DEVELOPER to join the team.




This is your opportunity to be part of a globally growing brand in a dynamic work environment. SAXX was ranked #1 men’s boxer brief brand in the USA and listed as one of Fast Company’s Best Workplaces for Innovators 2022!




The Business Intelligence Developer will..




Work in an Agile environment to support and extend the enterprise Business Intelligence (BI) platforms, data models, and data culture. This is a unique opportunity to work at a company where data-driven decision-making is a strategic pillar, not an afterthought. If you are an experienced Business Intelligence Developer looking for an innovative, entrepreneurial, fast-paced company with a great team spirit that has the support of a recognized brand, we encourage you to apply.







RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:




Serve as the subject matter expert on the enterprise BI platforms, data models, and solutions, as well as the business operations that govern them
Work collaboratively with business stakeholders to identify analytics opportunities and establish metrics to support insight-driven decision making
Carry out impact studies, requirements gathering, and provide estimates
Design and develop data models, data transformation processes, and metadata that converts raw data to formats suitable for consumption in enterprise BI platforms, including reporting, data mining, machine learning, forecasting, advanced analytics, etc.
Design, implement and support data provisioning to meet the analytics needs of various business units while following and enhancing BI standards and best practices across the organization
Conduct multidisciplinary and multi-level stakeholder meetings to gather business requirements and provide user training in non-technical language
Translate business requirements into technical designs suitable for technical audiences
Write documents and make presentations for an internal user community
Advise departments on potential sources, use, and impact of data and integrate new data sources into the analytics eco-structure
Ensure optimal end-user satisfaction by establishing and consistently evaluating overall system performance and engagement to ensure actionable insights by the user community
Perform and document testing and validation (unit / integrated) for developed solutions to ensure users trust the data
Implement and continuously improve effective business analytics practices that drive improved decision-making, efficiency, and performance
Ensure availability and accuracy of analytics solutions to support business operations
Identify, communicate, and resolve data quality and data reconciliation issues
Perform technical troubleshooting, code debugging, and problem-solving for custom-built data solutions
Ensure optimum service to all internal and external partners in response to requests for service and information
Monitor and ensure the adoption of BI tools by providing training, documentation, and support to users
Perform software and system maintenance and upgrades relating to the BI platform; document business intelligence and information management solutions.
Manage licenses for user access to BI tools and identify opportunities for increased user engagement




REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or equivalent
Minimum 3 years of experience developing Business Intelligence solutions (Tableau / Qlik Sense / Qlik View / Power BI, SQLServer, SSIS, SSRS);
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Advanced working SQL knowledge with experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL), and SQL optimization
Strong solution design experience including Data modeling, data presentation, data visualization, the definition of key performance indicators, and ETL processing
Good knowledge of relational databases and SQL language
Experience integrating data from different sources (API, Databases, files, etc.)
Experience performing root cause analysis on data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Physical and logical design of database architecture for relational databases, data warehouses, and data lakes
A high degree of flexibility and adaptability to change
A high degree of responsibility and attention to detail
Proven track record of delivering collaborative and business-focused solutions




NICE TO HAVE:

Database administration, optimization, data replication, database recovery, and performance tuning.
Experience in the retail or apparel industry
Experience in an operational role supporting data platforms and business intelligence solutions.
Experience working in an Agile environment




Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. At SAXX we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace community, so if you’re excited about this role, but your past doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might just be the right candidate for this or other roles.




WHY WE THINK YOU’LL LOVE WORKING WITH US

We offer equitable salaries, a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision coverage to support your well-being.
Get additional healthcare support through a virtual healthcare platform and an Employee and Family Assistance Program.
Have your birthday off to celebrate in style.
Four paid days off dedicated for you to volunteer in your community.
Be part of a team of incredibly talented, passionate, and empowered people focused on building and innovating.
Make an impact with your work—each person has an equal opportunity to contribute to our goals.
Join a fast-growing company and find opportunities to grow in your own career—offering advancement opportunities for our team members is important to us!
Hang out with the cute and cuddly dogs at our headquarters.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, we learned the majority of our roles are remote-friendly. Although there may be times when it is required or more effective to be in the office for certain meetings or tasks. As the pandemic evolves, we will continue to adjust our working arrangements as necessary.




TO APPLY...

Please forward your resume and quote BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DEVELOPER in the subject line.




No phone calls please. We appreciate your interest in the role, however; only successful applicants will be contacted for an interview. Thank you for your interest in a career with SAXX.




Please keep tabs on your junk/spam folders. Our emails may end up there and we want to make sure we have the opportunity to connect with you!

  • Ensure optimal end-user satisfaction by establishing and consistently evaluating overall system performance and engagement to ensure actionable insights by the user community
  • Perform and document testing and validation (unit / integrated) for developed solutions to ensure users trust the data
  • Implement and continuously improve effective business analytics practices that drive improved decision-making, efficiency, and performance
  • Ensure availability and accuracy of analytics solutions to support business operations
  • Identify, communicate, and resolve data quality and data reconciliation issues
  • Perform technical troubleshooting, code debugging, and problem-solving for custom-built data solutions
  • Ensure optimum service to all internal and external partners in response to requests for service and information
  • Monitor and ensure the adoption of BI tools by providing training, documentation, and support to users
  • Perform software and system maintenance and upgrades relating to the BI platform; document business intelligence and information management solutions.
  • Manage licenses for user access to BI tools and identify opportunities for increased user engagement


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or equivalent
  • Minimum 3 years of experience developing Business Intelligence solutions (Tableau / Qlik Sense / Qlik View / Power BI, SQLServer, SSIS, SSRS);
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge with experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL), and SQL optimization
  • Strong solution design experience including Data modeling, data presentation, data visualization, the definition of key performance indicators, and ETL processing
  • Good knowledge of relational databases and SQL language
  • Experience integrating data from different sources (API, Databases, files, etc.)
  • Experience performing root cause analysis on data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Physical and logical design of database architecture for relational databases, data warehouses, and data lakes
  • A high degree of flexibility and adaptability to change
  • A high degree of responsibility and attention to detail
  • Proven track record of delivering collaborative and business-focused solutions


NICE TO HAVE:

  • Database administration, optimization, data replication, database recovery, and performance tuning.
  • Experience in the retail or apparel industry
  • Experience in an operational role supporting data platforms and business intelligence solutions.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. At SAXX we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace community, so if you’re excited about this role, but your past doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might just be the right candidate for this or other roles.


WHY WE THINK YOU’LL LOVE WORKING WITH US

  • We offer equitable salaries, a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision coverage to support your well-being.
  • Get additional healthcare support through a virtual healthcare platform and an Employee and Family Assistance Program.
  • Have your birthday off to celebrate in style.
  • Four paid days off dedicated for you to volunteer in your community.
  • Be part of a team of incredibly talented, passionate, and empowered people focused on building and innovating.
  • Make an impact with your work—each person has an equal opportunity to contribute to our goals.
  • Join a fast-growing company and find opportunities to grow in your own career—offering advancement opportunities for our team members is important to us!
  • Hang out with the cute and cuddly dogs at our headquarters.
  • During the COVID-19 pandemic, we learned the majority of our roles are remote-friendly. Although there may be times when it is required or more effective to be in the office for certain meetings or tasks. As the pandemic evolves, we will continue to adjust our working arrangements as necessary.


TO APPLY...

Please forward your resume and quote BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE DEVELOPER in the subject line.


No phone calls please. We appreciate your interest in the role, however; only successful applicants will be contacted for an interview. Thank you for your interest in a career with SAXX.


Please keep tabs on your junk/spam folders. Our emails may end up there and we want to make sure we have the opportunity to connect with you!

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
This is a completely new opportunity with a Vancouver-based company that is looking for an experienced Data Center Technician to join their growing team. You will be based out of their Vancouver office location, and they have a hybrid work model, so you will work in the office 3 days a week. This is a more senior role on the team, and you'll report to the IT Director.




In this role, you will be working on all aspects of their IT infrastructure; you'll be working on systems and networking, so a diverse skillset is required. They work in a mostly M365 environment, with both on prem and cloud servers in place. Some of the work that you'd be doing would include maintaining their servers, fire cables, networking equipment and policies.




In this role, you will:




[-] Manage complex networks and configure networking equipment

[-] You will administer and manage NAS and SANs upgrades

[-] You will administer MFA systems and upgrade VMWare and virtual environments

[-] You will configure DNS servers and alerting systems




This is a full-time position that includes a competitive base salary, extended benefits, and paid vacation.







The interview process …




A bit about myself - my name is Tanvi Krishna, and I am a recruitment consultant based in Vancouver, BC. I am constantly working on IT and creative roles, and I am always looking to meet new people.




If you're interested in pursuing this role, please apply to this posting. If you are selected for the next stage, I will give you a ring. This is a chance for us to discuss the job requirements in greater detail, as well as your career goals and preferences for your next position. We can also discuss other opportunities which may fit what you're looking for.




Please feel free to reach out and find me on LinkedIn by searching my name: Tanvi Krishna







Requirements ...




[-] 5-7 years' worth of IT experience in a Data Center Technician/Engineer role

[-] Advanced understanding of networking devices and firewalls (Fortinet)

[-] Strong understanding of fiber optics networking

[-] Understanding of virtualization especially VMWare




[ VISA / RELOCATION SUPPORT ]







[-] Preference will be given to candidates who are currently in Vancouver with proper working permission to work in Canada

[-] No relocation or VISA sponsorship support will be offered for this role

Title: Specialist Data Integration Data Analytics, Reporting & Evaluation
Description:
Data Integration Specialist




PHSA Corporate




201 - 13737 96 Ave, Surrey BC V3V 0C6




Reporting to the Decision Support Consultant, Information Integration, the Data Integration Specialist provides integrated healthcare data analysis and interpretation to senior leadership, agency committees, departments and external consultants. This role is responsible for opportunity identification, business requirements analysis, design and development of data marts and business intelligence solutions and extension of the Enterprise Data Warehouse. The Data Integration Specialist provides assistance to Performance Measurement & Reporting staff and to data/information creators in other departments with data quality, data manipulation and reporting, data integration (ETL), and data conversion.




What You’ll Do




Supports Performance Measurement and Reporting services in the development and distribution of healthcare data via business intelligence tools. Serves as a technical expert to program managers, physicians and the executive on accessing patient specific data and provides orientation to the tool as required for staff and clients.
Develops data warehousing infrastructure to enable distribution of complex reports in a more robust way.
Participates in the development, definition and reporting of patient specific data based performance indicators as related to agency operations, access and throughput, for use at the program director and executive level. Liaises on behalf of the agency with external consultants on the provisioning of patient specific data, as well as providing education on analysis and interpretation.
Performs database administration tasks including database creation, database tuning, security administration, file management and data replication.
Performs data administration tasks including the maintenance and integrity of patient specific data infrastructure, modelling the conceptual, logical and physical data architecture, creating value added data elements, and reporting of complex integrated information. Leads the identification of new data sources and implements data extraction routines from departmental feeder systems. Provides advice and direction on patient specific data availability and quality. Consults and problem-solves with feeder departments regarding periodic downloads.
Oversees routine processing activities within the Performance Measurement and Reporting department related to key decision support applications. Develops and executes detailed, complex database scripts with regard to extraction, transformation, loading and analysis of patient specific data.
Represents Performance Measurement and Reporting on committees at various levels with regard to data standards, appropriate usage, availability and quality.




Qualifications




What you bring




A level of education, training, and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Health Information Science/Management from a recognized school plus a minimum of three (3) to five (5) years recent related work experience.
Ability to apply in-depth subject matter knowledge in a healthcare, science or business discipline to the design of a business intelligence solution.
Superior analytical and problem solving skills including the ability to comprehend complex large scale health care environment operational issues and related data/information and present information in concise meaningful ways.
Ability to understand and explain complicated technical issues in non-technical terms.Advanced knowledge, and experience in application of best practices of data standards, database design, data architecture and modeling. Expertise in developing ETL solutions using SQL Server Integration Services (2008).
Superior database querying skills using Structured Query Language -preferably T-SQL.
Understanding of report writing tools such as Crystal Reports and SQL Server Reporting Services.
Ability and experience in developing technical documentation.
Customer focused with ability to facilitate and encourage cooperation between professionals from other disciplines.
Ability to educate and lead management staff on the importance of using high quality data for decision making, via business intelligence tools and other means.
Demonstrated administrative, organizational, work planning and control skills.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Ability to work under pressure and multi-task with little direct supervision.
Persistence and a positive attitude are essential given the iterative development cycle and sometimes problematic data integration issues.




Skills & Knowledge




Commitment to upholding the shared responsibility of creating lasting and meaningful reconciliation in Canada as per TRC (2015) and BC's Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act (2019).
As a strong asset for consideration, we are looking for our successful candidate to have: Knowledge of social, economic, political and historical realities impacting indigenous communities and familiarity with Indigenous Cultural Safety and anti-racism and accompanying reports (BC DRIPA, TRC, etc.).




What We Bring




Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.




Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth, development, and recognition programs that honour the commitment and contribution of all employees.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Access to WorkPerks, a premium discount program offering a wide range of local and national discounts on electronics, entertainment, dining, travel, wellness, apparel, and more.




Job Type: Regular Full-Time




Salary Range: $67,864 - $97,555/year. The starting salary for this position would be determined with consideration of the successful candidate’s relevant education and experience, and would be in alignment with the provincial compensation reference plan. Salary will be prorated accordingly for part time roles.




Location: 201 - 13737 96 Ave, Surrey BC V3V 0C6




Hours of Work: 08:00-16:00 Monday-Friday




Requisition #: 124821E




As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.




What We Do




The Provincial Health Services Authority (




Learn More About PHSA And Our Programs




PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.




Reconciliation is an ongoing process and a shared responsibility for all of us. The BC Governments’ unanimous passage of the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act was a significant step forward in this journey—one that all health authorities are expected to support as we work in cooperation with Indigenous Peoples to establish a clear and sustainable path to lasting reconciliation. True reconciliation will take time and ongoing commitment to work with Indigenous Peoples as they move toward self-determination. Guiding these efforts Crown agencies must remain focused on creating opportunities that implement the Truth and Reconciliation Commission Mandate.

Title: Data Engineer - Remote, Full-Time
Description:
Bluelight Consulting is a leading software consultancy seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join our fast-growing team. Our mission is to design and develop technology that improves the lives of its users while providing an exceptionally high level of service to our clients.




We are looking for Data Engineer who wants to be part of a fast-paced, dynamic environment, where everyone’s opinions and efforts are valued. We hire outstanding individuals and give them the opportunity to thrive in a collaborative atmosphere that values learning, growth, and hard work.




Our team is distributed across the United State and Central / South America. If you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, and rapidly-growing software development consultancy, and if you are passionate about software development and creating the finest apps in the marketplace, please apply below.




What We Are Looking For




Experience with AWS services including but not limited to S3, Athena, EC2, EMR, and Glue
Ability to solve any ongoing issues with operating the cluster
Experience with the integration of data from multiple data sources
Experience with various database technologies such as SQLServer, Redshift, Postgres, and RDS
Experience with one or more of the following data integration platforms: Pentaho Kettle, SnapLogic, Talend OpenStudio, Jitterbit, Informatica PowerCenter, or similar
Knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
Experience with or knowledge of Agile Software Development methodologies
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills
Excellent oral and written communication skills with a keen sense of customer service
Experience with collecting/managing/reporting on large data stores
Awareness of Data governance and data quality principles
Well versed in Business Analytics including basic metric building and troubleshooting
Understand Integration architecture: application integration and data flow diagrams, source-to-target mappings, data dictionary reports
Familiar with Web Services: XML, REST, SOAP
Experience with Git or similar version control software
Experience with integrations with and/or use of BI tools such as GoodData (Prefered), Tableau, PowerBI, or similar
Broad experience with multiple RDBMS: MS SQLServer, Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift
Familiarity with SaaS/cloud data systems (e.g. Salesforce)
Data warehouse design: star-schemas, change data capture, denormalization
SQL/DDL queries/Tuning techniques such as indexing, sorting, and distribution
BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
3+ years of Data Pipeline development such as SnapLogic or Datastage, Informatica, or related experience
3+ years of SQL experience (No-SQL experience is a plus)
Experience designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines


What You'll Be Doing




Develop and maintain data models for core package application and reporting databases to describe objects and fields for support documentation and to facilitate custom application development and data integration
Monitoring execution and performance of daily pipelines, triage and escalate any issues
Collaborates with analytics and business teams to improve data models and data pipelines that feed business intelligence tools, increasing data accessibility and fostering data-driven decision-making across the organization
Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality, ensuring production data is always accurate and available for key stakeholders and business processes
Writes unit/integration tests, contributes to engineering wiki, and documents work
Performs data analysis required to troubleshoot data-related issues and assist in the resolution of data issues
Work within AWS/Linux cloud systems environment in support of data integration solution
Works closely with a team of frontend and backend engineers, product managers, and analysts
Teamwork: Collaborate with team members. Share knowledge, provide visibility of interpersonal accomplishments and follow directions when provided


Company Benefits




Competitive salary and bonuses, including performance-based salary increases
Generous paid-time-off policy
Technology / Office stipend
100% remote work, now and post COVID
Continuing education, training, conferences
Company-sponsored coursework, exams, and certifications


Being a software consultant is a fun, challenging, and rewarding career choice for engineers. Your contributions are highly valued by clients, and the work you do often has a direct and significant impact on the client’s business.




You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects for our incredible clients, which will help you quickly improve as a consultant and software engineer. You will get to work with modern languages and frameworks alongside some of the best developers in the world!




So if you have the desire to be a part of an exciting, challenging, rapidly-growing software consultancy, please apply.

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Management (Permanent, Full Time)
Description:
Overview

BCLC’s two offices are located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam Indian Band), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples in Vancouver and the Tk’emlúps te Secwépemc territory, situated within the Secwépemc Nation in Kamloops. We honour and respect the people, the territory, and the land we are part of.

Joining the Social Purpose & Player Experience division at BCLC means you’ll be working with a dedicated group of talented professionals in Communications, Community & Stakeholder Engagement, Public Affairs, Player Health, Customer Support Operations, Business Intelligence, Marketing, CRM and Loyalty and Player Experience. As a Crown Corporation that earns more than a billion dollars in annual profit, BCLC’s commitment to giving funds back to the province is an integral part of our business, but still only one piece of a bigger picture. BCLC is committed to creating a welcoming workplace where everyone feels safe, included, and valued. For us, that means building a team that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve. We all are winners when differences are respected, valued and celebrated.

At BCLC, we exist to generate win-wins for the greater good. We believe everything we do must benefit the well-being of all involved. Through our Social Purpose, we aspire to make sure, in all of our endeavours, transactions and relationships – in the most important sense of life, livelihood, meaning, and well-being – nobody loses, and every person we touch comes out ahead.

Social Purpose is the driving force of our business, our opportunity to create a better world through innovation, engagement, and connection. BCLC aims to provide something unique that not only fills a need, but provides value to the province. Join the team responsible for telling our story, building stakeholder relationships, connecting with communities, and achieving our strategic vision for player-centered sustainable growth.

Job Summary

The Senior Analyst, Data Management supports the data management practice in the Enterprise Insights (EI) team, leading the definition of data standards, managing the corporate data assets, and maintaining the Data Dictionary/Metadata repository. This role is critical in being the liaison between business users and highly technical team members, defining guidelines and metrics for all master data assets and supporting the development of an Enterprise Data Governance Framework. The Senior Analyst, Data Management supports the enterprise in the understanding of BCLC data sources to improve data maturity and literacy.

Key Accountabilities

Supports the data management practice in the EI team leading the definition of data standards, managing the corporate data asset, creating and maintaining the Data Dictionary/Metadata repository. Acts as a liaison between EI team, Data Governance team, and other relevant stakeholders in the organization with respect to the data management practice.
Acts as subject matter expert and key point of contact for the business to ensure data requirements are assessed and understood to meet business needs; identifies business rules and data definitions; monitors and measures data quality across lines of business to provide visibility of current status and improvement opportunities; defines data profiling requirements with key stakeholders to ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Develops strategies and plans for supporting the achievement of business and data objectives while working closely with stakeholders.
Supports the successful development and delivery of projects related to Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Data Integration, and Data Warehousing. Acts as a subject matter expert during requirements gathering and a liaison between business users and technical team members. Performs impact analysis, development support for the Enterprise Data Warehousing team, user acceptance testing and production readiness
Collaborates and builds relationships with business clients and key stakeholder groups to determine guidelines for information sharing across the enterprise and external partners and to establish the governance principles reflective of the business’ needs; advises key stakeholders to assist with their need for governance, data stewardship and data ownership.
Assists in defining guidelines and metrics for all master data parameters, and collaborates with technical and non-technical teams to build and maintain a strong data governance framework, guidelines and best practices.
Leads data assessments to identify gaps and maturity opportunities.
Leads data management best practices including leading the development and maintenance of best data management practices within the EI team; fostering an organizational culture that recognizes and promotes best data management practices; supporting and mentoring other client management and solution delivery team members; and providing feedback to management related to the best tools and methodologies to support the data management practice.
Advises team members on data availability from source systems to the Enterprise Data Warehouse.
Works with relational databases, applications, and executes SQL statements in support of data integration projects and data quality investigations.
Supports the successful development and delivery of projects related to Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics Data Integration, and Data Warehousing.
Works with the Data Architects to provide input into the Enterprise Data Model in support of Master Data Management and data governance.

Minimum Required Qualifications

Education and Experience

Degree in Business Admin, Computer Science, or Information Technology;
Certification in Business Analysis is desired;
4-6 year’s related experience in a data engineering, analytics engineering, data governance, or data analytics role
Experience in application development and/or data analysis and governance is required;
Strong experience in business intelligence tools and/or data governance;
Related industry experience would be an asset;
An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered.

Technical Requirements

Experience with Metadata, Data Quality, Data Catalog and Data Governance platforms (e.g. Collibra, Alation, Informatica, Atlan, SAP IS/MDG, IBM MDM)
In-depth understanding of data within one or more of the following business domains: Finance, Supply Chain Management, Marketing or Operations;
SQL/SAS proficiency and database analysis skills;
Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio, and Outlook expertise;
Excellent analytical ability and a strong understanding of data concepts such as data modelling and data profiling
Advanced communication skills, both written and oral with the ability to work in a cross-functional environment with all levels of management and to explain complex information in an effective manner;
Ability to act on own initiative, to exercise sound judgment and to prioritize tasks;
Ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail;
Excellent interpersonal , time management multi-tasking and organizational skills;
Excellent conflict resolution and effective mediation and facilitation skills;
Demonstrated ability to proactively identify potential problems and vulnerabilities and apply a structured approach to problem solving;
Ability to manage deadlines, multiple tasks and adapt well to changing priorities;
Self-starter with the ability to learn and adapt quickly.

Additional Information

Effective November 22, 2021, BCLC requires all employees to be fully vaccinated (as defined by Health Canada). Full vaccination will be required before commencing employment with BCLC unless a legal exemption is obtained.
To build a rich diverse workforce representing the communities which we serve, we welcome applications from people of all colours and cultures, persons with diverse abilities, and members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community.
BCLC values work life balance and offers remote work options for its employees.
Relocation assistance is available for successful job candidates.
If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance at any step of your application, please send an email with your request to recruitment@bclc.com.
For over more than a decade, we have been recognized as one of BC’s Top Employers – and we are constantly seeking ways to improve our employee and player experience. To learn more about BCLC, please visit:https://corporate.bclc.com/careers/overview.html

Please Note

This opportunity will remain open until a qualified candidate pool has been established.

Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada and be 19 years of age to work at BCLC.
