Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst will support PEO Digital & Enterprise Services in conducting analysis for datasets pertaining to Navy network performance assessments and reports, root cause analysis, developing courses of action, and providing recommendations to improve overall NEN performance. Support data capture and analytics to inform trade space discussions and leadership investment/divestment decisions. This role will help to develop performance measurement frameworks involving key performance indicators (KPIs), service level requirements, performance metrics, performance goals, user needs and benefits, etc. Additional work includes collection and analysis of performance data to produce periodic reports, and brief analytical results with recommendations to management team.




Required Qualifications:




Must possess active DOD Secret Security Clearance
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.
Experience with one or more coding languages
Experience with statistical software
Extensive knowledge of SQL and big data
Proficient in data analytics and data visualization
Critical thinking and math skills
Experience in leading and working on projects autonomously
Experience in agile methodologies
Experience in supporting distributed systems
Experience in interacting with staff, management, stakeholders and vendors diplomatically and tactfully
Proficient in infrastructure automation and/or automated application deployments
Proficient in Information Technology operations performance, reliability, and availability metrics
Proficient in working with all levels of staff, management, stakeholders, vendors
Proficient in leading, guiding, mentoring, and training others
Proficient in organizational planning, and time management skills
Experience in research, analytical, and problem solving
Experience in producing desired results and achieving goals and objectives
Demonstrated experience in exercising initiative and using good judgment to make sound decisions
Proficient verbal and writing communication skills
Proficient in presenting findings, conclusions, alternatives and information clearly and concisely
Experience in development and/or operations framework methodologies (e.g. ITIL, SDLC)
Demonstrated effectiveness at decision-making, problem-solving and collaboration




Desired Qualifications:




Bachelor’s degree in statistics, machine learning, mathematics, computer science, economics, or any other related quantitative field.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Proficiency in statistics and statistical packages like Excel, SPSS, SAS to be used for data set analyzing
Experience/knowledgeable with Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) and Model-Based Systems Engineering (MBSE)
Experienced in cloud migration and engineering cloud centric environments
Previous work-related experience in Navy products, services, programs, policies and procedures
Expertise in application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines
Proficient knowledge of one or more infrastructure components such as orchestration tools, containerization, cloud services, computer and storage systems
Experience with cloud hosted applications.




Education




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, or a related technical field OR equivalent experience




Salary Range:




$80,000-$100,000 depending on experience




Why You’ll Want to Work at GovSG:




Competitive pay and benefits, including PTO and company matched 401k
Development opportunities through comprehensive training suite
Ability to make an impact supporting the warfighter
Opportunities to engage with the community through volunteering




The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.




GovSG is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. GovSG participates in E-Verify.

Description:
We're working with a growing scientifically-driven asset manager who are hiring a Data Analyst to join the Product team in Boston. You will be working closely with the Head of Product Strategy on the design and development of products and investment-related processes.




Responsibilities

Undertake quantitative analysis for product-related requests from external and internal stakeholders.
Analyse market dynamics to facilitate the prioritisation of strategic product opportunities.
Assist the Head of Product Strategy with general data requests and project tasks.

Degree in any STEM subject (Science, Technology, Engineering & Maths).

Programming ability, ideally Python.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Must be authorized to work in the U.S. Position does not provide sponsorship*

At Cisco Meraki, we know that technology can connect, empower, and drive us. By simplifying powerful technology, we can free passionate people to focus on their mission. As the fastest-growing cloud-managed team in the world, our product and technology architecture is changing the landscape of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality.

You:

You will have the opportunity to liaise with various teams. You are passionate about data and can use all of our systems and data to help our company make the best possible data-driven planning decisions. We are looking for a self-starter, who enjoys collaborating, and is looking to continuously learn and grow.

What You Will Do:

We are seeking a Data Analyst to drive Meraki’s growth further. This is a newly created role which is responsible for creating and executing processes within our Global Fulfillment team. The role reports directly into our Director of Operations. As the fastest growing cloud-managed networking team in the world, our products and technology architecture are changing the face of enterprise networking and making cloud-managed IT a reality. We also understand on a personal level, by simplifying powerful technology we can free passionate people to focus on their mission.

Own and lead the global fulfillment team’s forecasting and trend analysis to help plan with our global distribution centers
Support ongoing analysis of business performance trends and insights required to inform decisions, producing reports and analytics to help teams achieve their goals
Build dashboards to make key operational data available to teams
Drive analytics to support continuous improvement projects
Measure and track progress of owned projects and programs


Who You Are

:

We strive to create a welcoming workplace that inspires the insatiably curious and the relentlessly focused to make customer IT and networks utterly simple. We are looking for an individual that lives the Meraki values daily: care deeply, be brave, simplify everything, and everybody in. Our ideal candidate is not bound by a checklist, which includes,

5+ years of analytical experience
Curious and inquisitive, strong interest in diving deep on analyses, strong work ethic, capable of a high level of autonomy and creative contribution
Experience with SQL; additional experience with BI & visualization tools is a strong plus (i.e. DOMO, Looker, Tableau)
Proficient MS Excel skills (pivots, basic formulas, VLOOKUPs)
Experience with top-tier ERP and planning systems, e.g., Oracle, SAP, NetSuite, etc.
Good communication skills and ability to work closely with multi-functional teams
Experience in the enterprise software, networking, or SaaS industry
Creative problem solver who meets or beats project timelines
Decisive and comfortable with a matrix organization
Highly proactive, skilled at independently initiating, leading and measuring projects
Hold Bachelor's degree, MBA or master’s degree is a plus


Why Cisco

Meraki?

Apply here: https://meraki.cisco.com/jobs/?gh_jid=4789844

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking ambitious risks to craft the technologies that give us connected cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with unusual personalities who aren't afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns. We are encouraging leaders, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers. We Are Cisco Meraki.

At Cisco Meraki, we’re challenging the status quo with the power of diversity, inclusion, and collaboration. When we connect different perspectives, we can imagine new possibilities, inspire innovation, and release the full potential of our people. We’re building an employee experience that includes appreciation, belonging, growth, and purpose for everyone.

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis. Cisco will consider for employment, on a case by case basis, qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst, Asset Management

Onyx is seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing Asset Management team as we work to create the bridge from today’s clean energy reality to tomorrow’s possibilities for commercial energy users throughout the United States.

The Onyx Asset Management team is committed to meeting every need of the operational assets so that our clients and stakeholders enjoy the benefits of their commitment to clean energy. 

The Data Analyst will be responsible for data warehouse development for a fleet of solar and battery storage assets with the goal of streamlining reporting processes and advancing the analytic capabilities of the Asset Management team. The Data Analyst will also perform routine remote monitoring of the assets to assist the identification and tracking of performance affecting events in order to drive optimal asset performance and efficient operations and maintenance. This position provides an excellent opportunity for an entry-level renewable energy professional to perform a significant role in operating and optimizing clean energy assets.

The position will be based in our New York City office with an opportunity for a hybrid work schedule. For other locations, remote employment will be considered.




Principal Responsibilities:

•         Develop and maintain data warehouses for asset performance data

•         Write SQL queries for standard reporting needs as well as ad-hoc analyses

•         Develop and manage ETL processes for data warehouses, including cleaning and transforming data from various data sources and formats

•         Remotely monitor distributed generation PV solar and battery storage assets daily to promptly identify and track plant outages/events, underperforming equipment, data quality issues, and performance trends

•         Support regular and ad-hoc asset performance and maintenance reporting for internal and external stakeholders

•         Evaluate project performance and data quality to make recommendations for corrective action or asset improvements

•         Assist with configuring and troubleshooting monitoring platform applications and data communications to them

•         Collaborate with internal engineering and construction teams, and external monitoring system contractors, to onboard systems into asset management, and continue to work with the same teams to maintain a high level of asset data quality throughout operations




Required Qualifications

•         Undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university

•         1-3 years of work experience

•         Experience managing and reporting of large datasets with a high level of attention to detail, as well as a strong ability to analyze and synthesize the data

•         Advanced knowledge of SQL (especially PostgreSQL), query writing, and data warehouse design principles

•         Proficiency with Python and pandas/NumPy

•         Familiarity with data warehouse ETL processes

•         Strong command of Microsoft applications, including an advanced knowledge of Excel and database applications

•         Self-starter with strong organizational skills and the ability to work well both independently and in a dynamic and collaborative work environment

•         Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an honest open communication style

•         Mindful, accountable, responsible, respectful and collaborative approach to work




Preferred Qualifications

•         Degree, certificate, or advanced training in Data Analytics or Data Science

•         Solar, wind or other clean energy focused educational or professional experience

•         Working knowledge of solar performance monitoring programs, especially Power Factors Drive and AlsoEnergy PowerTrack

•         Working knowledge of electrical systems, data acquisition/SCADA systems, and network/remote communications

•         Knowledge of common solar and battery storage performance metrics

•         Working knowledge of solar energy production estimate models and the outputs of related industry standard programs like PVSyst

•         Familiarity with data visualization tools (eg. PowerBI, Tableau)

•         Experience working with various stakeholders to scope and develop dashboards for displaying key performance metrics

•         Experience working with an internal CRM (particularly Salesforce)

Annual Compensation Range

$70,000 - $90,000 depending on applicable experience

EEO Statement

Onyx provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Onyx complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.




To apply: email resume and letter to careers@onyxrenewables.com

Show more Show less
HTML:
Data Analyst, Asset Management

Onyx is seeking a Data Analyst to join our growing Asset Management team as we work to create the bridge from today’s clean energy reality to tomorrow’s possibilities for commercial energy users throughout the United States.

The Onyx Asset Management team is committed to meeting every need of the operational assets so that our clients and stakeholders enjoy the benefits of their commitment to clean energy. 

The Data Analyst will be responsible for data warehouse development for a fleet of solar and battery storage assets with the goal of streamlining reporting processes and advancing the analytic capabilities of the Asset Management team. The Data Analyst will also perform routine remote monitoring of the assets to assist the identification and tracking of performance affecting events in order to drive optimal asset performance and efficient operations and maintenance. This position provides an excellent opportunity for an entry-level renewable energy professional to perform a significant role in operating and optimizing clean energy assets.

The position will be based in our New York City office with an opportunity for a hybrid work schedule. For other locations, remote employment will be considered.


Principal Responsibilities:

•         Develop and maintain data warehouses for asset performance data

•         Write SQL queries for standard reporting needs as well as ad-hoc analyses

•         Develop and manage ETL processes for data warehouses, including cleaning and transforming data from various data sources and formats

•         Remotely monitor distributed generation PV solar and battery storage assets daily to promptly identify and track plant outages/events, underperforming equipment, data quality issues, and performance trends

•         Support regular and ad-hoc asset performance and maintenance reporting for internal and external stakeholders

•         Evaluate project performance and data quality to make recommendations for corrective action or asset improvements

•         Assist with configuring and troubleshooting monitoring platform applications and data communications to them

•         Collaborate with internal engineering and construction teams, and external monitoring system contractors, to onboard systems into asset management, and continue to work with the same teams to maintain a high level of asset data quality throughout operations


Required Qualifications

•         Undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university

•         1-3 years of work experience

•         Experience managing and reporting of large datasets with a high level of attention to detail, as well as a strong ability to analyze and synthesize the data

•         Advanced knowledge of SQL (especially PostgreSQL), query writing, and data warehouse design principles

•         Proficiency with Python and pandas/NumPy

•         Familiarity with data warehouse ETL processes

•         Strong command of Microsoft applications, including an advanced knowledge of Excel and database applications

•         Self-starter with strong organizational skills and the ability to work well both independently and in a dynamic and collaborative work environment

•         Excellent verbal and written communication skills and an honest open communication style

•         Mindful, accountable, responsible, respectful and collaborative approach to work


Preferred Qualifications

•         Degree, certificate, or advanced training in Data Analytics or Data Science

•         Solar, wind or other clean energy focused educational or professional experience

•         Working knowledge of solar performance monitoring programs, especially Power Factors Drive and AlsoEnergy PowerTrack

•         Working knowledge of electrical systems, data acquisition/SCADA systems, and network/remote communications

•         Knowledge of common solar and battery storage performance metrics

•         Working knowledge of solar energy production estimate models and the outputs of related industry standard programs like PVSyst

•         Familiarity with data visualization tools (eg. PowerBI, Tableau)

•         Experience working with various stakeholders to scope and develop dashboards for displaying key performance metrics

•         Experience working with an internal CRM (particularly Salesforce)

Annual Compensation Range

$70,000 - $90,000 depending on applicable experience

EEO Statement

Onyx provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Onyx complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.


To apply: email resume and letter to careers@onyxrenewables.com

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
The Data Analyst is a professional position supporting the Agency Performance, Program Integrity, and Innovation Department in our project to prepare the DOL to procure products and services for an Enterprise Licensing and Permitting technology platform modernization. The Data Analyst is responsible for related data planning and the functionality therein that supports the business, which will mainly encompass the effort to cleanse, transform and model data with the goal of discovering and presenting useful information, informing conclusions, and supporting decision-making in the platform modernization project. The Data Analyst will assist the Project Manager in coordinating project activities, alerting the PM and team of out-of-scope activities. The Data Analyst will assist in developing Project Plan (Charter) and Statement of Work (SOW) and gain approvals.

Requirements

Responsibilities:

The Data Analyst investigates, documents, and offers solutions to data collection and data quality problems, including functional requirements, needed workflows, and accompanying data plans to improvements, close gaps, and to support the development of new applications and workflows within our technology environments. As such he/she must be versatile, a quick learner, and an excellent communicator and translator to understand and clearly express these concepts to the stakeholders involved. This position must be able to communicate to both technical and non-technical staff and to translate concepts between those groups. Insufficient buy-in, resistance to change, and skill deficits are all challenges that will be faced by the incumbent in this position.
  • Acts as a liaison between Agency Performance, Program Integrity, and Innovation Department and other DOL Business Units;
  • Develops and reviews specifications for enhancements to the DOL's Enterprise Applications and associated database environments;
  • Determines which research method to use and how to proceed with research and analysis;
  • Determines which strategy is best for processing data and producing reports;
  • Extract data from various sources (data warehouse, SQL tables, Excel, among others). Work closely with system owners to define/redefine developed models;
  • Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems;
  • Perform analysis on report/query results to ensure accuracy in reporting and recommend solutions;
  • Identify patterns and trends in data sets and recommend changes/solutions to problems;
  • Define new data collection and analysis processes;
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality;
  • Design processes that operationalize the use of data in business decision making;
  • Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques;
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets;
  • Supports the organization’s key business processes and applications;
  • Gathers and documents business requirements;
  • Translates requirements into business, functional, and use case documents or operational artifacts;
  • Develops data plans to support application development;
  • Work alongside teams within the business or the management team to establish business needs;
  • Test solution requests prior to implementation;
  • Generate reports, visuals, and presentations;
  • Assist in developing Project Plan (Charter) and Statement of Work (SOW) and gain approvals;
  • Alert the Project Manager to any “out of scope” activity;
  • Develop and maintain project information with collaboration tools such as SharePoint;
  • Maintain records of time spent on assigned tasks and provide information as required for project management and other administrative purposes;
  • Assists in the creation and delivery of related user documentation and end-user training when requested; and
  • Performs other related duties as required.

In practice, the position requires not only general technical expertise, but also specific substantive knowledge of the breadth and depth of the DOL business operations agency-wide, as well as the technical platforms, so that the challenges can be met. In meeting these challenges, the Data Analyst must display the following job competencies:
  • Supports the DOL's Mission, Ethics and Values in keeping with the general operational standards of the department;
  • Develops productive relationships with our customers and builds Subject Matter Expertise in their fields during engagements;
  • Understands and translates business unit functions and how information service operations, specialized tools, and software facilitate those functions. Uses this understanding to communicate value propositions and risk mitigation for proposed engagements and use case documents;
  • Demonstrates a commitment to continuously improve their knowledge of fast changing computer programs, hardware and software through professional development;
  • Provides exemplary customer service in a courteous and professional manner at all times to all DOL staff and the public we serve;
  • Works with others cooperatively, demonstrating a willingness to be a team player, and contributing to a work environment that focuses on shared departmental goals;
  • Accurately assesses workflow, data, and other process related problems. Recommends and facilitates best fit solutions.

Qualifications:

Minimum Entrance Requirements:
  • Knowledge of and ability to work with business data analysis, query design principles, data visualization, and/or statistical analysis.
  • Knowledge of business data analytics and use of business intelligence and technical tools to source and organize data.
  • Ability to create, prepare and present visual data and to engage in public speaking.
  • Ability to problem solve, use deductive and inductive reasoning, and apply critical thinking skills to complex matters.
  • Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Ability to use data analysis and business intelligence to interpret trends to support business activity.
  • Ability to prepare recommendations, reports and revisions based on business data analytics.
  • Ability to communicate effectively and build relationships with colleagues, superiors and internal and external stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of the methods of statistical report writing.
  • Knowledge of project management and business planning.
  • Ability to adapt to new tools and concepts in the field of Data Analytics.

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Strong customer service skills;
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills;
  • Demonstrated ability to balance, prioritize and organize multiple tasks;
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in teams and across organizations;
  • Demonstrated ability to synthesize feedback and adjust plans accordingly;
  • Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships inside and outside the organization;
  • Basic analytical skills to evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, consolidate details and extract to functional requirements;
  • Demonstrated ability to effectively translate user requirements into business, functional and test scenarios for projects of various sizes and complexity;
  • Knowledge of formal software development life cycle methodologies;
  • Experience preparing technical documentation, including business process models, cross functional flow charts, data catalogs, technical project SOWs and project plans, and performance analysis documents. Ability to analyze complex issues and information relating to systems and programs;
  • Experience in designing program integrity checks;

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST (Power BI, DAX, and Power Query)




Be a part of our success story. Launch offers talented and motivated people the opportunity to do the best work of their lives in a dynamic and growing company. Through competitive salaries, outstanding benefits, internal advancement opportunities, and recognized community involvement, you will have the chance to create a career you can be proud of. Your new trajectory starts here at Launch.




We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will have a strong background in Business Intelligence and experience designing data models, creating dashboards and interactive reports, and converting business requirements into technical specifications. The ideal candidate will be proficient in Power BI, DAX, and Power Query, and have experience performing DAX queries and functions, creating customized charts and custom calculations, and developing tabular and multidimensional data models. This is a challenging and rewarding opportunity for a highly motivated and experienced Data Analyst to join a fast-growing company and make a significant impact on the business.




Responsibilities




Understand business requirements in BI context and design data models to transform raw data into meaningful insights.
Create dashboards and interactive visual reports using Power BI.
Convert business requirements into technical specifications.
Create relationships between data and develop tabular and other multidimensional data models.
Perform DAX queries and functions in Power BI.
Create customized charts and custom calculations as per requirements.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in all reporting and analysis.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze data, develop insights, and provide recommendations.
Required Experience/Qualifications:




Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics)
At least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst
Proficiency in Power BI, DAX, and Power Query
Strong knowledge of data modeling concepts and experience creating tabular and multidimensional data models
Experience with data visualization, dashboards, and interactive reports
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams
Familiarity with SQL and other data manipulation tools is a plus
Compensation and Benefits:




Anticipated Wage Range: $115,000.00 – $132,000.00 – Education and experience will be taken into account, and we are happy to discuss your wage expectations.
Competitive Benefits (PPO and HSA, Dental, Vision, AD&D, STD, LTD, FSA, Pet, Legal, etc.) *employees and immediate family members*
401k offered with company match.
Paid Time Off
Education reimbursement
8 paid holidays
We are Navigators in the Age of Transformation.




We use sophisticated technology to transform clients into the digital age, but our top priority is our positive impact on the human experience. We ease anxiety and fear around digital transformation and replace it with opportunity.




Qualified applicants, please respond to LCG-inquire@launchcg.com with your full name, resume, and a brief description of how your skills match the requirements above. Please refer to job #7372




Launch Consulting is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB SUMMARY: Alan Gray Inc. is a rapidly expanding insurance consulting services firm headquartered in downtown Boston. We are currently seeking a dynamic and professional person to provide data analysis and in support of our various insurance consulting and ad-hoc systems development projects.




MAJOR DUTIES: This position is responsible for importing, creating, reviewing and analyzing various forms of data, designing and maintaining Access/SQL/Online databases, reporting data findings utilizing Access / Excel and Word, overseeing and actively participating in software implementations and effectively communicating the results of these projects to management. The person will research and identify any anomalies in the data, work well independently, meet deadlines and draft canned and ad hoc reports upon completion of data analysis. In addition, the position may require the transfer of data points from scanned/hardcopy documents into meaningful, useful data through scraping, OCR or other means of entry. Some travel may be required.




Qualifications




Qualified candidates will have either insurance-related and/or database programming work experience or a degree plus one to three years’ experience in a related field such as finance, accounting or business analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong computer skills, proficiency in Microsoft Access and Excel, experience with SQL and relational databases, including developing/designing databases and a working knowledge of accounting principles. An understanding of basic statistics would be desirable.




Alan Gray LLC is a leading audit and advisory firm with over 30 years of excellence in the insurance space. Our number one goal is to help our clients realize significant bottom line savings. We can adapt quickly to situational changes and our experienced team is committed to staying current with the latest industry information and advances in technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Note: This is a remote role but candidates must occasionally be able to go to Weymouth, MA.




Finance company based outside of Boston is looking for a Data Analyst to join their finance team. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented and highly organized with 1-3 years of experience in finance. Must be comfortable with data analysis and financial modeling!




Responsibilities




Analyze financial records and policies
Compile client billing metrics for monthly revenue reporting
Complete and manage files for revenue calculations
Run queries through internal databases to extract and analyze billing information
Gather, manage, and manipulate data from multiple reports for analysis; identify trends, extract insights, and deliver actionable presentations of findings.
Provide recommendations to Development teams and Management teams based on analysis.
Work internally to resolve billing issues as needed.
Research current market trends as necessary.




Qualifications




Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or related field
1-3 years of experience in Data Analysis
Proficiency using MS Office Suite products
Excellent MS Excel skills including pivot tables and V Lookups
1-3 years of SQL experience
Experience working with Sage is a plus
Detail-oriented and extremely organized
Proven ability to work under tight deadlines
Ability to identify errors in data collection
Proven critical thinking skills in data analysis

Description:
We're working with a growing scientifically-driven asset manager who are hiring a Data Analyst to join the Product team in Boston. You will be working closely with the Head of Product Strategy on the design and development of products and investment-related processes.




Responsibilities

Undertake quantitative analysis for product-related requests from external and internal stakeholders.
Analyse market dynamics to facilitate the prioritisation of strategic product opportunities.
Assist the Head of Product Strategy with general data requests and project tasks.

Highly numerate ability and familiarity with quantitative concepts.

Programming ability, ideally Python.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Liaison, we’ve helped higher ed institutions build better, more diverse classes for three decades. You may recognize us as the company behind the Centralized Application Service (CAS), Enrollment Marketing services and platform (EMP), SlideRoom, Time2Track, TargetX (CRM) and Othot.




Everything we do is focused on taking that proven success and expanding its scope and scale. Over 31,000 programs on more than 1,000 campuses see us as a forward-thinking partner integral to meeting their total enrollment goals — and we’re building the data- and mission-driven team that will reinforce and expand our role for decades to come.







Data Acquisition and Management

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other

strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data

systems

Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Tailor customer models to each institution’s needs and desired goals.
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Automate or help automate as many manual data activities as possible.




Qualifications




Education

Bachelor’s degree in information systems/technology, computer science, mathematics, or another relevant field required

Experience

Background or familiarity with statistics and business analytics
Advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge and proficiency in MS Office Suite

Skills

Ability to handle large volume of data
Capacity to work independently and as part of a team
Critical thinker
Manage multiple projects and deadlines

HTML:
At Liaison, we’ve helped higher ed institutions build better, more diverse classes for three decades. You may recognize us as the company behind the Centralized Application Service (CAS), Enrollment Marketing services and platform (EMP), SlideRoom, Time2Track, TargetX (CRM) and Othot.


Everything we do is focused on taking that proven success and expanding its scope and scale. Over 31,000 programs on more than 1,000 campuses see us as a forward-thinking partner integral to meeting their total enrollment goals — and we’re building the data- and mission-driven team that will reinforce and expand our role for decades to come.



Data Acquisition and Management

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other

strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data

systems

  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
  • Tailor customer models to each institution’s needs and desired goals.
  • Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
  • Automate or help automate as many manual data activities as possible.


Qualifications


Education

  • Bachelor’s degree in information systems/technology, computer science, mathematics, or another relevant field required

Experience

  • Background or familiarity with statistics and business analytics
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel knowledge and proficiency in MS Office Suite

Skills

  • Ability to handle large volume of data
  • Capacity to work independently and as part of a team
  • Critical thinker
  • Manage multiple projects and deadlines

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity




Data Analyst is sought to build and maintain data analysis scripts to support analysis of cognitive assessments and training programs that will support both analysis in UNITY Based Applications, AWS servers as well on personal computers. Current analysis scripts are in python and data visualization in R. The candidate will need to work well with both scientists, software developers and students to develop and document data analysis procedures.




BA/BS degree (MS preferred) in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Psychology, Neuroscience or related technical field.




One to three years of academic or professional experience.




Programming experience in MATLAB, Python, and R.




Programming and maintaining Python scripts for data processing




40%




Statistical analysis and data visualizations




20%




Documentation and training of data processing and analysis systems




20%




Contributing to other research activities from data collection to data dissemination




20%




Position Type




Data Planning and Analysis




Additional Information




Northeastern University considers factors such as candidate work experience, education and skills when extending an offer.




Northeastern has a comprehensive benefits package for benefit eligible employees. This includes medical, vision, dental, paid time off, tuition assistance, wellness & life, retirement- as well as commuting & transportation. Visit www.northeastern.edu/benefits for more information.




Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.




All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see www.northeastern.edu/diversity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
** LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY**




Position Overview:

We are looking for a motivated, organized, and analytical thinker to join our Operations Team. The ideal candidate must be comfortable corresponding daily on the phone and through professional emails with people in municipal departments. You must have strong attention to detail, communication, and reading comprehension skills. You must be results driven, growth oriented, and able to balance multiple projects at any given time. You must be able to think quickly and be an active problem solver. If you are experienced with real estate taxes, assessment, valuation, or real estate in general – this is the role for you!




Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

● Engage in daily phone and email correspondence to obtain information from government bodies across the country as well as foster working relationships with those people

● Engage in persistent and professional follow-up with necessary parties and maintain working relationships

● Review, analyze, and archive meta-data points from commercial contracts, public records, and information gathered from correspondence with government bodies

● Search public records and online databases for property information, building permits, tax bills, and information related to clients and contracts

● Participate with executive Management Team on company growth strategy

● Prepare and present reports and to the Management Team

● Be a direct support to our Sales Team

● Be creative and have an analytical thinking mentality

● Work collaboratively with all departments to reach company targets

● Participate in regular training and success meetings




Qualifications:

● ● Bachelor’s degree or appropriate job-related experience

● Minimum of 2 years’ professional experience with a preference to those within the commercial real estate industry or experience with property assessments and/or real estate taxes (New college graduates with applicable Intern or co-op experience may be considered)

● Confident and comfortable speaking with others by phone/email

● Able to work independently as well as in a team environment

● Experience with research and data analysis

● Basic skills in Excel and Microsoft Office applications

● Strong organizational, communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

● Proven project management skills and experience handling concurrent projects with attention to detail and accuracy.

● Professional demeanor with a high degree of business acumen

● Creative, persistent, fast learner, and quick thinker - Problem Solver Mentality

● Must be able to handle rejection and overcome work obstacles




Compensation:

Commensurate with experience. Competitive Benefits Package including: 100% paid health insurance, dental, and vision coverage. Flexible Time Off and 401K contribution.

Title: Data Analyst, Onboarding
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join CooperSurgical and help build Embryo Options, the first business of its kind to help guide patients through the process of storing cryopreserved embryos, eggs, and sperm. Embryo Options partners with IVF centers to educate and assist fertility patients with making disposition decisions for their cryopreserved tissue. The IVF center and Embryo Options partnership enables patients to conveniently pay storage fees online, as well as gain access to comprehensive educational content and the world's largest embryo donation platform.




As more and more patients are freezing embryos, eggs, and sperm, our goal is to provide tools to fertility clinics that help their patients to navigate the complicated financial, legal, and ethical issues associated with cryopreservation.




As a Data Analyst on the Embryo Options team, you will work closely with patient data to help IVF centers take advantage of the Embryo Options platform and better understand their patients and their business. Besides helping clinics, you will also develop and visualize insights for the Embryo Options product team that will drive critical business decisions.




You Will:

Clean, analyze, and transform clinic cryo-storage data from disparate, unstructured sources like Excel, Microsoft Access, SQL databases, and CSV
Develop reproducible reports and workbooks to help launch new IVF centers on Embryo Options and keep their data accurate and up-to-date
Work closely with our Center Support team to communicate any data issues back to IVF clinics and EMR providers
Provide clear, reproducible analysis to help answer business questions for IVF centers and our product team
Develop intuitive, insightful data visualizations
Collaborate with our product team to identify new application features that help IVF centers better understand their patient data




You Have:

2+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or a related technical field
Advanced proficiency in SQL
Experience with Excel as well as a programming language like Python or R
Experience designing data visualizations and dashboards using business intelligence tools (Tableau, Looker, Mode, Metabase, etc.)
High attention to detail, including experience with data validation techniques
Precise and effective communication skills for technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to understand the underlying needs of the business and drive impact in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment

About CooperSurgical:

CooperSurgical is a leader in manufacturing and marketing multiple trusted and innovative brands that assist clinicians in improving the health of women, babies and families worldwide. Through an aggressive growth and diversification strategy, CooperSurgical has evolved its portfolio of over 600 products to include products and services used primarily by obstetricians and gynecologists in surgical and medical procedures wherever they occur: in hospitals, surgical centers, medical offices and fertility clinics.

For U.S. locations that require disclosure of compensation, the starting base pay for this role is between $70,000 and $90,000. The actual base pay includes many factors and is subject to change and modification in the future. This position may also be eligible for other types of compensation and benefits.

Our Benefits:

As an employee of CooperSurgical, you'll receive an outstanding total compensation plan. As we believe your compensation goes beyond your paycheck, we offer a great compensation package, medical/dental/vision insurance coverage, 401(k), paid time off for vacation, personal, sick and holidays, paid family leave and many other perks and benefits. Please visit us at www.coopersurgical.com to learn more about CooperSurgical and the benefits of becoming a member of our team.




We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Quanterix is a company on a mission to change the way in which healthcare is provided by giving researchers the ability to closely examine the continuum from health to disease. In our focused therapeutic areas, our revolutionary technology, Simoa®, is helping researchers advance the science of precision health. Simoa® is changing the way in which the biology of health and disease is studied by giving researchers the ability to closely examine critical biomarkers in most therapeutic areas including neurology, infectious disease, oncology, inflammation, and cardiology. To continue our extraordinary growth, we are hiring a Data Analyst, located in Billerica, MA.
In this critical role this individual will facilitate data management and hygiene, aid scientists subject matter experts (SME) and leadership with development and deployment of new data capture, analysis and reporting systems and dashboards. Success in this role will be dependent on ability to engage with multiple stakeholders, understand the business requirements and turn these requirements into insightful and easy-to-understand visualizations that provide performance insights and key operation metrics to support business decisions.
Key Responsibilities

Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format
Interpret data, analyze, and predict results using statistical techniques
Develop strong understanding of the data and business drivers to make recommendations regarding strategic decisions
Create and manage dashboards, reports, and scorecards in company BI delivery solution for the broader organization
Communicate findings and insights to key stakeholders and help these teams to take action based on your recommendations and the assistance of SMEs
Recommending improvements to existing processes and procedures based on company’s requirements.
Deliver scalable solutions designed with the user experience in mind; provide general training, Q&A and troubleshooting for audiences

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree with emphasis in statistics, informatics, business analytics, or a closely related field.
Basic knowledge regarding immunoassays is strongly encouraged.
Experience using one or more of the following tools: VBA, python, R, SAS, JMP, SPSS, Minitab or other analytical tools to perform data analysis.
Experience in development and implementation of databases/ data collection systems.
Proficiency in building reports and dashboards in BI solutions such as PowerBI, Salesforce Einstein analytics, Tableau, Qlik, or Birst
Familiarity with Microsoft Suite
Must be a fast learner with high attention to detail and possess a passion for data, data quality & process improvement
Excellent technical writing and oral communication, organization and record keeping skills are desired.

Why You’ll Like Working For Us
Our Technology: Quanterix’ technology is designed to enable much earlier disease detection, better prognoses and enhanced treatment methods to improve the quality of life and longevity of the population for generations to come. The technology is currently being used for research applications in several therapeutic areas. The company was established in 2007 and is in Billerica, Massachusetts. For additional Information, please visit https://www.quanterix.com .
Our Commitment To Employees: We have a free, state-of-the-art onsite fitness center for all employees. To keep you fueled up, we provide onsite employees free bagels every Monday morning, and free snacks and drinks every day! Quanterix hosts Virtual Bingo nights with all employees when we can see families, pets, and win amazing prizes. Unwind on Tuesdays and Thursdays with a virtual yoga session. In addition to competitive compensation and a 401k plan with an employer match, we offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents. We offer a Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Life, Disability, and Accidental Death & Dismemberment Insurances, and Mental Health Care, we offer generous Maternity & Paternity leave, Family Medical Leave, Fertility Assistance, Dependent Care, Military Leave and Vacation Carryover. All employees are awarded Equity, an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, a Performance Bonus, and 1:1 Financial Counseling/Planning. We also offer Tuition Assistance.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
Data Analyst I - ( 23000064 )




Description




Agency Overview:




The Department of Revenue's core mission is to collect the revenues required to support the business of the Commonwealth, to make a difference in the lives of children by enforcing the financial responsibilities of parenthood, and to assist Massachusetts cities and towns in sound and efficient fiscal management. Our vision is to conduct our operations in a manner that inspires public confidence in government by administering and enforcing tax, child support and municipal finance laws in ways that are innovative, customer-focused and transparent.




Vision Statement




Our vision is to conduct our operations in a manner that inspires public confidence in government by administering and enforcing tax, child support and municipal finance laws in ways that are innovative, customer-focused and transparent.




Tax




The Tax Administration Division is responsible for fostering voluntary compliance and narrowing the tax gap by identifying, educating, and auditing noncompliant taxpayers. The Tax Administration Division audits the tax returns of businesses and individuals filed, including sales/use, meals, room’s occupancy and special fuels are subject to examination by the Tax Administration Division staff.




Duty Statement




The Massachusetts Department of Revenue Tax Division Data Analytics team is seeking to hire a Programmer/Developer who will be assisting with the new application development and enhancing the current applications to meet agency needs. The person will be responsible for helping to drive key big data-based initiatives that will generate significant benefits throughout the audit division. The Programmer/Developer will be responsible in reviewing and completing requests in the enhancement of the new and the existing applications/reports and assisting with the development and supporting any other agency applications/reports. The Programmer/Developer will also perform unit testing by preparing test data, conducting test runs, and reviewing input and output data.




Duties




Evaluate requests, gather business requirements, and creatively develop solutions, generating accurate queries and outputs to satisfy business requirements and needs. Write comprehensive reports explaining results of queries and outputs. Produce standard and ad hoc reports using SQL, PLSQL, other tools and data sources. Produce business rules and other project documentation based on DOR standards. Conduct advanced data mining, statistical analysis and research activities. Manage a dynamic workload of development, testing and research tasks, ensuring key deadlines are met. Design and develop utility programs to automate manual operations, when needed. Conduct data matches for the purpose of improving collections, enforcement, and data reliability. Identify all audit and external source data files and variables needed to produce specific output requirements utilizing both data extracts and Data Warehouse.




Qualifications




Proficient with SQL/PL SQL.




Experience in SQL Server 2012 and up.




Proficient with at least one computer programming language such as JAVA, C#, .Net, Python, XML, etc.




Knowledge of Microsoft applications including Excel, Teams and Word.




Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.




Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot the existing applications.




Experience in business intelligence analysis and design




Experience with predictive collections models and a risked based scoring process to forecast behavior, to better understand our customers, and to determine what metrics are critical to the organization.




Experience in the integration of business intelligence data into the daily operations of the organization to prioritize actions that will result in the greatest return.




Ability to design programs to gather and manipulate appropriate data to accommodate requests for reports and/or analysis, and then translate that analysis into management reports.




Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing; and handle confidential assignments.




Ability to work independently/ with minimal supervision, handle multiple tasks simultaneously and adapt quickly to changes.




Perform unit testing by preparing test data, conducting test runs, and reviewing input and output data.




Preferred Qualifications




Well versed with Microsoft Excel and other office applications.




Knowledge of R/R-Studio or Python.




Experience working with Jira and AWS.




Experience working with Tableau.




Expert knowledge of SQL/PL SQL programming.




Experience in design and developing of applications using .Net




Good knowledge of MA and IRS tax laws, policies and procedures.




As part of the Future of Work initiative, the agency is adopting a hybrid work model.Hybrid work is a mix of in-office work and telework. The position will work remotely some days and in-person on other days .




An external candidate recommended for a position with the Department of Revenue will be subject to a background check that includes checks for: state and federal tax compliance; child support compliance; education verification; Massachusetts CORI checks; criminal background checks in state(s) of current and previous residence/employment; validation of eligibility to work in the United States; and national fingerprint-based criminal background checks.




Qualifications




First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.




Minimum Entrance Requirements




Applicants must have (A) at least two years of full-time or equivalent part-time professional or technical experience performing related duties that include business data recovery, analysis, query design, reporting and statistical analysis; or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below




Substitutions




I. A Bachelor’s degree or higher with a major in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or a related field may be substituted for the required experience




Comprehensive Benefits




When you embark on a career with the Commonwealth, you are offered an outstanding suite of employee benefits that add to the overall value of your compensation package. We take pride in providing a work experience that supports you, your loved ones, and your future.




Want the specifics? Explore our Employee Benefits and Rewards!




Executive Order #595: As a condition of employment, successful applicants will be required to have received COVID-19 vaccination or an approved exemption as of their start date. Details relating to demonstrating compliance with this requirement will be provided to applicants selected for employment. Applicants who receive an offer of employment who can provide documentation that the vaccine is medically contraindicated or who object to vaccination due to a sincerely held religious belief may make a request for exemption.




An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.




The Commonwealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Research suggests that qualified women, Black, Indigenous, and Persons of Color (BIPOC) may self-select out of opportunities if they don't meet 100% of the job requirements. We encourage individuals who believe they have the skills necessary to thrive to apply for this role.




Official Title : Data Analyst I




Primary Location : United States-Massachusetts-Chelsea-200 Arlington Street




Job : Information Systems and Technology




Agency : Department of Revenue




Schedule : Full-time




Shift : Day




Job Posting : Jan 9, 2023, 10:39:50 PM




Number of Openings : 4

Write comprehensive reports explaining results of queries and outputs. Produce standard and ad hoc reports using SQL, PLSQL, other tools and data sources. Produce business rules and other project documentation based on DOR standards. Conduct advanced data mining, statistical analysis and research activities. Manage a dynamic workload of development, testing and research tasks, ensuring key deadlines are met. Design and develop utility programs to automate manual operations, when needed. Conduct data matches for the purpose of improving collections, enforcement, and data reliability. Identify all audit and external source data files and variables needed to produce specific output requirements utilizing both data extracts and Data Warehouse.


Qualifications


Proficient with SQL/PL SQL.


Experience in SQL Server 2012 and up.


Proficient with at least one computer programming language such as JAVA, C#, .Net, Python, XML, etc.


Knowledge of Microsoft applications including Excel, Teams and Word.


Strong analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.


Develop, maintain, and troubleshoot the existing applications.


Experience in business intelligence analysis and design


Experience with predictive collections models and a risked based scoring process to forecast behavior, to better understand our customers, and to determine what metrics are critical to the organization.


Experience in the integration of business intelligence data into the daily operations of the organization to prioritize actions that will result in the greatest return.


Ability to design programs to gather and manipulate appropriate data to accommodate requests for reports and/or analysis, and then translate that analysis into management reports.


Ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing; and handle confidential assignments.


Ability to work independently/ with minimal supervision, handle multiple tasks simultaneously and adapt quickly to changes.


Perform unit testing by preparing test data, conducting test runs, and reviewing input and output data.


Preferred Qualifications


Well versed with Microsoft Excel and other office applications.


Knowledge of R/R-Studio or Python.


Experience working with Jira and AWS.


Experience working with Tableau.


Expert knowledge of SQL/PL SQL programming.


Experience in design and developing of applications using .Net


Good knowledge of MA and IRS tax laws, policies and procedures.


As part of the Future of Work initiative, the agency is adopting a hybrid work model.Hybrid work is a mix of in-office work and telework. The position will work remotely some days and in-person on other days .


An external candidate recommended for a position with the Department of Revenue will be subject to a background check that includes checks for: state and federal tax compliance; child support compliance; education verification; Massachusetts CORI checks; criminal background checks in state(s) of current and previous residence/employment; validation of eligibility to work in the United States; and national fingerprint-based criminal background checks.


Qualifications


First consideration will be given to those applicants that apply within the first 14 days.


Minimum Entrance Requirements


Applicants must have (A) at least two years of full-time or equivalent part-time professional or technical experience performing related duties that include business data recovery, analysis, query design, reporting and statistical analysis; or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and the substitutions below


Substitutions


I. A Bachelor’s degree or higher with a major in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or a related field may be substituted for the required experience


Comprehensive Benefits


When you embark on a career with the Commonwealth, you are offered an outstanding suite of employee benefits that add to the overall value of your compensation package. We take pride in providing a work experience that supports you, your loved ones, and your future.


Want the specifics? Explore our Employee Benefits and Rewards!


Executive Order #595: As a condition of employment, successful applicants will be required to have received COVID-19 vaccination or an approved exemption as of their start date. Details relating to demonstrating compliance with this requirement will be provided to applicants selected for employment. Applicants who receive an offer of employment who can provide documentation that the vaccine is medically contraindicated or who object to vaccination due to a sincerely held religious belief may make a request for exemption.


An Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. Females, minorities, veterans, and persons with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply.


The Commonwealth is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law. Research suggests that qualified women, Black, Indigenous, and Persons of Color (BIPOC) may self-select out of opportunities if they don't meet 100% of the job requirements. We encourage individuals who believe they have the skills necessary to thrive to apply for this role.

Title: Risk & Data Analyst
Description:
Risk & Data Analyst

A large full-service bank managing billions in assets is adding a Risk and Data Analysis to its office in the Greater Boston area. The individual filling this role will analyze client portfolio data to provide actionable advice to aid management’s decision-making process. Focusing on Small Business, Commercial, and Residential Lending portfolios, this Risk and Data Analyst will create reports, gather portfolio data, and provide insights into trends and potential issues.

Benefits:

Medical, Dental, and Life Insurance
Paid Time Off
Annual profit sharing and 401k match
Work/life balance
Commuter benefits, including shuttle from Boston and subsidized MBTA passes
Education reimbursement, tuition discounts, and corporate discounts at select partners

Responsibilities:

Handle risk management reports for credit portfolios, identifying and measuring risk through data gathering and analysis
Ensure that reports are streamlined and efficient through collaboration with various teams
Analyze bank projects and create risk reports as requested
Aid with ad hoc projects for various business initiatives within the organization




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business
Prior banking experience required
Strong analytical skills with 2 to 5 years of applicable underwriting, lending, credit, and/or treasury experience
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office and Tableau/SQL (or similar software) with the ability to learn new software quickly
Strong attention to detail, organization, problem-solving, judgement, and collaboration skills







Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

The Hollister Group is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage applications from people who are under-represented in their respective occupation or position.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Job Location: Boston, MA

Job Duration: 3-6 Months + High Possibility of Extension

Job Description

Duties:

Engage with various teams to understand data uses and associated integration requirements.
Understand governance and adopter APIs, and how those support data lineage and veracity.
Review object model, metadata, for data sourcing and governance, creating integration patterns.
Work with data partners to gain required governance insights and data catalogue requirements.
Provide subject matter expertise on the integration needs for project deliveries, scope, acceptance, installation, and deployment.
Design and develop dashboards and reports to visualize analysis results using BI tools for internal governance team use.
Contribute to the design, development, and completion of project deliverables.
Hands-on experience with application integration and associated issue root cause analysis and remediation processes.

Skills:

• Proficient in application integration and integration patterns

• Excellent verbal and written communications, high attention to detail.

• Candidate should be able to troubleshoot problem areas and identify gaps and issues.

• Ability to adapt to fast changing environment.

• Familiarity with database modeling and schema design

• Experience understanding API integration processes.

• Strong organizational skills and ability to effectively prioritize multiple tasks.

• Presentation skills in demonstrating system design and integration analysis solutions.

• Familiar with agile project delivery process.

• Familiarity with CI/CD API integration and data pipeline automation




Education:

• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent.

• 4+ years of professional data analysis working with business data initiatives.

• Hands-on expertise with SQL for use in data access, discovery, and analysis.

• Hands-on expertise with Data Warehousing solutions

• Hands-on experience with scripting languages such as ReatJS, NodeJS, and Python

• Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools such as Git, Jenkins and code build

• Hands-on experience creating API mapping documents and specifications

• Hands-on experience with various cloud-based database technologies (Vertica, Redshift, Postgres, etc.)

• Experience in data governance a plus.

Title: Data Analyst #30653
Description:
JOHNLEONARD is seeking a committed and passionate Data Analyst #30653 to join a progressive company in Boston. This full-time data analysis role offers an excellent salary of $60K-$70K and fantastic benefits.




As a skilled Data Analyst, you will play a central role in supporting and enhancing the company's delivery capabilities by ensuring the consistency and availability of high-quality information to their delivery teams. You will also be responsible for assisting in the integrity of their information assets across the entire lifecycle, including data collection, organization, cleansing, analysis, and reporting.




In your first few weeks in this Data Analyst role, you can expect to:

Implement SOPs for the collection, management, and analysis of information assets
Ensure work is carried out per applicable SOPs and working practices
Ensure operational excellence in collaboration with delivery teams for the application of standards, data acquisition, proactive data review and query management, data cleaning, data access, and metrics reporting
Assist in developing ad-hoc graphs, tables, charts, and reports as necessary
Contribute to the company's blog, podcasts, and webinars




To apply for this data analysis job, you must be a recent graduate with excellent technical skills or a business analytics degree. You will also require a minimum of one year of relevant data/information management experience, data migration, and data warehouse experience are desired. In addition, you must have experience in one or more of the following:

Data migration, data governance, and data quality
Data warehouse management
Knowledge management and document management
Basic knowledge of SQL, relational datasets, and relevant toolsets, such as Access




As a vital member of the team and in return for your expertise, inclusive approach, and commitment, our client will provide a generous salary of $60K-$70K and fantastic benefits, including company-sponsored health and dental insurance, flexible spending accounts, holiday and PTO, 401K, hybrid/remote work options, and more!




If this full-time, remote Data Analyst job in Boston motivates and inspires you, please get in touch with JOHNLEONARD today.




Founded in 1969, JOHNLEONARD, a woman-owned business, is the premier staffing choice in Boston and beyond. We provide Temporary/Contract, Direct Hire, Temp to Hire, and Payroll services as part of our comprehensive service offerings. We connect talent with opportunity, building relationships across the community to create better futures for all. In doing so, we live by our mantra; Actions Speak Louder Than Words™.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bain Capital, LP is one of the world’s leading private multi-asset alternative investment firms with approximately $160 billion of assets under management. The firm seeks to create lasting impact for our investors, our employees, and the communities in which we live. Since our founding in 1984, we’ve applied our insight and experience to a broad array of asset classes including private equity, venture capital, public equity, credit, and real estate.




BAIN CAPITAL PARTNERSHIP STRATEGIES




Bain Capital Partnership Strategies was formed in 2005, initially to find investments for the personal capital of Bain Capital’s partners. Our 18 person, Boston-based team combines rigorous fundamental research, deep experience across asset classes, and a global perspective to make unique investments that are not commonly available. We utilize our long-term time horizon, flexible capital, and patient investment philosophy to make proprietary investments sourced “off market.” Bain Capital Partnership Strategies has historically been funded by the Bain Capital partners, but in 2018 we began accepting capital from external investors.




POSITION DESCRIPTION:




The Partnership Strategies’ data and engineering team is growing, and we are looking for a motivated and well-rounded full-stack developer to join our team. This position will have responsibility for technical design, implementation, support, and maintenance of strategic technology assets that are critical to the business’ success. This position will support a range of investment strategies that rely on our ability to rapidly source and analyze data.




This role is an opportunity to work closely with, and learn from, seasoned investors that have decades of experience investing globally. Projects are run in small pods with cross functional expertise comprising of portfolio manager(s), quants & research analysts, and engineers/developers working closely together. This is a dynamic and fast-moving team that has a flexible mandate to invest in a broad variety of markets including commodities, public equities, fixed income, environmental markets, and cryptocurrencies.




The candidate will be responsible for sourcing, processing, analyzing, and presenting both structured and unstructured data in a manner that is consumable by the investment teams. The candidate will also develop self-service BI dashboards and reports in partnership with the investment team. The candidate will work on SQL/NoSQL cloud data stores, data ingestion pipelines, business intelligence tools, and web-scraping technologies to develop strategic systems and tactical tools to enable the investment team’s decision-making processes.




TECHNOLOGY EXPERIENCE:




Experience programming with Python, SQL
Experience programming with C# and/or R is a plus
Experience with cloud platforms is required (in one or more of platforms such Snowflake, AWS or Azure)
Hands-on experience with reporting technologies & data visualization tools such as Plotly Dash, Tableau or Power BI
Experience with relational and/or non-relational databases
Experience building or maintaining data pipelines and transformations
Knowledge of software development lifecycle
Experience with and understanding of source control (Git) and CI/CD processes
Proficient with current web scraping technologies
Familiarity with Kimball / Star schema data warehousing design is a plus
Experience with Pandas, numpy, Airflow, dbt, and Docker is a plus




QUALIFICATIONS:




BS or MS degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical training and professional work experience
A demonstrated experience or interest in Finance, Economics, and/or Accounting is a plus
2-5 years of professional experience developing software applications
Prior experience with a hedge fund or financial services is a plus
Strong analytical and technical problem-solving skills
An interest in emerging technologies and a proven record of ability to pick up new technology platforms and programming languages
Must possess excellent communication skills; ability to articulate technology concepts to non-technical stakeholders and ability to translate business needs and desired goals into technical requirements
Takes ownership and pride in end-to-end delivery of projects and initiatives; willingness to take on any task, no matter how big or small
Reliable and collaborative team member
Self-starter with ability to work independently




Bain Capital is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.
